name: Standard
description: ConsentAcknowledgment and Consent. The [PARTY C] hereby acknowledges and consents to the foregoing assignment and assumption listed in the [ASSIGNMENT OF ASSETS] and [ASSUMPTION OF LIABILITIES] clauses of this agreement.Release and Discharge. The [PARTY C] hereby releases and discharges the [PARTY B] from its obligations arising under or in connection with the [Loan Agreement].

name: Abandonment
description: Abandonment. If [PARTY B] does not occupy the Premise for [14] consecutive days [PARTY A] may deem that [PARTY B] abandoned the Premise, unless [PARTY A] gave written consent to that period of non-occupancy.

name: Abatement of Rent
description: Abatement of Rent. In the event of Premises Partial Damage or Premises Total Destruction for which Tenant is not responsible under this Lease, the Rent payable by Tenant for the period required for the repair, remediation or restoration of such damage shall be abated in proportion to the degree to which Tenant's use of the Premises is impaired, but not to exceed the proceeds received from insurance.

name: [PARTY A] — Standard
description: Conduct in Ordinary Course and Absence of Certain Changes. Except as listed in [PARTY A]'s Disclosure Schedule, from [MONTH, YEAR] through the Effective Date,except for the negotiation, execution, and delivery of this agreement, [PARTY A], and its Subsidiaries, has conducted [PARTY A]'s business in the ordinary course of business consistent with past practice in all material respects,there has not been any event, development, or state of circumstances that would have, or would reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on [PARTY A], andexcept as would not have, and would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on [PARTY A], [PARTY A] has not, and none of its Subsidiaries have, suffered any loss, damage, destruction, or other casualty affecting any of its properties or assets, whether or not covered by insurance.

name: [PARTY A] — Concise
description: CompareAbsence of Certain Changes. Except as listed in [PARTY A]'s Disclosure Schedule, since [MONTH, YEAR] [PARTY A] hasoperated its business, in all material respects, in the ordinary course of business consistent with past practice, andnot suffered a Material Adverse Effect.

name: [PARTY B] — Concise
description: CompareAbsence of Certain Changes. Except as listed in [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule, since [MONTH, YEAR], [PARTY B] hasoperated its business, in all material respects, in the ordinary course of business consistent with past practice, andnot suffered a Material Adverse Effect.

name: Standard — Limited inspection time; No special rights.
description: AcceptanceAcceptance of Delivery. [PARTY B] will have [INSPECTION PERIOD] Business Days to inspect and evaluate the [DELIVERABLE] on the delivery date before notifying [PARTY A] that it is either accepting or rejecting the [DELIVERABLE]. Acceptance Criteria. The "Acceptance Criteria" are the specifications the [DELIVERABLES] must meet for [PARTY A] to comply with its requirements and obligations under this agreement, detailed in [ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement.

name: Extra inspection time; Heavy rejection rights, including adjustment fees.
description: CompareAcceptanceAcceptance of Delivery. If in [PARTY B]'s opinion, [PARTY A]'s corrections fail to satisfy the Acceptance Criteria [NUMBER OF FAILURES ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA] times, [PARTY B] may eitherterminate this agreement, oradjust the Acceptance Criteria, and require [PARTY A] to pay the Adjustment Fee.Adjustment Fee. "Adjustment Fee" means $[ADJUSTMENT FEE].Liquidated Damages Statement. name: Standard
description: Acceptance and RejectionInspection Period. [PARTY B] will have [INSPECTION PERIOD] Business Days after [PARTY A] delivers the [DELIVERABLE] to inspect and test the [DELIVERABLE] to ensure it meets the Acceptance Criteria (the "Inspection Period").Acceptance. If in [PARTY B]'s opinion the [DELIVERABLE] meets the Acceptance Criteria, [PARTY B] will accept the [DELIVERABLE] and notify [PARTY A] that it is accepting the [DELIVERABLE].Deemed Acceptance. [PARTY B] will be deemed to have accepted the [DELIVERABLE] if[PARTY B] fails to notify [PARTY A] on or before the expiration of the Inspection Period, orif during the Inspection Period, [PARTY B] sells or attempts to sell, runs, or otherwise uses the [DELIVERABLE] beyond what is necessary for inspection and testing and in a way a reasonable person would consider consistent with [PARTY B] having accepting ownership of the [DELIVERABLE] from [PARTY A].Rejection. name: Reseller Agreement
description: CompareAcceptance and Rejection of Product DeliveriesInspection Period. [PARTY B] will have [INSPECTION PERIOD] Business Days after [PARTY A] delivers an order of Products to inspect and test the Products for defects and to ensure the order meets the specifications of the applicable Purchase Order (the "Inspection Period").Acceptance. If in [PARTY B]'s opinion the Products satisfy the specifications of the applicable Purchase Order, [PARTY B] will accept the Products and notify [PARTY A] that it is accepting them.Deemed Acceptance. [PARTY B] will be deemed to have accepted Products if[PARTY B] fails to notify [PARTY A] on or before the expiration of the Inspection Period, orif during the Inspection Period, [PARTY B] sells or attempts to sell, runs, or otherwise uses the Products beyond what is necessary for inspection and testing, and in a way a reasonable Person would consider consistent with [PARTY B] having accepting the delivery from [PARTY A].Rejection and Cure. If in [PARTY B]'s opinion, a delivery of Products fails to meet the specifications of the applicable Purchase Order,[PARTY B] shall deliver to [PARTY A] a written list detailing each failure, and[PARTY A] shall promptly deliver to [PARTY B] any Products necessary to remedy each failure, at no expense to [PARTY B].

name: Real Property Lease
description: Acceptance of PremiseInspection. [PARTY A] shall deliver possession of the Premise to [PARTY B] on [the Effective Date / [DATE]].As-Is Condition. [Subject to any other obligations of [PARTY A] under this agreement to make any improvements or repairs, to correct any defects, or provide maintenance services, ][PARTY B] accepts the Premise "As Is" and with all faults[ (other than latent defects)].

name: Pro-Landlord

name: Acceptance of Terms of Service
description: Acceptance of Terms of Service. This is an agreement between [COMPANY NAME] ("Company"), the owner and operator of [WEBSITE URL] (the "Site"), and you ("you" or "You"), a user of the Site. By using the Site you acknowledge and agree to these Terms of Service and also the Privacy Policy, which can be found at [PRIVACY POLICY URL] and is incorporated by reference. If you choose to not agree with any of these terms, you may not use the Site.

name: Acceptance w/ COPPA Provisions
description: CompareAcceptance of Terms of Service. This is an agreement between [COMPANY NAME], ("Company"), the owner and operator of [WEBSITE URL] (the "Site"), and you ("you" or "You"), a user of the Site. By using the Site you acknowledge and agree to this Terms of Service, and the Privacy Policy, which can be found at [PRIVACY POLICY URL], and which is incorporated by reference. If you choose to not agree with any of these terms, you may not use the Site.The Site is offered and available to users who 13 years of age or older. By using this Site, you represent and warrant that you meet all of the foregoing eligibility requirements. If you do not meet all of these requirements, you must not access or use the Site.

name: Access To Data
description: Access to Data. Discloser shall limit access to Data to those staff members with a well-defined business need.

name: Pro-Discloser
description: CompareAccess to DataMethod of Access and Transfer. Data will be obtained in the following manner:[DESCRIBE METHOD OF ACCESS]Persons Having Access to Data. All persons who will have access to data must complete a data privacy training through [TRAINING PROGRAM]. Prior to the transfer of any data, staff members who will have access to the data shall sign the Non-Disclosure Agreement (Appendix A) and deliver signed copies to [DISCLOSER CONTACT].Frequency of Data Exchange. Data will be exchanged as needed to meet reporting requirements as well as on an ongoing basis between Discloser and Recipient staff for the entire length of the project.[Criminal Background Checks. Recipient shall certify that all staff members with access to Data have been subjected to a bone fide criminal background check and have no record of any felony convictions. Any exceptions to this requirement must be approved in writing by Discloser.]

name: Data Processing: third-party access
description: Compare Third Party Requests for Access to DataNon-Governmental Requests. Provider will not disclose Customer Personal Data to any third party, unless authorized by the Customer or required by law.Governmental Requests. If a government or Supervisory Authority demands access to Client Personal Data, IBM will notify Client prior to disclosure, unless prohibited by law.

name: Standard
description: Access to Information[PARTY A]'s Access. On reasonable notice to the [PARTY B], the [PARTY A] may[, during normal business hours] prior to the Effective Time, have reasonable access to the [PARTY B]'s, its Subsidiaries', and Affiliates':properties, facilities, operations, and Books and Records[, and those of the Business]; andofficers, employees, attorneys, independent accountants, and other agents, to discuss the business, condition (financial or otherwise) or prospects of the [PARTY B] [in furtherance of the Transaction] Minimal Interference. The [PARTY A] shall use reasonable efforts to minimize any interference with the [PARTY B] [and Businesses'] regular operations during any such access.[PARTY B]'s Cooperation. The [PARTY B] shall cooperate with the [PARTY A] in the [PARTY A]'s reasonable requests for access.

name: Accessibility of Website During Construction
description: Accessibility of Website During Construction. During the construction and testing of the Website, Customer's website shall remain accessible to end users.

name: Accessing and Correcting Information
description: Accessing and Correcting User InformationOpportunity to Correct Contact Information and Preferences. [PARTY A] shall provide Users with the opportunity to ensure that contact information and preferences are accurate, complete, and up to date, through each User's account, accessible from [WEBSITE LOGIN URL].Opportunity to Request Corrections and Deletions. Subject to paragraph [DISCRETION OVER CORRECTIONS AND DELETIONS], [PARTY A] shall provide Users with the opportunity to request that [PARTY A]correct inaccurate Personally Identifiable Information [PARTY A] holds, anddelete Information [PARTY A] is not required to retain by Law or for legitimate business purposes.Discretion Over Corrections and Deletions. [PARTY A] will have the sole discretion to adhere to or decline User requests to correct or delete Information that are frivolous or vexatious, jeopardize the privacy of others, are extremely impractical, or not otherwise required by Law.

name: Account
description: AccountsSeparate Participant Accounts. The Committee shall maintain a separate account for each Participant, in the Participant's name (each one a "Participant Account," or to specify the account of a specific Participant, "Participant's Account").Amounts Credited to Account. On the last day of each calendar year, [PARTY A] shall credit each Participant Account with an amount equal to 10% of the Base Salary paid to the relevant Participant during that calendar year.Account Earnings. At the end of each calendar quarter, [PARTY A] shall credit each Participant Account with the earnings on the Participant Account, compounded quarterly.

name: Account Security
description: Account Security. The Company cares about the integrity and security of your personal information. However, the Company cannot guarantee that unauthorized third parties will never be able to defeat the Site's security measures or use any personal information you provide to us for improper purposes. You acknowledge that you provide your personal information at your own risk.

name: Accounts and Records
description: Accounts and RecordsMaintenance of Records. Licensee shall maintain accurate account books and records showing the manufacture and sale or other distribution of Licensed Products for a period of at least [MAINTENANCE PERIOD] after the payment of the corresponding royalty.Access to Records. All books and records shall be available for inspection and examination by Licensor or a duly authorized representative, upon [AUDIT NOTICE PERIOD], during normal business hours.Under/Over Payments. In the event an audit shows a deficiency to be due, Licensee shall promptly pay the amount of the deficiency to Licensor. If the audit shows that an excess was paid, Licensor shall be entitled to deduct the amount of such excess from the payment due for the next calendar quarter or pay the amount to Licensee without undue delay, at Licensor's discretion.Late Payments. Amounts that are not paid when due will accrue interest from the due date until paid, at a rate equal to [INTEREST RATE] per month or the maximum allowed by law, if less.

name: Delivery of Records
description: CompareReports and Records. To the extent that Licensor or its members do not have access to the underlying information, Licensee shall, upon Licensor's written request, furnish Licensor with [semiannual / annual] reports of all sales of all products subject to this Agreement and of all sublicensing agreements hereunder. Licensor shall have the right to inspect the books and records of Licensee relating to sales of all products subject to this agreement and to all sublicensing agreements hereunder.

name: test alternative
description: Compare thats is a testing alternativeExample Notes test

name: [PARTY A]
description: Accounts ReceivableDisclosure of Accounts Receivable. [PARTY A]'s Financial Statements correctly list all Accounts Receivable, along with an aging report of these accounts.Status of Accounts Receivable. [PARTY A]'s Accounts Receivablearose from bona fide sales of goods and services in the ordinary course of business,are carried at values determined according to GAAP consistently applied,constitute undisputed claims of [PARTY A], not subject to claims of set-off, other defenses, or counterclaims, other than normal cash discounts accrued in the ordinary course of business consistent with past practice,subject to the reserve for bad debts reflected on the interim Balance Sheet, are collectible in full within 90 days after billing, andare free from any Encumbrance.Certain Accounts Receivable Not Included. Accounts Receivable arising from unclaimed property and unasserted legal claims are not reflected on [PARTY A]'s Balance Sheet.

name: [PARTY B]
description: CompareAccounts ReceivableDisclosure of Accounts Receivable. [PARTY B]'s Financial Statements correctly list all Accounts Receivable, along with an aging report of these accounts.Status of Accounts Receivable. [PARTY B]'s Accounts Receivablearose from bona fide sales of goods and services in the ordinary course of business,are carried at values determined according to GAAP consistently applied,constitute undisputed claims of [PARTY B], not subject to claims of set-off, other defenses, or counterclaims, other than normal cash discounts accrued in the ordinary course of business consistent with past practice,subject to the reserve for bad debts reflected on the interim Balance Sheet, are collectible in full within 90 days after billing, andare free from any Encumbrance.Certain Accounts Receivable Not Included. Accounts Receivable arising from unclaimed property and unasserted legal claims are not reflected on [PARTY B]'s Balance Sheet.

name: Standard
description: Accuracy of Confidential Information and Release from LiabilityNo Guarantee of Accuracy. Neither party makes any representation or warranty, express or implied, as to the accuracy or completeness of the Confidential Information it discloses.Release from Liability. The parties hereby release one another, and one another's Representatives and Affiliates, from any liability arising out of the use of any Confidential Information, or any inaccuracies, omissions, or errors in the Confidential Information.Effect on the Transaction. The representations and releases made under this clause will have not effect or apply to the finalized Transaction, if such Transaction is finalized, or any representations or warranties, or any information disclosed in the Transaction.

name: [PARTY A]
description: Information SuppliedAccuracy of Information. None of the information [PARTY A] has supplied or will supply under this agreement contains or willcontain any untrue statement of a material fact, or omit to state a material fact required to ensure the statements made, in light of the circumstances in which [PARTY A] made them, are not misleading.Information Sent to Third-Parties. [PARTY A] makes no representation in connection with the truthfulness or non-misleading nature of statements it made or incorporated by reference into any materials it sends to any Governmental Authority or other third-party under this agreement, when it based the statements on information supplied by [PARTY B] under this agreement.Compliance of Information with Applicable Law. The information [PARTY A] has supplied or will supply under this agreement will comply in all material respects with any applicable Law.

name: [PARTY B]
description: CompareInformation SuppliedAccuracy of Information. None of the information [PARTY B] has supplied or will supply under this agreement contains or willcontain any untrue statement of a material fact, or omit to state a material fact required to ensure the statements made, in light of the circumstances in which [PARTY B] made them, are not misleading.Information Sent to Third-Parties. [PARTY B] makes no representation in connection with the truthfulness or non-misleading nature of statements it made or incorporated by reference into any materials it sends to any Governmental Authority or other third-party under this agreement, when it based the statements on information supplied by [PARTY A] under this agreement.Compliance of Information with Applicable Law. The information [PARTY B] has supplied or will supply under this agreement will comply in all material respects with any applicable Law.

name: [PARTY A] — With Acknowledgment of Reliance
description: CompareInformation SuppliedAccuracy of Information. None of the information [PARTY A] has supplied or will supply under this agreement contains or willcontain any untrue statement of a material fact, or omit to state a material fact required to ensure the statements made, in light of the circumstances in which [PARTY A] made them, are not misleading.Information Sent to Third-Parties. [PARTY A] makes no representation in connection with the truthfulness or non-misleading nature of statements it made or incorporated by reference into any materials it sends to any Governmental Authority or other third-party under this agreement, when it based the statements on information supplied by [PARTY B] under this agreement.Acknowledgment of Reliance on Information. [PARTY A] acknowledges that [PARTY B]will use and rely upon the accuracy and completeness of all information [PARTY A] provides without independently investigating or verifying same,has not been retained to independently verify any such information,assumes no responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, or adequacy for any purpose of such information [PARTY A] provides or any other information regarding [PARTY A], andwill not make any appraisal of any of [PARTY A]'s assets.Compliance of Information with Applicable Law. The information [PARTY A] has supplied or will supply under this agreement will comply in all material respects with any applicable Law.

name: [PARTY B] — With Acknowledgment of Reliance
description: CompareInformation SuppliedAccuracy of Information. None of the information [PARTY B] has supplied or will supply under this agreement contains or willcontain any untrue statement of a material fact, or omit to state a material fact required to ensure the statements made, in light of the circumstances in which [PARTY B] made them, are not misleading.Information Sent to Third-Parties. [PARTY B] makes no representation in connection with the truthfulness or non-misleading nature of statements it made or incorporated by reference into any materials it sends to any Governmental Authority or other third-party under this agreement, when it based the statements on information supplied by [PARTY A] under this agreement.Acknowledgment of Reliance on Information. [PARTY B] acknowledges that [PARTY A]will use and rely upon the accuracy and completeness of all information [PARTY B] provides without independently investigating or verifying same,has not been retained to independently verify any such information,assumes no responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, or adequacy for any purpose of such information [PARTY B] provides or any other information regarding [PARTY B], andwill not make any appraisal of any of [PARTY B]'s assets.Compliance of Information with Applicable Law. The information [PARTY B] has supplied or will supply under this agreement will comply in all material respects with any applicable Law.

name: Acknowledgement of Reasonableness
description: Reasonableness of Restrictions[PARTY B]'s Acknowledgements. [PARTY B] acknowledges that the restrictions contained in this agreement arefair and reasonable in scope and duration,necessary to protect [PARTY A]'s legitimate business interests, anda material inducement to [PARTY A]'s entry into [this agreement / the [UNDERLYING AGREEMENT]].Waiver of Certain Defenses. [PARTY B] irrevocably waives all defenses to [PARTY A]'s strict enforcement of [PARTY B]'s obligations under this agreement.

name: Comprehensive
description: CompareAcknowledgementsExtent of [PARTY]'s Obligations. Except for the terms of section 3.2 (Permitted investments), [PARTY B]'s obligations under this agreement extend to any actions carried out on his or her own behalf or on behalf of or in connection with any other Person, directly or indirectly, in any capacity and in any part of the Restricted Territory.Reasonableness of Restrictions. [PARTY B] acknowledges that the restrictions contained in this agreement are (a) fair and reasonable in scope and duration, (b) necessary to protect the Company's legitimate business interests, and (c) a material inducement to the Company to enter into [this agreement/TRANSACTION AGREEMENT]. Accordingly, [PARTY B] waives all defences to the Company's strict enforcement of [PARTY B]'s obligations under this agreement.Enforcement of Restrictions. If any restriction imposed under this agreement is in any jurisdiction held to be excessively broad, that restriction will be interpreted, in that jurisdiction, by limiting the particular term so as to be enforceable to the extent compatible with the applicable Law in that jurisdiction.

name: Less Stringent
description: Acknowledgement of Securities Laws. Each party is aware, and will advise their respective Representatives who are informed of the matters of this agreement, of the restrictions imposed by the federal and state securities Laws on the purchase or sale of securities by any Person who has received material, non-public information from the issuer of such securities, and on the communication of such information to any other Person when it is reasonably foreseeable the other Person is likely to purchase or sell such securities in reliance on that information.

name: More Stringent
description: CompareSecurities LawsInsider Trading Prohibited. The parties and their Representatives are aware, and they shall use reasonable precautions to ensure that their respective directors, officers, and employees are aware, that United States securities laws prohibit any person who has material, non-public information concerning a company or a possible Transaction involving the parties from purchasing or selling securities of that company, or from communicating such information to any other person when it is reasonably foreseeable that the person is likely to purchase or sell such securities, or otherwise permit another to make an investment decision with such information.Notice of Termination. Each party shall ensure that none of its Representatives who have access to Confidential Information will acquire or dispose of any interest (including any share or option) in the stock or debt of the other party until they have been notified in writing that the business relationship has been terminated and for a period of [90] days after termination.Parties Are Informed. The parties acknowledge that they and their Representatives are familiar with the Exchange Act and the rules and regulations promulgated under the Exchange Act to the extent they relate to the matters referred to in this agreement.No Contravention. The parties shall not use, or permit any third party to use, and they each shall use reasonable efforts to assure that none of their respective Representatives will use or permit any third party to use, any Evaluation Material in contravention of United States securities laws (including the Exchange Act and any rules and regulations promulgated under the Exchange Act).

name: Investment Bank Engagement Letter
description: Acknowledgements. Each party hereby acknowledges that:[PARTY B] is engaged in a wide range of investing, investment banking and other activities (including investment management, corporate finance, securities issuance, trading, research, and brokerage activities) from which conflicting interests or duties, or the appearance of conflicts, may arise;[PARTY B] and its Affiliates have and may continue to have investment banking, broker-dealer, and other relationships with parties other than [PARTY A], under which MDB may acquire information of interest to [PARTY A];[PARTY B] will have no obligation to disclose to [PARTY A] or to use for [PARTY A]'s benefit any such non-public information or other information acquired in the course of engaging in any other transaction (on [PARTY A]'s own account or otherwise) or otherwise carrying on [PARTY B]'s business of MDB;information held elsewhere within [PARTY B] but not accessible (absent a breach of internal procedures) to its investment banking personnel providing services to [PARTY A] will not under any circumstances affect [PARTY B]'s obligations under this agreement;[PARTY B]'s independent research department may publish research reports or other materials, the substance and/or timing of which might conflict with the views or advice of [PARTY B]'s investment banking department and/or which might have an adverse effect on [PARTY A]'s interests in connection with the transactions contemplated under this agreement or otherwise;in [PARTY B]'s ordinary course of business, it may trade the securities of [PARTY A] for its own account and for the accounts of its customers, and might at any time hold a long or short position in such securities, but that [PARTY B] shall comply with federal securities Laws in all respects in connection with such activities;[PARTY B] will act solely as an independent contractor under this agreement, that its responsibility to [PARTY A] is solely contractual in nature, that it does not owe [PARTY A] or any other Person, including [PARTY A]'s shareholders, any fiduciary or similar duty as a result of this agreement;neither [PARTY B] nor any of its controlling Persons, Affiliates, or Representatives will have any liability to [PARTY A] or any Person asserting claims on behalf of or in right of [PARTY A] for any losses, claims, damages, liabilities, or expenses arising out of this agreement, unless it is finally judicially determined that such losses, claims, damages, liabilities, or expenses resulted solely from [PARTY B]'s gross negligence or willful misconduct;[PARTY B] has not provided nor is undertaking to provide any advice to [PARTY A] relating to legal, regulatory, accounting, or tax matters; and[PARTY A] has relied and will continue to rely on the advice of its own legal, tax and accounting advisors in all matters relating to any Contemplated Transaction under this agreement.

name: Mutual
description: Acknowledgement of Terms. Each party acknowledges that theyhave read this agreement,understand the terms of this agreement,have had the opportunity to consult[ and has consulted] with independent legal counsel in connection with this agreement, andhave signed this agreement voluntarily.

name: Pro-providee: acknowledgement of terms
description: CompareAcknowledgement of Contract Terms. Before signing this agreement, the [PARTY B]has been given[ a reasonable opportunity / the opportunity, for no less than [21] days,] to consider its terms,has carefully read and fully understands all its terms,has been advised by the [PARTY A], and has been given ample opportunity, to consult with an attorney of his or her choosing regarding this agreement, andknowingly and voluntarily agrees to all of the terms of this agreement, without any duress, coercion, or undue influence by the [PARTY A], its representatives, or any other Person, and agrees to be legally bound by those terms.

name: Unilateral
description: CompareAcknowledgement of Contract Terms. [PARTY B] acknowledges that ithas read this agreement,understands its terms,has had the opportunity to consult with independent legal counsel, andhas signed this agreement voluntarily.

name: Pro-Provider: Suggested Counsel
description: CompareAdvice of Counsel. [PARTY A] has advised [PARTY B] to review this agreement with an attorney of its choosing before signing this agreement, and [PARTY B] has had a reasonable period of time to do so.

name: Pro-Providee: Acknowledgement of Terms
description: CompareAcknowledgement of Contract Terms. Before signing this agreement, [PARTY B]has been given[ a reasonable opportunity / the opportunity, for no less than [21] days,] to consider its terms,has carefully read and fully understands all its terms,has been advised by [PARTY A], and has been given ample opportunity, to consult with an attorney of his or her choosing regarding this agreement, andknowingly and voluntarily agrees to all of the terms of this agreement, without any duress, coercion, or undue influence by [PARTY A], its representatives, or any other Person, and agrees to be legally bound by those terms.

name: Actions Requiring Approval
description: Actions Requiring Approval. Proxy is not authorized to take any of the following actions without the express written approval of Shareholder:the sale or disposal, in any manner, of capital assets or business of Company where an individual sale or disposition exceeds [25%] of the assets of Company or where sales or dispositions in the aggregate exceeds [45%] of the assets of Company,the pledging, mortgaging or encumbering of the assets of Company for purposes other than obtaining working capital or funds for capital improvements,any merger, consolidation, reorganization or dissolution of Company, orthe filing or making of any petition under the federal bankruptcy laws or any similar law or statute of any state or any foreign country.

name: Actions Upon Approval
description: Action Upon Approval. Upon written request by Shareholder, Proxy shall take such action necessary to recommend, authorize, or approve the actions specified in Section [ ]. Proxy shall consult with Shareholder concerning such action so that the Shareholder may have sufficient information to ensure that all such actions will be taken in accordance with applicable laws. Any action of Proxy with respect to the matters specified in Section [ ] that is taken without the approval of Shareholder shall be void and shall have no effect.

name: Additional Offices
description: Offices. The Corporation may also have offices at such other places as the Board of Directors appoints from time to time appoint.

name: Additional Parties
description: Additional Parties. From and after the date of this Agreement, the Company may grant registration rights under this Agreement to any holder or prospective holder of securities of the Company. Upon signing this Agreement by any such additional party and by the Company, such additional party shall be considered an Investor for all purposes of this Agreement.

name: Master Services Agreement
description: Additional ServicesRequesting Additional Services. [PARTY B] may request Additional Services from [PARTY A] by providing written notice.Amendment to Include Additional Services. If [PARTY A] agrees to provide Additional Servicesthe parties shall amend this agreement and the [SERVICES ATTACHMENT] to include the Additional Services, so thatafter the amendment, all references to Services in this agreement will include such requested and agreed on Additional ServicesAdditional Services Definition. “Additional Services” means services similar in nature but outside the scope of the Services listed in the [SERVICES ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement.

name: Transition Services Agreement
description: Compare Additional ServicesRequesting Additional Services. [PARTY A] may request Additional Transition Services from [PARTY B] by providing written notice.Amendment to Include Additional Services. If [PARTY B] agrees to provide Additional Transition Servicesthe parties shall amend this agreement and the [SERVICES ATTACHMENT] to include the Additional Transitional Services, so thatafter the amendment, all references to Transition Services in this agreement will include such requested and agreed upon Additional Transition ServicesAdditional Services Definition. “Additional Transition Services” means services similar in nature but outside the scope of the Transition Services listed in the [SERVICES ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement.

name: Master Services Agreement
description: CompareAdditional Services. [PARTY B] may request additional services from [PARTY A] according to the procedure for executing additional Statements of Work described in section [STATEMENTS OF WORK].

name: Adjourned Meetings
description: Adjourned Meetings. If less than a quorum is present at a meeting, a majority of the shares so represented may adjourn the meeting from time to time without further notice. At such adjourned meeting at which a quorum is present or represented, any business may be transacted which might have been transacted at the original meeting.

name: Adjournment
description: Adjournment. A majority of the directors present, whether or not constituting a quorum, may adjourn any meeting to another time and place.

name: Standard
description: Purchase Price AdjustmentPayment of Post-Closing Adjustment. A party shall pay any Post-Closing Adjustment it owes under this [POST-CLOSING ADJUSTMENT] subclause:within ten 10 business days of acceptance of the applicable Actual Working Capital Statement and, to the extent there are disputed amounts, disputed amounts within 10 business days of their resolution described below; andby wire transfer of immediately available funds to such account(s) as is directed by the [PARTY A] or the [PARTY B].Post-Closing Adjustment. The post-closing adjustment will be the amount equal to the Actual Working Capital minus the Target Working Capital (the "Post-Closing Adjustment").Surplus Paid to [PARTY B]. If the Post-Closing Adjustment is a positive number, the [PARTY A] shall pay to the [PARTY B] an amount equal to the Post-Closing Adjustment.Deficit Paid to [PARTY A]. If the Post-Closing Adjustment is a negative number, the [PARTY B] shall pay to the [PARTY A] an amount equal to the Post-Closing Adjustment.Review and ObjectionReview Period. After receipt of the Actual Working Capital Statement, the [PARTY B] has 60 days when it may review the Actual Working Capital Statement (the "Review Period").Access to Information. During the Review Period, the [PARTY B] may have reasonable access to:the [PARTY A]'s Books and Records that relate to the Actual Working Capital;the [PARTY A]'s personnel;the [PARTY A]'s work papers, to the extent the papers relate to the Actual Working Capital Statement; andthe [PARTY A]'s historical financial information (to the extent in the [PARTY A]'s possession) that relates to the Actual Working Capital Statement.Objection. Before the end of the Review Period, the [PARTY B] may object to the Actual Working Capital Statement by delivering to the [PARTY A] a written statement setting out the [PARTY B]'s objections in reasonable detail, indicating each disputed item or amount, and the basis for the [PARTY B]'s disagreement.Failure to Object. If the [PARTY B] fails to object before the end of the Review Period, the [PARTY B] will be deemed to have accepted the Actual Working Capital Statement and the Post-Closing Adjustment.Resolving an Objection Negotiate. If the [PARTY B] does object before the end of the Review Period, the parties shall negotiate in good faith to resolve such objections. Independent Review. If the parties fail to resolve such objections within [RESOLUTION PERIOD] days, the parties will submit the dispute to an independent certified public accountant the parties mutually appoint. Binding. The parties shall accept the determination by the independent certified public accountant.Fees of Independent Accountant. The [PARTY B] shall pay the expenses of the Independent Accountant based on the percentage that the amount actually contested but not awarded to the [PARTY B] or [PARTY A], respectively, bears to the aggregate amount actually contested by the [PARTY B] and the [PARTY A], with the [PARTY A] paying any remainder.Interest on Post-Closing Adjustments. Any outstanding Post-Closing Adjustment payment will bear interest from the due date at a rate per annum equal to the lowest applicable federal rate promulgated by the Internal Revenue Service for short-term loans as of the Closing Date. Such interest will be calculated daily on the basis of a 365 day year and the actual number of days elapsed, without compounding.Tax Treatment of Post-Closing Adjustments. The parties will treat any payments made under this subclause as an adjustment to the Purchase Price for Tax purposes, unless otherwise required by Law.Actual Working CapitalPrepare and Deliver. Within 60 days after the Closing Date, the [PARTY A] shall prepare and deliver to the [PARTY B] a statement listing its calculation of actual working capital (the "Actual Working Capital"), which statement will contain an unaudited balance sheet of the Business as of the Closing Date (without giving effect to the transactions contemplated herein) (the "Actual Working Capital Statement").Calculation. The [PARTY A] shall prepare the Actual Working Capital Statement in good faith, and in accordance with the sample calculation in the attached [SCHEDULE].Target Working Capital. "Target Working Capital" means $[TARGET WORKING CAPITAL AMOUNT].

name: Adjustments Upon Changes In Capitalization
description: Adjustments on Changes in Capitalization, Dissolution, Liquidation, Merger, or Asset SaleChanges in CapitalizationAdjustments After Changes in Capitalization. Subject to any required action by [PARTY A] stockholders, the Board shall proportionately adjust the maximum number of shares each Participant may purchase each Offering Period, the price per share, and the number of shares of [PARTY A] common stock covered by each option under this plan which has not yet been exercised to account for any increase or decrease in the number of issued shares of [PARTY A] common stock resulting from a stock split, reverse stock split, stock dividend, combination, reclassification of the stock, or any other increase or decrease in the number of shares of stock effected without [PARTY A] receiving consideration.Issuances Not Requiring Adjustment. Unless expressly provided for in this plan, [PARTY A] issuing shares of any class of stock, or securities convertible into shares of any class of stock, will not affect, and no adjustment will be made in connection with, the number or price of shares of [PARTY A] common stock subject to an option.Dissolution or LiquidationAdjustments In Case of Dissolution or Liquidation. In the event of a proposed dissolution or liquidation of [PARTY A], the Board will shorten the Offering Period then in progress by setting a New Exercise Date so that the Offering Period will terminate immediately before the consummation of the proposed dissolution or liquidation, unless the Board or Committee provides otherwise.New Exercise Date In Case of Dissolution or Liquidation. The New Exercise Date under this paragraph [DISSOLUTION OR LIQUIDATION] will be before the date of [PARTY A]'s proposed dissolution or liquidation.Merger or Asset Sale.Adjustments In Case of Merger or Asset Sale. In the event of a proposed sale of all or substantially all of [PARTY A]'s assets, or [PARTY A]'s merger with or into another corporation, each outstanding option will be assumed or an equivalent option substituted by the successor corporation, a Parent, or Subsidiary of the successor corporation.New Exercise Date In Case of Merger or Asset Sale. In the event that the successor corporation refuses to assume or substitute for the option, the Board shall shorten the Offering Period then in progress by setting a New Exercise Date on a date before the date of the proposed sale or merger.Notice of New Exercise Date. If the Board sets a New Exercise Date under this section, the Board or Committee shall notify each Participant in writing, at least 10 Business Days before the New Exercise Date, that theExercise Date for the Participant's option has been changed to the New Exercise Date, andParticipant's option will automatically exercise on the New Exercise Date, unless the Participant withdraws from the Offering Period before the New Exercise Date.

name: Administration
description: Administration of PlanAdministration by Committee. Subject to paragraph [DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY], the Committee shall administer this plan.Committee ProceduresMember Appointment. The Board may, on one or more occasions,appoint additional members to the Committee,substitute new members for then current members of the Committee, andfill vacancies, however caused, in the Committee.Selection of Chairman. The Committee shall select one of its members to be its chairman.Meetings. The Committee may hold its meetings at time, place, and manner it deems advisable, including by telephone.Majority Rule. The Committee shall make its determinations by a majority vote of its members.Written Voting. The Committee may make its determinations by a written instrument signed by a majority of its members, with the same binding effect as if the vote was made orally.Appointment of Secretary. The Committee may appoint a secretary.Committee's Authority. The Committee is authorized to interpret this plan, adopt the rules, guidelines, and forms it deems appropriate to implement this plan, andmake all other policy decisions relating to the operation of this plan.Delegation of AuthorityDelegation to Administrator. The Committee may delegate to the authority to administer this plan to an officer or Employee of [PARTY A] (the "Administrator").Administrator's Authority. The Administrator shall administer this plan subject to the Committee's rules and interpretive determinations in connection with this plan.Delegation Does Not Effect Administrator's Eligibility. The Committee's delegation will not make the Administrator, if otherwise an Eligible Employee, ineligible to participate in this plan.Compensation of Committee No Additional Compensation. Unless otherwise determined by the Board, [PARTY A] will not be required to provide additional compensation to Committee members because of their status or services as Committee members.Expenses Reimbursable. [PARTY A] shall pay all expenses in connection with the administration of this plan, including clerical, legal, and accounting fees.Indemnification and Limitation on Liability.No Liability. Members of the Board or Committee will not be liable for any action or determinationmade in good faith, andin connection with this plan or any option granted under it.Indemnification. [PARTY A] shall indemnify each member of the Board and Committee to the extent permitted by Law, in connection with any claim, loss, damage, or expense (including counsel fees) arising out of Board and Committee members' responsibilities under this plan.

name: Administration of Plan
description: Administration of PlanAdministered by Committee. The Committee shall be responsible for the general administration of this plan.Committee's Discretion in Administering Plan. The Committee shalladopt rules, regulations, and interpretations to assist it in the administration of this plan, determine eligibility to participate in this plan,determine the amount of benefits payable under this plan, andmake other interpretations, including factual determinations, necessary to administer this plan.Delegation to Agents. The Committee may employ agents and delegate its administrative obligations under this section to agents.Consult with [PARTY A] Counsel. The Committee may consult with [PARTY A]'s legal counsel.Committee's Binding Authority. The Committee's decisions and actions in connection with the administration, interpretation, and application of this plan, and the rules, regulations, and interpretations made under this plan will be binding on the Participants and all other Persons with an interests in this plan.Indemnification of Committee. [PARTY A] shall indemnify the Committee and each member of the Committee against all losses, damages, expenses, or liabilities arising from the Committee's or any Committee member's action or omission in connection with administering this plan, unless the act or omission constitutes willful misconduct or gross negligence by the Committee or any of its members.Participant Cooperation with Committee. On [PARTY A]'s or the Committee's reasonable request, Participants shall furnish any information reasonably necessary,take physical examinations reasonably necessary, andtake all other action reasonably necessary to facilitate the payment of benefits under this agreement.Contesting Denied BenefitsSubmit Claim for Benefits. A Participant who believes that he or she is being denied a Retirement Benefit to which he or she is entitled under this plan (this Participant referred to as a "Claimant") may submit a written claim to the Committee for the requested benefit, including reasonable and relevant arguments for awarding the benefit.Accept or Reject Claim. Within 60 days of receiving a Claimant's claim, the Committee shall give the Claimant written notice of the Committee's approval or denial of the claim. Denial of Claim. If the Committee denies a claim, it shall include in its notice of denialthe reasons for denial, including the specific provisions of this plan the rejection is based on,a description of any additional material or information required for a successful claim, and an explanation of why it is necessary, andan explanation of the Committee's claim review procedure.Review of Decision  Time Limit to Request Review. Within 60 days after receiving a rejection, or if the Committee has not responded to the claim within 60 days (or, in the case of a request in connection with a Disability, 180 days) after the Committee received the request, the Claimant may request the Committee review the claim by submitting a written request for review to the Committee.Decision on Review. Within 60 days of receiving the request to review, the Committee shall review the claim, and deliver its final decision to the Claimant in writing, including the reasons for its decision and the specific provisions of this plan the decision is based on.Materials on Review. The Committee shall review a reasonable amount of relevant documents, written comments, and written issues submitted by the Claimant in connection with the review.No Right to Hearing. The Committee will not be required to grant the Claimant a hearing in connection with its review.Extension. The Committee may extend the time for review to accommodate a hearing or other special circumstances, up to a maximum of 120 days. Final Decision. The Committee's decision on review will be final and binding on the Claimant.

name: Advancement of Expenses
description: Advancement of Litigation ExpensesLitigation Expenses. [PARTY A] shall advance all reasonable Litigation Expenses [PARTY B] incurs (or incurred on [PARTY B]'s behalf) in connection with any Indemnifiable Proceeding within [20] Business Days after [PARTY A]'s receives [PARTY B]'s written request for such advance or advances, whether before or after final disposition of such proceeding.Litigation Expense Statements. [PARTY B]'s request mustreasonably evidence all Litigation Expenses [PARTY B]'s incurs, andinclude, be preceded by, or accompanied by an undertaking by or on behalf of [PARTY B] to repay any Litigation Expenses advanced if it is ultimately determined that [PARTY B] is not entitled to be indemnified against such Litigation Expenses.

name: Pro-Indemnitee
description: CompareAdvancement of ExpensesExpenses. The Company shall advance all reasonable Expenses incurred by or on behalf of Indemnitee in connection with any Proceeding within 20 days after the receipt by the Company of a statement or statements from Indemnitee requesting such advance or advances from time to time, whether prior to or after final disposition of such Proceeding.Expense Statements. Such statement or statements shall reasonably evidence the Expenses incurred by Indemnitee and shall include or be preceded or accompanied by an undertaking by or on behalf of Indemnitee to repay any Expenses advanced if it shall ultimately be determined that Indemnitee is not entitled to be indemnified against such Expenses.Advances Unsecured and Interest. Such advances shall, in all events, be unsecured and interest free, and made without regard to the Indemnitee's ability to repay the advances.Adjudication under this Agreement. The Indemnitee's entitlement to such Expense Advance will include those Expenses incurred in connection with any Proceeding by the Indemnified Party against the Corporation seeking an adjudication or award pursuant to this Agreement.

name: Advertising Fee
description: Advertising Fee. Franchisee will pay to Franchisor an advertising fee of [ADVERTISING FEE PERCENTAGE] of gross sales of each month.

name: Advice of Counsel
description: Advice of Counsel. EXECUTIVE IS HEREBY ADVISED TO CONSULT WITH AN ATTORNEY BEFORE SIGNING THIS AGREEMENT.

name: Standard
description: FeesRetainer Fees. [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] a [one-time / monthly] nonrefundable retainer fee of $[RETAINER FEE] (the "Retainer Fee"). Transaction Consummation FeesFinancing Transaction Fees. At the closing of a Financing Transaction, [PARTY A] shall pay to [PARTY B] a non-refundable amount equal to [PERCENTAGE]& of the gross proceeds of such transaction ("Financing Transaction Fee").Sale Transaction Fees. At the closing of a Sale Transaction, [PARTY A] shall pay to [PARTY B] a non-refundable amount equal to [PERCENTAGE]& of the gross proceeds of such transaction ("Sale Transaction Fee").Maximum Transaction Consummation Fees. [PARTY A] will not be required to pay any Financing or Sale Transaction Fee in excess of $[MAXIMUM FEE].Retainer Fee Credited Against Transaction Fees. The Retainer Fee amount will be credited against any Financing or Sale Transaction Fee that may be payable under this section [FEES]. Transaction Value. For the purpose of this agreement, the total value of a Financing or Sale Transaction will include the value of all cash, securities[, or other property] paid in exchange to [PARTY A] for it assets or securities.

name: Robust
description: CompareFees Retainer Fee. [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] a [one-time / monthly] nonrefundable retainer fee of $[RETAINER FEE] (the "Retainer Fee"). Transaction Consummation FeesFinancing Transaction FeesFinancing Transaction Fee Structure. In addition to the foregoing retainer fee, on the consummation of any Financing Transaction with any party, whether or not resulting from [PARTY B]'s services, [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] a cash fee ("Financing Transaction Fee") equal to the greater of:a minimum fee of $[MINIMUM FEE]; orthe sum of: [PERCENTAGE]% of the aggregate amount of  senior debt raised or committed; [PERCENTAGE]% of the aggregate amount of all unsecured, non-senior, and subordinated debt raised or committed; and [PERCENTAGE]% of the aggregate amount of all equity and equity equivalents (including convertible and preferred stock); butin no case more than $[MAXIMUM FEE].Financing Transaction Fee Payment. [PARTY A] shall pay Financing Transaction Fees to [PARTY B] by withholding the amount due from the proceeds of the related Financing Transaction (including the exercise of any warrants) by instructing the financier, lender, investor, or purchaser to wire transfer the Financing Transaction Fee directly to [PARTY B] at the closing of any such Financing Transaction.Sale Transaction Fees. If [PARTY B]'s services involves a Sale Transaction, [PARTY A] shall pay to [PARTY B] a cash transaction fee (a “Sale Transaction Fee”) equal to the greater of:a minimum fee of $[MINIMUM FEE]; orthe sum of:[PERCENTAGE]% of the Transaction Value for amounts up to and including $[AMOUNT],[PERCENTAGE]% of the Transaction Value for amounts in excess of $[AMOUNT] and including $[AMOUNT], and[PERCENTAGE]% of the Transaction Value for amounts in excess of $[AMOUNT].Initial Fee on Definitive Agreement. On [PARTY A]'s entry into a definitive agreement with investors in a Financing Transaction or a purchaser in a Sale Transaction, [PARTY A] shall pay to [PARTY B] an initial payment of $[INITIAL FEE], which amount will be credited against any Financing or Sale Transaction Fee that may be payable under this section [FEES].Retainer Fee Credited Against Transaction Fees. The Retainer Fee amount will be credited against any Financing or Sale Transaction Fee that may be payable under this section [FEES]. Transaction ValueDefinition. “Transaction Value”, for the purpose of this agreement, means the total value of all cash, securities, or other property paid to [PARTY A] or its shareholders at the closing of the Sale Transaction  or to be paid in the future to them with respect to the Sale Transaction as provided below (other than payments of interest or dividends) in respect of:[PARTY A]'s assets;[PARTY A]'s capital stock (and any securities convertible into options, warrants, or other rights to acquire such capital stock); orthe assumption, directly or indirectly (by operation of law or otherwise), of any of [PARTY A]'s indebtedness for borrowed money, less all cash and cash equivalents held by [PARTY A] at closing.Valuation on Non-Cash Valuables. For purposes of valuing consideration included in Transaction Value other than cash payable at closing:the assumption of any indebtedness for borrowed money will be valued at the unpaid principal amount of such assumed liability;contingent payments will be valued at the present value of such payment using a discount rate of [PERCENTAGE]%;the value of any purchase money or other promissory notes will be deemed to be the face amount thereof;any securities (other than a promissory note) will be valued at the time of the closing of the Sale Transaction (without regard to any restrictions on transferability) as follows:if such securities are traded on a stock exchange, the securities will be valued at the average last sale or closing price for the 10 trading days immediately prior to the closing of the Sale Transaction;if such securities are traded primarily in over-the-counter transactions, the securities will be valued at the mean of the closing bid and asked quotations similarly averaged over a 10-trading-day period immediately before the closing of the Sale Transaction; andif such securities have not been traded before the closing of the Sale Transaction, the value of such securities will be as mutually agreed in good faith by [PARTY A]'s Board and [PARTY B]; andany assets other than cash or the assets described in the foregoing clauses will be valued as mutually agreed in good faith by [PARTY A]'s Board and [PARTY B].

name: Advisory Rights
description: Advisory Rights. If Investor is not represented on the Board, Investor shall be entitled to consult with and advise management of the Company on significant business issues, including management's proposed annual operating plans, and management will meet with Investor regularly during each year at the Company's facilities at mutually agreeable times for such consultation and advice and to review progress in achieving said plans.

name: Pro-Founder
description: CompareAdvisory Rights. If Investor holds at least [ ] shares of Series [ ] Preferred Stock and is not represented on the Board, Investor shall be entitled to consult with and advise management of the Company on significant business issues, as determined by the Company, and management will meet with Investor at the Company's facilities at mutually agreeable times for such consultation and advice and to review progress in achieving said plans.

name: After Acquired Property
description: Intellectual Property All Intellectual Property Included. Company hereby represents and warrants to Secured Party for the benefit of the Secured Party that the Intellectual Property listed on the Intellectual Property Exhibits constitute all of the Intellectual Property [material to the Company's business and] now owned by Company.Any Additional or After Acquired Property Automatically Included. If, before all Obligations shall have been satisfied in full [or before the Loan Agreement has been terminated], Company shallbecome aware of any existing Intellectual Property [material to the Company's business] of which Company has not previously informed Secured Party,obtain rights to any new patentable inventions or other Intellectual Property [material to the Company's business], orbecome entitled to the benefit of any Intellectual Property [material to the Company's business] which benefit is not in existence on the date hereof,the provisions of this Agreement shall automatically apply thereto and Company shall give to Secured Party prompt written notice thereof. Company Responsibilities. Company agrees to execute and deliver any and all documents and instruments necessary or advisable to record or preserve Secured Party's interest in all Intellectual Property added to the Intellectual Property Exhibits pursuant to this Section.Authorization to Modify and Refile. Company hereby authorizes Secured Party to modify this Agreement by amending the Intellectual Property Exhibits, as applicable, to include any such Intellectual Property, and to file or refile this Agreement with the appropriate government offices.

name: Aggregation of Stock
description: Aggregation of Stock. All shares of Registrable Securities held by Affiliates, Persons, or other entities under common management or control will be aggregated together for the purpose of determining the availability of any rights under this agreement.

name: Standard
description: Allocation of Purchase PriceAllocation Schedule. The Purchase Price and Assumed Liabilities will be allocated among the Purchased Assets for all purposes (including Tax and financial accounting) as shown on the attached allocation schedule (the "Allocation Schedule").Preparation and Dispute ResolutionPrepare and Deliver. The [PARTY A] shall prepare a draft of the Allocation Schedule and deliver it to the [PARTY B] within 30 days following the Closing Date.Negotiation of Disputes. If the [PARTY B] notifies the [PARTY A] in writing that the [PARTY B] objects to anything in the Allocation Schedule, the parties shall negotiate in good faith to resolve such dispute.Independent Accountants. If the parties are unable to resolve any dispute with respect to the Allocation Schedule within 30 days following the Closing Date, the parties shall submit the dispute to be resolved by independent accountants or advisors the parties mutually appoint.Expenses. The parties shall pay the expenses of the independent accountants or advisors equally.Related Tax Filings. The parties shall cooperate to file all Tax Returns (including amended returns and claims for refund) and information reports in a manner consistent with the Allocation Schedule.

name: Real Property Lease
description: Alterations, Additions, and Improvements to Premise[PARTY A]'s Consent Required. [PARTY B] may not make any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Premise unless [PARTY A] consents in writing.Construction Warranties. [PARTY B] shall ensure that all alterations, additions, or improvements it makes or has made are done in a good and workmanlike manner, in compliance with all Laws.Ownership. [ [PARTY B] / [PARTY A] ] will own all additions, alterations, and improvements it makes or has made.

name: Personal Property Lease
description: CompareAlterations, Additions, and Improvements to Equipment[PARTY A]'s Consent Required. [PARTY B] may not make any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Equipment unless [PARTY A] consents in writing.Construction Warranties. [PARTY B] shall ensure that all alterations, additions, or improvements it makes or has made are done in a good and workmanlike manner, in compliance with all Laws.Ownership. On the expiration or termination of this agreement, [PARTY A] will own all additions, alterations, and improvements [PARTY B] makes to the Equipment.

name: Sublease
description: CompareAlterations, Additions, and Improvements Prior Consent. [PARTY B] may not make or allow any alterations, additions, or improvements in or to the Premise, unless [PARTY A] consents in writing.Costs. [PARTY B] shall be solely responsible for the planning, construction, and completion of any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Premise, at [PARTY B]'s sole cost and expense.No Lien. [PARTY B] will not to permit any mechanic's or other liens to be placed on the Premise in connection with any alterations, additions, or improvements.Landlord's Property. At the expiration or termination of this agreement,[PARTY B] shall surrender to the Landlord all additions, alterations, and improvements [PARTY B] made to the Premise, andthe Landlord will own all those additions, alterations, and improvements.

name: Standard — Merger Agreement
description: Alternative ProposalsCompany Shall Cease Discussions and Negotiations of Ongoing Alternative Proposals. The Company shall, and must cause its Subsidiaries and Representatives to, immediately cease and cause to be terminated any discussions or negotiations with any parties that may be ongoing with respect to an Alternative Proposal.Company May Not Solicit Alternative Proposals or Make an Adverse Change in RecommendationGeneral Restriction Against Solicitation and Adverse Recommendation Changes. Subject to the [SUPERIOR PROPOSAL SUBCLAUSE], [PERMITTED DISCUSSION REGARDING ALTERNATIVE PROPOSALS] and [MAKING AN ADVERSE RECOMMENDATION CHANGE SUBCLAUSE] subclauses below, from the execution this agreement until the Effective Time or, if earlier, the termination of this agreement under [TERMINATION CLAUSE] the Company shall not, nor authorize any of its Subsidiaries or Representatives to, solicit any Alternative Proposals or recommend any Adverse Change in Recommendation.Specific Restrictions. Under the [NO SOLICITATION OR ADVERSE RECOMMENDATION CHANGE SUBCLAUSE] subclause, the Company may not, nor authorize any Subsidiary to:Solicit, initiate or take any action to knowingly facilitate or knowingly encourage the submission of any Alternative Proposal;Enter into or participate in any discussions or negotiations with or furnish any information relating to the Company or any of its Subsidiaries or afford access to the business, properties, assets, books or records of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries to, any third party relating to an Alternative Proposal or any inquiry or proposal that may reasonably be expected to lead to an Alternative Proposal;Fail to publicly reaffirm the Recommendation following any written request by Parent to provide such reaffirmation following an Alternative Proposal (which request may only be made once with respect to such Alternative Proposal absent further material changes in such Alternative Proposal) as promptly as practicable consistent with the Board of Directors' fiduciary duties; or Otherwise enter into any agreement in principle relating to recommending an Alternative Proposal to the Company Shareholders.Permitted Discussion Regarding Alternative Proposals. The Company may:Disclose to Company Shareholders an Alternative Proposal which the Company Board of Directors determines is reasonably required to disclose under applicable Law or fiduciary duty (provided that the Company may not recommend any Alternative Proposal unless permitted by the [MAKING AN ADVERSE RECOMMENDATION CHANGE] subclause; Issue a "stop, look and listen" disclosure or similar communication of the type contemplated by Rule 14d-9(f) under the Exchange Act; orContact and discuss with any person or entity who has made an Alternative Proposal solely for the purpose of clarifying whether such proposal might be a Superior Proposal. Notice of Alternative Proposal. Between the execution of this agreement and the  Company Stockholder Approval, the Company shall promptly, no later than within 24 hours, notify the Parent after receiving any Alternative Proposal or any request for information relating to the Company or any of its Subsidiaries, which notice shall include the material terms and conditions of any such Alternative Proposal, indication or request. Company’s Engagement With A Superior Proposal. Between the execution of this agreement and obtaining the Company Shareholder Approval, the Company may communicate with, negotiate with and furnish nonpublic Company information to a third party regarding an Alternative Proposal if:The Company or any of its Representatives receives such Alternative Proposal;That the Company Board of Directors believes in good faith:Is or may reasonably be expected to lead to a Superior Proposal; andThat the failure to accept such Superior Proposal would be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under applicable Law. Making an Adverse Change in Recommendation Reasons for Making an Adverse Recommendation Change. Subject to the below [PROCEDURE FOR MAKING AN ADVERSE RECOMMENDATION CHANGE SUBCLAUSE] subclause, at any time prior to obtaining the Company Stockholder Approval, the Company may, if the Company Board of Directors determines in good faith that the failure to do so would be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under applicable Law, make an Adverse Recommendation Change:In response to a written Alternative Proposal that the Company  Board of Directors has determined in good faith constitutes a Superior Proposal (provided the Company has complied with the [TERMINATION CLAUSE] clause); or In response to an Intervening Event. Procedure For Making an Adverse Recommendation Change. Prior to effecting any Adverse Recommendation Change or terminating this agreement the under [TERMINATION ON SUPERIOR PROPOSAL SUBCLAUSE] subclause  (“Superior Proposal Termination”) the Company shall do the following:Notify Parent. At least 3 business days’ prior to effecting such Adverse Recommendation Change or Superior Proposal Termination (“Notice Period”), the Company shall notify the Parent in writing of its intention to effect such Adverse Recommendation Change or Superior Proposal Termination (such notice must include the terms and conditions of the Superior Proposal, the identity of the person making such proposal, and a copy of the most recent draft of any related written agreement);Allow Opportunity to Renegotiate this Agreement. During the Notice Period, the Company shall negotiate with the Parent in good faith, to the extent Parent wishes to negotiate, to make such adjustment to this agreement such that either: The Superior Proposal ceases to be a Superior Proposal; or The Adverse Recommendation Change in response to the Intervening Event is no longer necessary; andReconsider Superior Proposal or Adverse Recommendation Change. At the end of the Notice Period, the Company Board of Directors shall determine in good faith and promptly notice the Parent of its decision regarding either: Whether to accept the re-negotiated terms of this agreement, or to effect the Superior Proposal Termination; or Whether the Intervening Event continues to necessitate an Adverse Recommendation Change.

name: Standard — Amend with mutual agreement
description: Amendment. This agreement can be amended only by a writing signed by both parties.

name: Unilateral Amendment with right to terminate
description: CompareAmendment. [PARTY A] may unilaterally amend the agreement, or any exhibit, schedule, or appendix of this agreement, by giving notice to [PARTY B], subject to the following conditions:The amendment will take effect at the specified time after the effective date of the notice.No amendment will retroactively amend any terms of this agreement.[PARTY B] may, upon receipt of [PARTY A]'s notice, elect to terminate the agreement.

name: Unilateral - Party against whom the amendment is enforced
description: CompareAmendment. This agreement may be amended only by a written instrument executed by the party against whom the amendment is to be enforced.

name: Authorized Person
description: CompareAmendment. This agreement may be amended only by a written instrument executed by [TITLE OR POSITION OF AUTHORIZED INDIVIDUAL] of each party.

name: Parent and Board — Merger or Acquisition Agreement
description: CompareAmendmentBefore the Effective Time. Before the Effective Time, this agreement may be amended by either the Parent Board of Directors or Company Board of Directors.After the Effective Time.  After the Effective Time, this agreement may only be amended by the Parent Board of Directors or Company Board of Directors with the prior written approval by the Company Shareholders, if such approval is required by the [APPLICABLE STATUTE].Method of Amendment. This agreement can be amended only by a written instrument signed on behalf of both parties.

name: Stockholder Approval - Corporate Formation Documents
description: CompareAmendment. This agreement may be amended only by written consent of the Company and Stockhoolders of at least [66%] of the outstanding shares of Common Stock. Any consent will only be effective in the specific instance and purpose for which it was given and shall not constitute continuing consent.

name: Executive Retirement Plan
description: CompareAmendmentConditional Right to Amend. Subject to paragraph [EFFECT ON BENEFITS], [PARTY A] may amend this plan without notice to or consent of any Participant.Consent Required for Amendment Adversely Effecting Benefits. If [PARTY A]'s amendment would adversely affect any Participant's vested benefits, [PARTY A] may not make that amendment without the written consent of the relevant Participants.

name: Amendment of Policy
description: CompareAmendment. This policy can be amended only by the Committee.

name: Amendment of Bylaws
description: CompareAmendmentPower of Board to Amend. The Board may amend or repeal any of these bylaws or adopt new bylaws for the Corporation at any regular or special Board meeting, except that the Board may not change what constitutes a quorum at a shareholders' meeting, or amend or alter bylaws that expressly cannot be amended or repealed by the Board.Power of Shareholders to Amend. The Corporation's shareholders may amend or repeal any of these bylaws or adopt new bylaws for the Corporation at any annual or special shareholders meeting.

name: Security Agreements
description: CompareAmendment. This agreement can only by amendedas provided under paragraph [PARTY A'S AUTHORIZATION TO AMEND AND FILE SCHEDULES], orif the parties agree in writing.

name: Amendment and Termination
description: Amendment and Termination. The Company reserves the right to modify or amend, in whole or in part, or to terminate this Plan, at any time without notice; provided, however, that no distribution of SERP Benefits shall occur upon termination of this Plan unless applicable requirements of Code Section 409A have been met.

name: Pro-Participant
description: CompareAmendment and TerminationAmendment. The Company may amend the Plan from time-to-time, but no amendment shall adversely affect the rights which a Participant shall have accrued hereunder at the time of the amendment without the express written consent of such Participant.Termination. While the Company intends to maintain this Plan for as long as necessary, the Company reserves the right to terminate it at any time for whatever reason it may deem appropriate, subject to the requirements of the Amendment Subsection above that apply with respect to any amendment to terminate the Plan. In the event of the termination of the Plan (and any other plan required to be aggregated with this Plan pursuant to Section 409A of the Code), the Company may, in its discretion, elect to distribute to each Executive the full amount of his benefit under the Plan in a lump sum no earlier than the 13th month and no later than the 24th month after the termination of the Plan, provided that the termination of the Plan is not proximate to a downturn in the Company's financial health and the Company does not adopt any new arrangement that would have been aggregated with the Plan under Section 409A within three years following the date of the Plan's termination. If a Change in Control Event occurs that results in the payment of benefits to Executives, then the Plan shall terminate automatically immediately following the payment of such benefits, and no further benefits shall accrue under the Plan following such Change in Control Event.

name: Forbearance Agreement
description: Amendment of Financing Agreement. On or before the Effective Date, the parties shall cooperate to amend the Financing Agreement as follows:Forbearance Agreement Definition. The parties shall amend the Financing Agreement to include in section [DEFINITIONS], in alphabetical order, "'Forbearance Agreement' means the Forbearance Agreement between the parties, dated as of [EFFECTIVE DATE], attached to this agreement."Interest on Unpaid Amounts. The parties shall amend the Financing Agreement to include a new section "[Interest After Default]," which reads: "On the occurrence and continuance of any Default or Event of Default (including the Existing Default as defined in the Forbearance Agreement), any principal of or due but unpaid interest on the Obligations or any other unpaid amounts will accrue interest, after as well as before judgment, at a rate per annum equal toin the case of the principal amount of the Obligations or other unpaid amounts, the rate then applicable to the Loans under the relevant Facility plus 2%, orin the case of the due but unpaid interest on the Obligations or other unpaid amounts, the rate applicable to [Base Rate Loans] under the [Revolving Facility] plus [2]%."

name: Annual Meetings
description: Annual Meetings. The annual meeting of the stockholders to elect directors and for the transaction of such other business as may properly come before the meeting shall be held on such date and at such time as may be designated from time to time by the Board of Directors.

name: Annual Physical Examination
description: Annual Physical Exam. To the extent not covered by the Company's medical insurance plan, the Company shall reimburse the Executive for [the full cost / [DOLLAR AMOUNT]] of a complete annual physical examination.

name: Direct Payment
description: CompareAnnual Physical Exam. The Company shall pay for an annual physical examination of the Executive by a physician selected by the Executive with the approval of the Company, which shall not to be unreasonably withheld.

name: Standard
description: Annual Report. Each year the Board will publish and submit a summary of the Corporation's (and its consolidated subsidiaries) consolidated income and a full or condensed balance sheet for the previous year.

name: Merger Agreement
description: Antitrust FilingsHSR Act Filings. As promptly as possible, each party shall take all actions necessary for the Merger and this agreement under the HSR Act, including to:file a Notification and Report Form pursuant to the HSR Act with respect to the transactions under this agreement;supply any additional information and documentary material that might be required under the HSR Act; andtake all other actions necessary, proper, or advisable to cause the expiration or termination of the applicable waiting periods under the HSR Act as soon as practicable. HSR Approvals and Authorizations Reasonable Efforts to Obtain Approvals and Authorizations. Subject to the [FURTHER ACTIONS SUBCLAUSE] subclause, each of the Parent, Merger Sub, and Company shall use reasonable efforts to obtain all approvals and authorizations, and make all filings for the transactions in this agreement required  under the HSR Act or any other antitrust Law.Specific Obligations. The parties’ obligations under this subclause include using reasonable efforts to: keep the other parties reasonably informed of any communication received by such party from, or given by such party to, the FTC, DOJ, any other U.S. or foreign Governmental Authority, on in connection with a proceeding with private party, with any other person, related to any antitrust Law; permit the other parties to review any such communication;consult with each other in advance of any meeting or conference with, the FTC, the DOJ, or any other Governmental Authority or, in connection with any proceeding by a private party, with any other person, related to any antitrust Law; andto the extent permitted, give the other parties the opportunity to attend and participate in such meetings and conferences.Resolving Challenges and Objections. The Parent, Merger Sub, and Company shall use reasonable efforts to resolve any objections to, or suits instituted or threatened by the FTC, DOJ or any other applicable Governmental Authority, or private party, against this agreement under any antitrust Law, or which would otherwise prevent, materially impede, or materially delay the Merger or otherwise this agreement.

name: Appointment of Reseller
description: Appointment of ResellerAuthorization and Appointment. [PARTY A] hereby authorizes and appoints [PARTY B], and [PARTY B] accepts the authorization and appointment, as [PARTY A]'s [non-exclusive / exclusive] reseller, to market, sell, or incorporate for resale the [PARTY A] Products listed in the [ATTACHMENT] attached to this agreement within the Territory.Revision of Authorization. [PARTY A] may revise the list of Products bygiving [PARTY B] written notice, andcooperating with [PARTY B] to draft, execute, and attach to this agreement an amended list of Products reflecting the revisions.

name: Appointment of Distributor
description: CompareAppointment of DistributorAuthorization and Appointment.
