All of [PARTY A]'s issued and outstanding shares of Common Stock and Preferred Stock have been authorized, are fully paid, and non-assessable.No Options. [PARTY A]'s Common Stock and Preferred Stock, including any other equity interests relating to such stock or the price of such stock, are not subject to any options, warrants, calls, subscriptions, or other rights, agreements, arrangements, or commitments of any character, in each case, obligating the [PARTY A] or its Subsidiaries to issue, sell or grant any Common Stock or Preferred Stock.

name: Long Form — [PARTY B]
description: CompareCapitalizationAuthorized Capital Stock. [PARTY B]'s authorized capital stock consists of [SHARES OF [PARTY B] COMMON STOCK] shares of [PARTY B] Common Stock, and [SHARES OF [PARTY B] PREFERRED STOCK] shares of [PARTY B] Preferred Stock.Authorized and Valid. All of [PARTY B]'s issued and outstanding shares of Common Stock and Preferred Stock have been authorized, are fully paid, and non-assessable.No Options. [PARTY B]'s Common Stock and Preferred Stock, including any other equity interests relating to such stock or the price of such stock, are not subject to any options, warrants, calls, subscriptions, or other rights, agreements, arrangements, or commitments of any character, in each case, obligating the [PARTY B] or its Subsidiaries to issue, sell or grant any Common Stock or Preferred Stock.

name: Standard
description: Capitalized Terms. Unless otherwise defined in this amendment, capitalized terms used in this amendment will have the same meaning they do in the Agreement.

name: Standard
description: Casualty and Eminent DomainLimited Termination Rights. [PARTY B] may not terminate this agreement, and will not be entitled to an abatement of Rent or any other amounts owed under this agreement because of a casualty or condemnation affecting the Premise, unless [PARTY A] is permitted to an abatement under the Lease Agreement.Termination Procedure. If [PARTY A] is allowed to terminate the Lease Agreement because of casualty or condemnation,[PARTY B] may terminate this agreement by giving [PARTY B] written notice at least 10 Business Days before to the date [PARTY A] is required to give notice to the Landlord of that termination under the Lease Agreement, and [PARTY A] shall give [PARTY B] written notice of this termination date under the Lease Agreement at least 30 days before that date occurs.

name: Cause
description: Cause. The Corporation may terminate the Executive's employment for Cause."Cause" defined. For purposes of the Agreement, the Corporation shall have "Cause" to terminate the Executive's employment uponthe willful and continued failure by the Executive to substantially perform his duties with the Corporation (other than any such failure resulting from his incapacity due to physical or mental illness) after a demand for substantial performance is delivered to the Executive by the Corporation which specifically identifies the manner that the Executive has not substantially performed his duties orthe willful engaging by the Executive in gross misconduct materially and demonstrably injurious to the Corporation."Willful" Defined. For purposes of this paragraph, no act, or failure to act, on the Executive's part shall be considered "willful" unless done, or omitted to be done, by him not in good faith and without reasonable belief that his action or omission was in the best interests of the Corporation.

name: Certain Obligations of the Parties
description: Certain Obligations of the Parties.Licensee Obligations. The Licensee:agrees to comply with all legal requirements in connection with the use of the Licensor Content;agrees that all rights in and to any of the Licensor Content not expressly licensed are reserved to Licensor;agrees not to sublicense, assign, transfer, pledge, offer as security, or otherwise encumber the Licensor Content or any of the rights granted in this Agreement in any way other than as expressly provided in the Agreement;agrees not to use any of the Licensor Content in any manner or for any purpose in violation of the terms of this Agreement;acknowledges and agrees that it shall not at any time during the Term or thereafter (i) challenge the title or any other rights of Licensor or its licensors in or to the Licensor Content or any parts or derivatives or any variations, (ii) contest the validity of the copyrights or other proprietary interests in and to the Licensor Content or (iii) claim any right, title or interest in or to the Licensor Content or any parts or derivatives or variations; andagrees to use its best efforts to cause sublicensees to comply with the terms of this section.Licensor Obligations. The Licensor:will provide reasonable on-going assistance to Licensee with regard to technical, administrative and service-oriented issues relating to the utilization, encoding, transmission and maintenance of the Licensor Content, as Licensee may reasonably request. Licensor will use its best efforts to ensure that the Licensor Content is timely, accurate, comprehensive and updated regularly as set forth in this Agreement.

name: Certain Payments — Generic
description: Certain Payments.No Inducement. Neither the [PARTY] nor any of its Subsidiaries (nor, to the knowledge of the [PARTY], any of their respective directors, executives, representatives, agents or employees) has provided, offered, gifted or promised, directly or knowingly through another person, anything of value to any foreign or domestic government officials or employees for the purpose of:Influencing any act or decision of any such government official or employee in their official capacity;Inducing any such government official or employee to do or omit to do any act in violation of their lawful duty, or securing any improper advantage for the [PARTY] or any of its Subsidiaries; orInducing any such government official or employee to use his or her influence to affect or influence any act or decision of any governmental entity, in each case of (a) and (b) in order to assist the [PARTY] or any of its subsidiaries in obtaining or retaining business.No Notices of Allegations. Neither the [PARTY] nor any of its Subsidiaries has received any written communication (or, to the [PARTY]'s knowledge, other communication) from any governmental entity alleging that the [PARTY] or any of its Subsidiaries, or any current or former director, executive, representative, agent or employee thereof, has engaged in the conduct described in preceding sentence, and no such conduct has been discovered by or brought to the attention of the [PARTY] or any of its Subsidiaries.No Anticipated Disclosure. Neither the [PARTY] nor any of its Subsidiaries has made or anticipates making any disclosure to any governmental entity regarding any such conduct.No Unlawful Funds. Neither the [PARTY] nor any of its Subsidiaries has established or maintained any unlawful fund of corporate monies or other properties.

name: Standard
description: Certain Prohibited PaymentsNo Prohibited or Conflicting Payments. The parties acknowledge that [PARTY A] will not be required to make any payment or take any action under this agreement if such payment or action:is prohibited by a Governmental Authority with jurisdiction over [PARTY A], or its Subsidiaries, because such Governmental Authority has determined [PARTY A], or its Subsidiaries is troubled, insolvent, in default, or operating in an unsafe or unsound manner; orwould be prohibited by or would violate any provision of state or federal Law applicable to [PARTY A] or any of its subsidiaries, including, without limitation, the Federal Deposit Insurance Act and the regulations thereunder presently found at 12 C.F.R. Part 359, as now in effect or hereafter amended; orotherwise would be prohibited by any Governmental Authority.Return Payments. If a Governmental Authority alleges or decides that any payment made by [PARTY A] to [PARTY B] under this agreement is in violation of paragraph [NO PROHIBITED OR CONFLICTING PAYMENTS] directly above, [PARTY B] shall immediately return such payment to [PARTY A].

name: Certain Settlement Provisions
description: Certain Settlement Provisions[PARTY A]'s Consent. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to indemnify [PARTY B] under this agreement for amounts paid to settle any Indemnifiable Proceeding without [PARTY A]'s written consent, which may not be unreasonably withheld.[PARTY B]'s Consent. [PARTY A] will not settle any Indemnifiable Proceeding in any manner that would impose any fine or other obligation on [PARTY B] without [PARTY B]'s written consent, which may not be unreasonably withheld.

name: Certificate of Incorporation and Bylaws Representation Clause
description: Public Company The Company Charter and Company Bylaws as most recently filed as exhibits to the Company SEC Reports are in full force and effect.

name: Long Form
description: CompareNo Violation. The Company is not in violation of any provisions of its Certificate of Incorporation or By-Laws in any material respect.No Other Organizational Documents. The Certificate of Incorporation of the Company and the By-Laws are in full force and effect and no other organizational documents are applicable to or binding upon the Company.

name: Private Company
description: ComparePrivate Company The Company has delivered or made available to [Party] true, correct, and complete copies of the certificate of incorporation and bylaws of the Company, including all amendments thereto. The Company is not in violation of its certificate of incorporation or bylaws[ or equivalent organizational documents].

name: Chairman of the Board
description: Chairman of the Board. The Chairman shall preside at all meetings of the Board of Directors. The Chairman may execute on behalf of the Corporation all bonds, mortgages, contracts, and other documents, except for such documents required by law to be otherwise executed or where the execution of such shall be delegated by the Board of Directors to another officer.

name: Executive Employment Agreement
description: Termination Related to a Change in Control.Triggering Payments Under this Section. [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] the benefits provided under paragraph [CHANGE IN CONTROL BENEFITS] if [PARTY B]’s employment is terminated on account ofan involuntary termination by [PARTY A] for any reason other than Cause, death, or Disability, or[PARTY B] voluntarily terminates employment with [PARTY A] on account of a resignation for Good Reason,in either case that occursat the same time as, or within the 12 month period following, the consummation of a Change in Control, orwithin the sixty 60 Business Day period prior to the date of a Change in Control where the Change in Control was under consideration at the time of [PARTY B]’s termination.Change in Control BenefitsCompensation Upon Involuntary Termination Relating to a Change in Control. Subject to paragraph [NO OVERLAPPING SEVERANCE BENEFITS], in the event a termination described in paragraph [INVOLUNTARY TERMINATION RELATING TO CHANGE IN CONTROL], [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] two times the sum of [PARTY B]'s Annual Base Salary and Target Bonus, paid in a single lump sum cash payment 60 Business Days following [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination, provided that [PARTY B] executes and does not revoke a release of [PARTY A].No Overlapping Severance Benefits. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if [PARTY B] is otherwise entitled to receive the severance benefit payable under this agreement as a result of a qualifying termination prior to a Change in Control and then becomes entitled to receive the severance benefit payable under this section [TERMINATION ON CHANGE OF CONTROL], [PARTY B] will be entitled only to the severance benefit payable under this section.Annual Base Salary. For purposes of this section, "Annual Base Salary" will mean the largest among the following: [PARTY B]'s annual Base Salary immediately before[PARTY B]’s Date of Termination,any reduction of [PARTY B]’s base salary described in the definition of Good Reason, orthe Change in Control.Target Bonus For purposes of this section, "Target Bonus" will mean the largest among the following: [PARTY B]’s target bonus immediately before [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination,immediately before any reduction of [PARTY B]’s target bonus described in the definition of Good Reason,immediately before the Change in Control or for the fiscal year preceding the year in which the Change in Control.Medical Coverage[PARTY B]'s Right to Continuing Medical Coverage. Subject to paragraphs [CONTINUING MEDICAL COVERAGE TERMINATES ON ALTERNATIVE EMPLOYMENT] and [PARTY B'S FAILURE TO PAY COBRA], for a period of up to 24 months following [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination, [PARTY B] and where applicable, [PARTY B]’s spouse and eligible dependents, will continue to be eligible to receive medical coverage under [PARTY A]’s medical plans according to the terms of the applicable plan documents, providedthat in order to receive such continued coverage at such rates, [PARTY B] shall pay the applicable premiums to the plan provider, andsubject to paragraph [IMPOSSIBILITY OF COBRA PAYMENTS], [PARTY A] will reimburse [PARTY B], within 60 Business Days following the date such monthly premium payment is due, an amount equal to the monthly COBRA (or, as applicable, other) premium payment, not including applicable Tax withholdings.Continuing Medical Coverage Terminates on Alternative Employment. If [PARTY B] obtains full-time employment during this 24 month period that entitles him/her, his/her spouse, and eligible dependents to comprehensive medical coverage[PARTY B] shall notify [PARTY A], and[PARTY A] may immediately cease any further reimbursements under this paragraph [MEDICAL COVERAGE].[PARTY B]'s Failure to Pay COBRA. If [PARTY B] does not pay the applicable monthly COBRA (or other) premium for a particular month during the 24 month period and coverage is lost as a result, [PARTY A] may immediately cease any further reimbursements under this paragraph [MEDICAL COVERAGE].Impossibility of COBRA Payments. If [PARTY A] determines that it cannot provide [PARTY B]'s COBRA benefits without potentially violating applicable Law (including Section 2716 of the Public Health Service Act), [PARTY A] shall instead pay [PARTY B] a taxable lump-sum amount equal to the monthly (or then remaining) COBRA premium [PARTY B] would be required to pay to continue his group health coverage in effect on his/her Date of Termination (which amount will be based on the premium for the first month of COBRA coverage).Stock Option VestingAccelerate Stock Option Vesting. If [PARTY B] holds any outstanding [PARTY A] stock options as of his/her Termination Date, [PARTY A] shall fully accelerate the vesting and exercisability of such stock options, so that all such stock optionswill be fully vested and exercisable as of [PARTY B]’s Termination Date, and(as well as any outstanding stock options that previously became vested and exercisable) remain exercisable, notwithstanding anything in any other agreement governing such options, until the earlier ofone year after [PARTY B]’s Termination Date, orthe original term of the option.Accelerate Other Option Vestings. If [PARTY B] is otherwise entitled to receive the vesting and exercisability acceleration provided this agreement as a result of a qualifying termination prior to a Change in Control,if [PARTY B] becomes entitled to receive the severance benefits payable under to this section [TERMINATION ON CHANGE OF CONTOL] as a result of the Change in Control that was considered at the time of [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination becoming consummated within 60 Business Days following [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination, any outstanding stock options that did not otherwise become vested and exercisable under this agreement will become vested and exercisable as of the date of the Change in Control, unless,if a Change in Control does not occur within 60 days following [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination, any stock options [PARTY B] holds that are not vested and exercisable will terminate 60 Business Days following [PARTY B]’s Termination Date or the end of the term, if earlier.[Restricted Stock OptionsAccelerate and Vest. Subject to paragraph  If [PARTY B] holds any Restricted Stock Units that are unvested at the time of his/her Date of Termination, all such unvested Restricted Stock Units will vest and settle no later than 60 Business Days following the Date of Termination.]If [PARTY B] is otherwise entitled to receive the vesting acceleration provided under this agreement as a result of a qualifying termination prior to a Change in Control,if [PARTY B] becomes entitled to receive the severance benefits payable under this section [TERMINATION ON CHANGE OF CONTROL] as a result of the Change in Control that was considered at the time of [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination becoming consummated within 60 Business Days following [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination, any outstanding Restricted Stock Units that did not otherwise vest under this agreement will vest as of the date of the Change in Control, unless if a Change in Control does not occur within 60 Business Days following [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination, any Restricted Stock Units [PARTY B]s holds that are not vested will terminate 60 Business Days following [PARTY B]’s Date of Termination.[Other Awards and Incentive Plans. [PARTY A] shall release to [PARTY B] any amounts that have been accrued for the account of [PARTY B] under a long term incentive plan,performance-based restricted stock unit, or performance contingent restricted stock unit that have not been released to [PARTY B] as of his/her Date of Termination Date, as applicable, according to the terms of the applicable agreement governing such awards or plans.]Payment. [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] any amounts earned, accrued or owing but not yet paid to [PARTY B] under this section in a lump sum.

name: Indemnification Agreement
description: CompareChange in ControlSelect Independent Counsel. After any Change in Control [PARTY A] undergoes [(other than a Change in Control approved by a majority of [PARTY A]'s Board of Directors who were directors immediately prior to such Change in Control)] all matters concerning [PARTY B]'s right to payment under this agreement or any of [PARTY A]'s governing documents, as amended, will be submitted to Independent Counsel [PARTY B] selects, subject to [PARTY A]'s approval (which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld).Independent Counsel's Binding Determination. [PARTY A] shall abide by the Independent Counsel's determination of the Independent Counsel.Expenses and Indemnity for Independent Counsel. [PARTY A] shallpay the Independent Counsel's reasonable fees, andfully indemnify the Independent Counsel against any and all expenses (including attorneys' fees), claims, liabilities, and damages arising out of this agreement or the counsel's engagement.

name: Compensation
description: CompensationBase Salary.Annual Base Salary. During the Employment Period, the Executive shall receive an annual base salary ("Annual Base Salary"), which shall be paid at a monthly rate, at least equal to twelve times the highest monthly base salary paid or payable, including any base salary which has been earned but deferred, to the Executive by the Company and its affiliated companies in respect of the twelve-month period immediately preceding the month in which the Change of Control Date occurs.Review. During the Employment Period, the Annual Base Salary shall be reviewed no more than 12 months after the last salary increase awarded to the Executive prior to the Change of Control Date and thereafter at least annually.Increase In Base Salary Does Not Affect Other Benefits. Any increase in Annual Base Salary shall not serve to limit or reduce any other obligation to the Executive under this Agreement. Annual Base Salary shall not be reduced after any such increase and the term Annual Base Salary as utilized in this Agreement shall refer to Annual Base Salary as so increased.Annual Bonus. In addition to Annual Base Salary, the Executive shall be awarded, for each fiscal year ending during the Employment Period, an annual bonus (the "Annual Bonus") in cash at least equal to the Executive's target annual bonus under the Company's Annual Incentive Bonus Plan, or any comparable bonus under any predecessor or successor plan, for the fiscal year in which the Change of Control Date occurs, which shall be calculated as follows:the target bonus percentage as established by the Board prior to the Change of Control Date for the fiscal year in which the Change of Control Date occurs, multiplied bythe Executive's Annual Base Salary (the "Recent Annual Bonus").Bonus Calculation If Not Established in Incentive Plan. In the event that, prior to the Change of Control Date, the Executive's target bonus percentage has not been established by the Board under the Annual Incentive Bonus Plan or any comparable bonus under any predecessor or successor plan, then for purposes of this Agreement, the Executive's Recent Annual Bonus shall be calculated by using the target bonus percentage for the other executives in the Executive's peer group (determined based on title, responsibilities and duties) who are parties to a Key Employee Change of Control Contract with the Company.Timing of Bonus Payment. Such Annual Bonus shall be paid no later than January 31 of the fiscal year next following the fiscal year for which the Annual Bonus is awarded, unless the Executive shall elect to defer the receipt of such Annual Bonus in accordance with procedures established by the Company that comply with the requirements of Code Section 409A.

name: Standard
description: Changes to Event DetailsRight to Make Changes. Subject to [PARTY A]'s availability and paragraphs [COST OF CHANGES] and [FAILURE TO NOTIFY], [PARTY B] may change the Event Time, Event Date, or Event Venue by giving [PARTY A] prompt written notice of the changes.Cost of Changes. [PARTY A] may adjust the Compensation to account for any changes [PARTY B] makes, making these adjustments at [PARTY A]'s rates at the time of this agreement.Failure to Notify. [PARTY A] will be relieved of its obligations under this agreement if and to the extent [PARTY B]'s failure to promptly notify [PARTY A] of any changes to the event harms [PARTY A]'s ability to provide the [DELIVERABLE].

name: Standard
description: Changes to PolicyDiscretion to Make Changes. [PARTY A] may change this policy at its discretion. Notice of Changes. [PARTY A] shall provide reasonable notice of any such changes on the Website.Acceptance of Changes. Users' continued use of the Website after notice of the changes has been posted to the Website will be deemed acceptance of the changes, if a reasonable time has passed in which Users could review the changes, butregardless as to whether the User actually did review the changes.

name: Product Resale, Distribution, or Supply Agreement
description: Changes to Products. [PARTY A] may discontinue or modify the Products, modify the Product specifications, or replace the Products with similar [PARTY A] or third party products, except that [PARTY A] may not discontinue, modify, or replace Products that are subject to an accepted and outstanding Purchase Order, unless required by Law.

name: Standard: consent required for change
description: ChangesRequest Changes. Either may request to change the [DELIVERABLE] by written notice to the other.Mutual Consent to Any Changes. Changes will not be binding unless agreed to in writing by each party.

name: Unrestricted right
description: CompareChanges. [PARTY A] may at any time make changes in shipping and packing instructions, quantities, drawings, designs, specifications, place of delivery, and/or delivery schedules, for which an appropriate adjustment to the order shall be made.

name: Business Service Provider: client may request change (subject to fee), withdraw, or terminate
description: CompareChanges to ServicesChange Orders. [PARTY B] may request changes to the [DELIVERABLE] by written notice to [PARTY A].Additional Time or Expense. If the proposed change will require a delay in delivery of the [DELIVERABLE] or would result in additional expense, [PARTY A] shall submit a proposal for the requested changes, detailing any added time and expense, and[PARTY B] may elect to eitherwithdraw its proposed change, orrequire [PARYT A] to provide the [DELIVERABLE] with the proposed change, subject to the delay and additional expense.Termination. If [PARTY A] cannot, or chooses not to accept the change order, then [PARTY B] may terminate this agreement and pay [PARTY A] any amounts it already owes under this agreement.Changes Made in Writing. If the parties agree to make changes to the [DELIVERABLE], the parties shall make those changes in writing, signed by each party.

name: Business Service Provider: provider can propose changes
description: CompareChangesNotice of Necessary Changes. [PARTY A] shall promptly notify [PARTY B] in writing of any change to the [DELIVERABLE] [PARTY A] reasonably determines is necessary.Contents of Notice. [PARTY A] shall include in its notice to [PARTY B]the particular elements of the [DELIVERABLE] [PARTY A] seeks to change,the reason for the requested change, andthe impact, if any, that the requested change will have onthe [price] [amount],time for [performance / delivery], orany other terms or conditions of this agreement.Changes Made in Writing. Any changes to the [DELIVERABLE] must be in writing and signed by each party.

name: Individual Service Provider: provider can propose changes
description: CompareChangesNotice of Necessary Changes. [PARTY B] shall promptly notify [PARTY A] in writing of any change to the [DELIVERABLE] [PARTY B] reasonably determines is necessary.Contents of Notice. [PARTY B] shall include in its notice to [PARTY A]the particular elements of the [DELIVERABLE] [PARTY A] seeks to change,the reason for the requested change, andthe impact, if any, that the requested change will have onthe [price] [amount],time for [performance / delivery], orany other terms or conditions of this agreement.Changes Made in Writing. Any changes to the [DELIVERABLE] must be in writing and signed by each party.

name: Individual Service Provider: client may request change (subject to fee) withdraw, or terminate
description: CompareChanges to ServicesChange Orders. [PARTY A] may request changes to the [DELIVERABLE] by written notice to [PARTY B].Additional Time or Expense. If the proposed change will require a delay in delivery of the [DELIVERABLE] or would result in additional expense, [PARTY B] shall submit a proposal for the requested changes, detailing any added time and expense, and[PARTY A] may elect to eitherwithdraw its proposed change, orrequire [PARTY B] to provide the [DELIVERABLE] with the proposed change, subject to the delay and additional expense.Termination. If [PARTY B] cannot, or chooses not to accept the change order, then [PARTY A] may terminate this agreement, and pay [PARTY B] any amounts it already owes under this agreement.Changes Made in Writing. If the parties agree to make changes to the [DELIVERABLE], the parties shall make those changes in writing, signed by each party.

name: Master Services Agreement
description: CompareChangesRequest Changes. Either may request to change a Statement of Work by written notice to the other party.Mutual Consent to Any Changes. Changes will not be binding unless both parties agree in writing.

name: Changes to Terms of Use
description: Changes to Terms of ServiceRight to Change Terms. The Company reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to change these Terms of Service ("Updated Terms") from time to time.Notice of Updated Terms. Unless the Company makes a change for legal or administrative reasons, the Company will provide reasonable advance notice before the Updated Terms become effective. You agree that the Company may notify you of the Updated Terms by posting them on the Site.Acceptance of Updated Terms. Your use of the Site after the effective date of the Updated Terms constitutes your agreement to the Updated Terms. You should review these Terms of Service and any Updated Terms before using the Site.Effective Date of Updated Terms. The Updated Terms will be effective as of the time of posting, or such later date as may be specified in the Updated Terms, and will apply to your use of the Site from that point forward.

name: Changing Beneficiary
description: Changing Beneficiary. Any Beneficiary designation may be changed by a Participant without the consent of the previously named Beneficiary by the filing of a new Beneficiary designation with the Committee.

name: Checks, Drafts, etc.
description: Checks, Drafts, etc. All notes, drafts, acceptances, checks, endorsements, and, subject to the provisions of these Bylaws, evidences of indebtedness of the Corporation, shall be signed by such officer or officers or such agent or agents of the Corporation and in such manner as the Board of Directors from time to time may determine. Endorsements for deposit to the credit of the Corporation in any of its duly authorized depositories shall be in such manner as the Board of Directors from time to time may determine.

name: Chief Executive Officer
description: Chief Executive Officer. The Chief Executive Officer, if one is elected, shall have such powers and shall perform such duties as the Board of Directors may from time to time designate.

name: Chief Financial Officer
description: Chief Financial Officer. The Chief Financial Officer shall be the principal financial officer of the Corporation, shall have charge and custody of, and be responsible for, all funds of the Corporation, and deposit all such funds in the name of the Corporation in such banks, trust companies or other depositories as shall be selected by the Board of Directors; shall receive, and give receipts for, monies due and payable to the Corporation from any source whatsoever; and, in general, shall oversee all the duties incident to the office of Treasurer and perform such other duties as these Bylaws provide, as are usual and customary, or as may, from time to time, be assigned by the Board or Directors.

name: Claims, Inquiries and Appeals
description: Claims, Inquiries and Appeals. Any application or request for benefits, inquiries about the Plan or inquiries about payment or future rights under the Plan must be submitted to the Plan Administrator in writing by an individual (or his or her authorized representative) (the "Applicant") at the following address:[COMPANY ADDRESS][COMPANY]Denial of Claims. The Applicant will be notified within ninety (90) days after the claim is filed whether the claim is allowed or denied, unless the Applicant receives written notice from the Plan Administrator before the end of the ninety (90) day period stating that special circumstances require an extension of the time for decision, such extension not to extend beyond the day which is one hundred eighty (180) days after the day the claim is filed.Manner and Content of Denial of Initial Claims. If the Plan Administrator denies a claim, it must provide to the Applicant, in writing or by electronic communication:the specific reasons for the denial;a reference to the Plan provision upon which the denial is based;a description of any additional information or material that the Applicant must provide in order to perfect the claim;an explanation of why such additional material or information is necessary;a description of the Plan's review procedures and the time limits applicable to such procedures; anda statement of the Applicant's right to bring a civil action under Section 502(a) of ERISA following a denial on review of the initial denial.Appeal of Denied Claim. A request for review of a denied claim must be made in writing to the Plan Administrator within sixty (60) days after receiving notice of denial. The decision upon review will be made within sixty (60) days after the Plan Administrator's receipt of a request for review, unless special circumstances require an extension of time for processing, in which case a decision will be rendered not later than one hundred twenty (120) days after receipt of a request for review. A notice of such an extension must be provided to the Applicant within the initial sixty (60) day period and must explain the special circumstances and provide an expected date of decision. The Plan Administrator will afford the Applicant an opportunity to review and receive, without charge, all relevant documents, information and records and to submit issues and comments in writing to the Plan Administrator. The Plan Administrator will take into account all comments, documents, records and other information submitted by the Applicant relating to the claim regardless of whether the information was submitted or considered in the initial benefit determination.Decision on Review. Upon completion of its review of an adverse initial claim determination, the Plan Administrator will give the Applicant, in writing or by electronic notification, a notice containing:its decision;the specific reasons for the decision;the relevant Plan provisions on which its decision is based;a statement that the Applicant is entitled to receive, upon request and without charge, reasonable access to, and copies of, all documents, records and other information in the Plan's files which is relevant to the Applicant's claim for benefits;a statement describing the Applicant's right to bring an action for judicial review under Section 502(a) of ERISA; andif an internal rule, guideline, protocol or other similar criterion was relied upon in making the adverse determination on review, a statement that a copy of the rule, guideline, protocol or other similar criterion will be provided without charge to the Applicant upon request.Rules and Procedures. The Plan Administrator will establish rules and procedures, consistent with the Plan and with ERISA, as necessary and appropriate in carrying out its responsibilities in reviewing benefit claims. The Plan Administrator may require an Applicant who wishes to submit additional information in connection with an appeal from the denial of benefits to do so at the Applicant's own expense.Calculation of Time Periods. For purposes of the time periods specified in this Section, the period of time during which a benefit determination is required to be made begins at the time a claim is filed in accordance with the Plan procedures without regard to whether all the information necessary to make a decision accompanies the claim. If a period of time is extended due to an Applicant's failure to submit all information necessary, the period for making the determination will be tolled from the date the notification is sent to the Applicant until the date the Applicant responds.Exhaustion of Remedies. No legal action for benefits under the Plan may be brought until the Applicanthas submitted a written application for benefits in accordance with this Section,has been notified by the Plan Administrator that the application is denied,has filed a written request for a review of the application in accordance with the appeal procedure described in this Section andhas been notified that the Plan Administrator has denied the appeal. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the Plan Administrator does not respond to a Applicant's claim or appeal within the relevant time limits specified in this Section, the Applicant may proceed with a legal action for benefits.

name: Standard
description: Clawback Provisions. Any incentive-based compensation, or any other compensation, paid to [PARTY B] under this agreement or any other agreement or arrangement with [PARTY A] which is subject to recovery under any Law or stock exchange listing requirement, will be subject to such deductions and clawback as may be required to be made under such Law or stock exchange listing requirement (or any policy adopted by [PARTY A] under such Law or stock exchange listing requirement).

name: Closing
description: ClosingClosing Date. The closing (the "Closing") of the transactions provided for herein shall take place at the [CLOSING LOCATION], by [CLOSING DATE] or at such other time and place as Transferor and Transferee may agree upon in writing (the "Closing Date").Technology Delivery. At the Closing, Transferor shall deliver or cause to be delivered to Transferee: (a) the Acquired Technology in a mutually agreeable format; (b) copies of all files and records relating to the Acquired Technology; and (c) the contact information of any others that may be currently using the Acquired Technology.

name: Standard
description: Closing Conditions. From the date of this agreement until the Closing, each party shall use reasonable efforts to take, or cause to be taken, such actions as are necessary to expeditiously satisfy the conditions precedent set out in the [CONDITIONS PRECEDENT] clause.

name: Standard
description: The Closing and Closing Date. Unless the parties agree otherwise in writing, the consummation of the transactions contemplated under this agreement (the "Closing") will take place, and this agreement will become effective (the "Effective Time"):at [CLOSING TIME], [TIME ZONE];on the [second] business day after all of the conditions to Closing set out in the [CONDITIONS PRECEDENT] clause are either satisfied or waived (other than conditions which, by their nature, are to be satisfied on the Closing Date) (the "Closing Date"); andat [NAME AND ADDRESS OF CLOSING LOCATION].

name: Merger Agreement
description: CompareClosing and Effective TimeClosing Date. Unless the parties agree otherwise in writing, this agreement will close and the Merger will come into effect (the "Effective Time"):at [MERGER CLOSING TIME], [TIME ZONE];on the [fifth] business day after all of the conditions precedent to this agreement listed in the [CONDITIONS PRECEDENT] clause are either satisfied or waived (other than conditions which, by their nature, are to be satisfied at the closing) (the "Closing Date"); andat [NAME AND ADDRESS OF MERGER CLOSING LOCATION].Certificate of Merger. On the Closing Date, the parties shall file with the Secretary of State of the [STATE OF JURISDICTION] a signed certificate of merger in the form required by the [RELEVANT STATE STATUTE] ("Certificate of Merger").

name: Asset Purchase Agreement
description: Closing Deliverables[PARTY B] Deliverables. At the Closing, the [PARTY B] shall deliver to the [PARTY A] the following:a bill of sale in the form of [ATTACHMENT] (the "Bill of Sale") and signed by the [PARTY B], transferring the tangible personal property included in the Purchased Assets to the [PARTY A];an assignment and assumption agreement in the form of [ATTACHMENT] (the "Assignment and Assumption agreement"), signed by the [PARTY B], effecting the assignment to and assumption by the [PARTY A] of the Assigned Contracts and the Assumed Liabilities;with respect to each Lease, an Assignment and Assumption of Lease substantially in the form of [ATTACHMENT] (each, an "Assignment and Assumption of Lease"), signed by [PARTY B] and, if necessary, [PARTY B]'s signature shall be witnessed and/or notarized;a Closing Certificate signed by the [PARTY B];an affidavit of non-foreign status of [PARTY B] under Section 1445 of the Code signed [PARTY B]; andany other customary instruments of transfer, assumption, filings, or documents, as may be reasonably required to give effect to this agreement.[PARTY A] Deliverables. At the Closing, [PARTY A] shall deliver to [PARTY B] the following:the Purchase Price;the Assignment and Assumption agreement signed by the [PARTY A];with respect to each Lease, an Assignment and Assumption of Lease signed by the [PARTY A] and, if necessary, [PARTY A]'s signature shall be witnessed and/or notarized; anda Closing Certificate signed by the [PARTY A].

name: Stock Purchase Agreement
description: Compare Closing Deliverables[PARTY B] Deliverables. At the Closing, the [PARTY B] shall deliver to the [PARTY A]:An executed stock certificate evidencing the Shares accompanied by a stock power duly executed in blank, in the form attached as [ATTACHMENT]; andA Closing Certificate signed by a duly authorized officer of the [PARTY B].[PARTY A] Deliverables. At the Closing, the [PARTY A] shall deliver to the [PARTY B]:The Purchase Price; andA Closing Certificate signed by a duly authorized officer of the [PARTY A].

name: Closing Of Transfer Books
description: Closing Of Transfer Books. The Board of Directors may close the books of the Corporation against transfers of shares during the whole or any part of a period not more than [60] days prior to the date of a stockholders' meeting, the date when the right to any dividend, distribution, or allotment of rights vests, or the effective date of any change, conversion, or exchange of shares.

name: Standard
description: Dependency and Timing of PerformanceThe Closing of this agreement will be conducted as follows in this [CLOSING] clause.Each party's performance at the Closing will be conditioned on the performance of the other other party.The parties' will be deemed to have performed simultaneously, with all closing transfers made simultaneously.

name: Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
description: Code of EthicsNo Effect on the Code of Ethics. The parties hereby acknowledge thatnothing in this agreement is intended to limit, modify, or reduce [PARTY A]'s obligations under [PARTY B]'s Code of Ethics, and[PARTY B]'s obligations under this agreement are in addition to, and not in lieu of, it's obligations under the Code of Ethics.Inconsistencies. The Code of Ethics will control if and to the extent there is any inconsistency between this agreement and the Code of Ethics.[PARTY A]'s Code of Ethics. "Code of Ethics" means [PARTY A]'s code of ethics attached to this agreement as [ATTACHMENT].

name: Standard
description: Commission CompensationCommissions. The Representative shall be entitled to receive a commission on sales of the Products in the Territory to customers, which sales were made substantially through the efforts of the Representative during the Term (or any extension of the Term). Commissions shall be payable as follows: [COMMISSION PERCENTAGE FOR INCLUDED PRODUCTS] of the Net Amount charged by the Company for orders of the Products placed through the Representative (other than to Existing Customers and their affiliates); and[COMMISSION PERCENTAGE FOR OTHER PRODUCTS] of total Net Amount charged by the Company for orders of products other than Products listed in Exhibit A placed through the Representative."Net Amount" is the sales price of the sold product as listed on the invoice, less charges for handling, freight, sales, use, value added, or similar taxes, import or export taxes or levies taxes, C.O.D. charges, insurance, customs duties, trade discounts, and/or any other governmental or administrative fees or charges.Offsets and Charge-Backs. In calculating the commission that is due to the Representative, the Company may offset any credits, cancellations, refunds, allowances, and returns to or by customers of revenues on which Representative has already been paid commissions under this Agreement; provided, however, that in no event shall the offset for any customer exceed the sales price of that customer's returned, cancelled, or otherwise credited products.No Commissions in Certain Circumstances. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no commission shall be payable to the Representative under any of the following circumstances:if prohibited under applicable government law, regulation, or policy;if the Representative did not directly facilitate the sale of the Products to a customer;on any sale to customers that are directly or indirectly owned by or under common ownership with the Representative;on any sales outside of the Territory, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Company;on any sales to Existing Customers, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Company; or (vi) on any sale of Products to a customer occurring after the expiration or termination of the Term (or any extension of the Term) unless:the sale takes place within ________ (___) days after the termination or expiration of this Agreement; andthe sale is the direct result of the Representative's sales efforts before such termination or expiration.No Other Compensation. The compensation set out above shall be the Representative's sole compensation under this Agreement.

name: Standard
description: Committees Board Establishes Committees. The Board may establish one or more committees, each committee to consist of one or more directors.Powers of Committees. Any committee, to the extent permitted by Law and as provided in the Board's resolution, will have the same powers and authority as the Board to manage the Corporation's business and affairs.Conduct of Committees. Unless the Board determines otherwise, any committee may make rules for the conduct of its business, but if a committee does not set its own rules it will conduct its business so far as possible in the same manner as the Board is required to under these bylaws.Board's Ability to Remove Committee Members or Committees. The Board may remove any committee member from its committee position, or disband any committee.

name: Common Areas
description: Common Areas. Tenant will be entitled to the non-exclusive use of the common areas of the Building as they exist from time to time during the Term, including the parking facilities, subject to Landlord's rules and regulations regarding such use.

name: Standard
description: Communications GuidelinesCommunication Via Designees. The parties shall submit or direct to each other's Designee all:communications, questions, or request regarding the Transaction, Purpose, or Confidential Information;requests for additional information, confidential or not;requests for facility tours or management or employee meetings or conversations; andany other communications, questions, or requests related to this agreement.No Other Communications. The parties will not initiate or maintain contact with the other party with respect to communications relating in any way to the Transaction, Purpose, the Confidential Information, or this agreement, except in accordance with the guidelines provided in this section [COMMUNICATIONS GUIDELINES].

name: Limited Liability Company
description: AllocationProfits and Losses. [PARTY A] shall allocate its profits and losses to the Members in proportion to each Member's respective Sharing Ratio.Special Allocations. If an allocation of income, gain, loss, or deduction is prohibited by the Code or other applicable Law, [PARTY A] shall allocate to the effected Members [PARTY A]'s subsequent income, gain, loss, and deductions, so as to reflect as nearly as possible the Members' respective Sharing Ratios (at the time the allocations are determined).Tax AllocationsAllocate Tax Items. [PARTY A] shall allocate to Members, in according with Code section 704(c), items taxable income, gain, loss, and deduction in connection with any property contributed to [PARTY A]'s capital so as to account for any variation between [PARTY A]'s adjusted basis for that property and that property's gross asset value.Adjusted Values. If the gross asset value of any company asset is adjusted under Regulations Section 1.704-1(b)(2)(iv)(e) or (f), subsequent allocations of items of taxable income, gain, loss, and deduction in connection with that asset will take into account any variation between the adjusted basis and the gross asset value of that asset under Code section 704(c).Credit Recaptures. [PARTY A] shall allocate to Members Tax credit recaptures, and any related items, according to the Members' respective interests in those items as reasonably determined by the [Manager / Board], taking into account Regulations Sections 1.704-1(b)(4)(ii) and 1.704-1T(b)(4)(xi).No Effect on Accounting. Allocations under this section [ALLOCATION] are solely for the purpose of federal, state, and local Taxes, and will not effect, or in any way be taken into account in computing, and Member's capital account or share of income, loss, distribution, or other [PARTY A] item under this agreement.

name: Company Car
description: Company Car. The Company shall make available a [DETAILS OF COMPANY CAR] for the Executive's professional [and private] use.

name: Standard
description: [PARTY A] DistributionsDistributions. [PARTY A] shall make distributions to Memberssimultaneously to all Members, in proportion to the Members' respective Sharing Ratios (at the time the amounts of distribution are determined), andin the amount the Board determines, provided that any loans from Members are repaid before other distributions to Members.Successors. For purposes of determining the amount of distributions, each Member will be treated as having made the capital contributions and as having received the distributions made to or received by its predecessors in respect to any of that Member's Units.Tax DistributionsCalculation of Pro Rata Distributions. On or before the 10th day after the end of each quarterly tax period of each calendar year, [PARTY A] shall make a cash distribution (each one a "Tax Distribution"), pro rata in accordance with Share Ratios as of that quarterly tax period, in the amount equal to the excess ofthe product ofthe cumulative positive taxable income of [PARTY A] measured from the Effective Date through that quarterly tax period, based onthe information returns filed by [PARTY A], andestimated amounts for periods [PARTY A] has not yet filed information returns for,multiplied by the assumed tax rate, or[PARTY A]'s cumulative prior distributions under this section.Disregarded Amounts. For the purposes of the computations required under this section, [PARTY A]'s taxable income will be determined by disregardingany adjustment to any Member's taxable income that arises under Code section 743(b) that is attributable to that Member acquiring an interest in [PARTY A] described in Code section 743(a), andany taxable income or gain attributable to any undistributed accounts allocated under section [PARTY A ALLOCATIONS].Limits on Tax Distributions. Tax Distributions under this section, if any, will be made only to the extent that all previous distributions from [PARTY A] for that fiscal year or prior fiscal years (as determined by the [Manager / Board]) to the applicable Member are less than the Tax Distributions that Member would otherwise be entitled to for the applicable quarterly tax period and all prior quarterly tax periods and fiscal years.Distributions In-Kind. If [PARTY A] distributes property in-kind to Members, [PARTY A] will be treated as making a distribution equal to the fair market value of that property, that property will be treated as if it were sold for an amount equal to its fair market value, andany resulting gain or loss will be allocated to the Member's capital accounts in accordance with section [CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS].WithholdingAuthority to Withheld. The [Manager / Board] may withhold from distributions to Members and instead pay to any Governmental Authority any amounts required to be withheld under either the Code or any other Tax Law. Treatment of Withholdings. Amounts withheld under this paragraph [WITHHOLDING] will be treated as a distribution to the applicable Member.Security Interest and Right of Set OffAs security for any withholding Tax or other liability or obligation [PARTY A] is or later becomes subject to because of any Member's act, omission, or status, [PARTY A] will have a security interest in any assets distributable to that Member, to the extent of the withholding Tax, liability, or obligation.[PARTY A] may set-off against these distributions the amount of the withholding Tax, liability, or obligation.Limitations on Distributions. Nothing in this agreement will permit or require [PARTY A] to make a distribution to any Member if that distribution would violate the Act or other Law.

name: Company Indemnity
description: Company Indemnity. The Company shall indemnify the Executive to the maximum extent permitted by law against all claims, liability, costs, and expenses (including attorneys' fees) arising from any third party claim or proceeding against the Executive to which he or she may be made a party by reason of being an officer, director, or employee of the Company, any subsidiary or affiliate, or any other corporation for which the Executive serves as an officer, director, or employee at the Company's request.

name: Short Form
description: CompareCompany Indemnity. The Company shall indemnify the Executive to the fullest extent permitted by the [STATE CORPORATION LAW], as amended from time to time.

name: Short Form - Limit
description: CompareCompany Indemnity. Employee shall be entitled to indemnification as provided to other officers and directors generally under the Company's indemnification policies and procedures.

name: Indemnity Minimum
description: CompareCompany Indemnity. The Company shall indemnify the Executive to the maximum extent permitted by law against all claims, liability, costs, and expenses (including attorneys' fees) arising from any third party claim or proceeding against the Executive to which he or she may be made a party by reason of being an officer, director, or employee of the Company, any subsidiary or affiliate, or any other corporation for which the Executive serves as an officer, director, or employee at the Company's request.Indemnity Minimum. In no event shall the indemnity of the Executive be less than the maximum indemnity provided by the Company to any other director or officer under an indemnification insurance policy or the bylaws or charter of the Company.

name: Standard
description: Company Shareholder Approval Meeting Hold Company Shareholder Approval Meeting. Promptly after the Proxy Statement is cleared by the SEC, the Company shall: recommend that the Company Shareholders approve the adoption of this agreement (the "Recommendation");take all action necessary, under applicable Law, [APPLICABLE STATE STATUTES], and the Company’s charter and bylaws, to hold the Company Shareholder Approval Meeting; andsubject to the [ALTERNATIVE PROPOSAL SUBCLAUSE] subclause, use reasonable efforts to obtain the Company Shareholder Approval. Postponement of Meeting.The Company may make one or more successive postponements or adjournments of the Company Shareholder Approval Meeting: for lack of a quorum; to allow reasonable additional time for:the filing and mailing of any supplemental or amended disclosure which the Company Board of Directors determines is reasonably necessary under applicable Law; and such supplemental or amended disclosure to be sent to and reviewed by the Company Shareholders prior to the Company Shareholder Meeting; orto allow reasonable additional time to solicit additional proxies to the extent the Company Board of Directors reasonably believes necessary in order to obtain the Company Shareholder Approval.

name: Escrow Agent
description: Escrow Agent Compensation[PARTY A] Shall Compensate. On receiving an invoice from the [PARTY C], the [PARTY A] shall compensate the [PARTY C] for:the [PARTY C]'s services under this agreement in accordance with the [ATTACHMENT] attached to this agreement; andthe [PARTY C]'s reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, including reasonable attorneys' expenses.Survival. The [PARTY A]'s obligations under this [ESCROW AGENT COMPENSATION] clause will survive any termination of this agreement and the resignation or removal of the [PARTY C].

name: Compensation of Proxy
description: Compensation of Proxy. Shareholder shall promptly pay the compensation, reasonable and necessary travel expenses, and other expenses paid or incurred by Proxy in the administration of their duties upon submission to Shareholder of reasonably detailed documentation as appropriate.

name: Compensation on Termination for Death, Cause, or Notice
description: Compensation on Termination for Death, for Cause, or [PARTY B]'s Notice. If this agreement terminates due to [PARTY B]'s Death, for Good Cause, or on Notice by [PARTY B], [PARTY A] shall pay or award [PARTY B] the following.Salary. [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B]'s salary through the Termination Date but not after the date.Bonus. [PARTY A] shall award [PARTY B] only those bonus payments that [PARTY B] fully earned before the Termination Date.Stock Options. [PARTY A] stock options granted to [PARTY B] will continue to vest only through the Termination Date.

name: Compliance Enforcement Authority
description: 5. Compliance Enforcement Authority. As defined in the NERC Rules of Procedure.

name: Concise
description: Export Control Laws. Each party shall obtain all Permits necessary to and otherwise comply with all Laws on export control applicable to this agreement and all transactions contemplated under this agreement.

name: Mutual Compliance with Laws
description: Compliance with Laws. Each party willcomply with all Laws [relating to [SUBJECT MATTER OF AGREEMENT]],keep records evidencing its compliance,on the other party's reasonable request, provide these records of compliance to the other party, andnotify the other party if it becomes aware of any non-compliance in connection with this section.

name: Unilateral Compliance with Laws
description: CompareCompliance with Laws. [PARTY B] willcomply with all applicable Laws [relating to [SUBJECT MATTER OF AGREEMENT]],keep records evidencing its compliance, on [PARTY A]'s reasonable request, provide these records of compliance to [PARTY A], andnotify [PARTY A] if it becomes aware of any non-compliance in connection with this section.

name: Unilateral Compliance with Laws and Procedures
description: CompareCompliance with Laws and ProceduresCompliance with Laws. [PARTY B] willcomply with all applicable Laws [relating to [SUBJECT MATTER OF AGREEMENT]],keep records evidencing its compliance, andon [PARTY A]'s reasonable request, provide these records of compliance to [PARTY A].Compliance with Safety Procedures. [When on [PARTY A]'s premises,] [PARTY B] will comply with [PARTY A]'s reasonable safety requirements, policies, and procedures bearing on the performance of this agreement.Notice of Non-Compliance. [PARTY B] will notify [PARTY A] if it becomes aware of any non-compliance in connection with this section.

name: Mutual Compliance with Laws and Procedures
description: Compare Compliance with Laws and ProceduresCompliance with Laws. Each party willcomply with all applicable Laws [relating to [SUBJECT MATTER OF AGREEMENT]],keep records evidencing its compliance, andon the other party's reasonable request, provide these records of compliance to the other party.Compliance with Safety Procedures. Each party will[, when on the other party's premises,] comply with the other party's reasonable safety requirements, policies, and procedures bearing on the performance of this agreement.Notice of Non-Compliance. Each party will notify the other party if it becomes aware of any non-compliance in connection with this section.

name: Concise
description: CompareCompliance with Laws. Each party willcomply with all applicable Laws [relating to [SUBJECT MATTER OF AGREEMENT]], andnotify the other party if it becomes aware of any non-compliance in connection with this section.

name: Simple
description: CompareCompliance with Laws. Each party will comply with all applicable Laws [relating to [SUBJECT MATTER OF AGREEMENT]].

name: [PARTY B]
description: Compliance with LawsCompliance. [PARTY B][, and each of its Subsidiaries] is in compliance with all Laws and Orders applicable to or binding [PARTY B], its Subsidiaries, and any of their respective businesses or properties.No Notice. [PARTY B] has not received notice from any Governmental Authority stating that [PARTY B] or its Subsidiaries is not in compliance with any Law or Order.

name: [PARTY A]
description: CompareCompliance with LawsCompliance. [PARTY A][, and each of its Subsidiaries] is in compliance with all Laws and Orders applicable to or binding [PARTY A], its Subsidiaries, and any of their respective businesses or properties.No Notice. [PARTY A] has not received notice from any Governmental Authority stating that [PARTY A] or its Subsidiaries is not in compliance with any Law or Order.

name: Mutual
description: Compliance With Policies. Each party shall comply with all of the other party's policies it is notified of by the other party.

name: [PARTY B]
description: CompareCompliance With Policies. [PARTY B] shall comply with all [PARTY A] policies that [PARTY A] makes known to [PARTY B].

name: [PARTY A]
description: CompareCompliance With Policies. [PARTY A] shall comply with all [PARTY B] policies that [PARTY B] makes known to [PARTY A].

name: Standard
description: CondemnationTotal Condemnation. If the entire Premise, or enough of the premise as to make the Premise unusable by [PARTY B], is taken by condemnation or in any other manner for any public or quasi-public purpose (collectively "Condemnation," or the act of the taking, "Condemned"), this agreement will automatically terminate on the date that the condemning authority takes possession of the Premise. Partial CondemnationRight to Terminate for Partial Condemnation. Either party may terminate this agreement on 30 days notice to the other if enough of the Premise is Condemned so that, in [PARTY B]'s reasonable opinion, the Premise cannot be restored to an economically viable condition.Continuation of Agreement. If there is a partial Condemnation and neither party elects to terminate this agreement, [PARTY A] shalladjust the Rent to reflect the reduced amount of rentable area in the Premise, andrestore the Premise, but only to the extent of the compensation paid to [PARTY A] for the Condemnation.[PARTY A]'s Damages. [PARTY B] will not have any right to compensation paid as a result of a Condemnation, and hereby waives any right it could have to that consideration. [PARTY B]'s Damages. [PARTY B] may, to the extent it does not reduce [PARTY A]'s compensation for a Condemnation, bring a separate action against the condemning authority forthe recovery of [PARTY B]'s moving expenses,displacement expenses,loss of business, anddamage to [PARTY B]'s personal property.

name: Condition of Premises
description: Condition of Premises. Tenant acknowledges that neither Landlord nor any agent of Landlord has made any representation or warranty regarding the Premises or any portion of the Building except as expressly set forth in this Lease.

name: Pro-Landlord
description: CompareCondition of PremisesTenant acknowledges that neither Landlord nor its agents has made any representation or warranty regarding the Premises or any portion of the Building or the suitability of either for the conduct of Tenant's business, except as herein expressly set forth.The taking of possession of the Premises by Tenant shall establish that the Premises were in satisfactory condition at such time.

name: Pro-Tenant
description: CompareCondition of PremisesTenant acknowledges that neither Landlord nor any agent of Landlord has made any representation or promise regarding the Premises or any portion of the Building except as herein expressly set forth.The Leased Premises shall be deemed in satisfactory condition unless, within fifteen (15) days after the Commencement Date, Tenant shall give Landlord written notice specifying in reasonable detail, the respects in which the Leased Premises are not in satisfactory condition.

name: Conditions to Severance Payments
description: Conditions to Receipt of SeveranceSeparation Agreement and Release of Claims. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to pay [PARTY B] Severance Benefits under section [EFFECT OF TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT] unless [PARTY B] signs, complies with, and does not revokea general release and waiver of claims in favor of [PARTY A], and its officers, directors, and Affiliates, including release from any claims for wages, bonuses, employment benefits, or damages of any kind whatsoever, arising out of any contracts, express or implied, any covenant of good faith and fair dealing, express or implied, any theory of wrongful discharge, any legal restriction on the Company's right to terminate employment, or any federal, state or other governmental statute or ordinance, including Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the federal Age Discrimination in Employment Act, the American with Disabilities Act, the Family and Medical Leave Act, or any other legal limitation on the employment relationship,which general release and waiver of claims will be in a form prepared by [PARTY A], in its reasonable discretion, and delivered to [PARTY A] no later than the due date listed in the form prepared by [PARTY A].CovenantsBenefits Subject to Compliance with Covenants. [PARTY A]'s obligation to pay [PARTY B] any Severance Benefits under section [EFFECT OF TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT] is subject to [PARTY B]'s compliance with sections [NON-SOLICITATION], [NON-COMPETITION], and [CONFIDENTIALITY].Effect of Non-Compliance. If [PARTY B] breaches any of sections [NON-SOLICITATION], [NON-COMPETITION], and [CONFIDENTIALITY][PARTY A] will no longer be obligated to pay Severance Benefits under section [EFFECT OF TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT];[PARTY A] may immediately cease paying all such benefits; and[PARTY B] shall repay to [PARTY A] the full amount of any payments and benefits previously paid by to it by [PARTY A] under section [EFFECT OF TERMINATION] prior to the date of the breach.

name: Standard
description: Conditions on Severance. [PARTY A] will be obligate to pay [PARTY B] the severance payments and benefits under section [SEVERANCE BENEFITS] of the Severance Agreement only if [PARTY B]signs and delivers this agreement to [PARTY A] within 60 of receiving it from [PARTY A],complies the terms of this agreement and the Severance Agreement, anddoes not revoke this agreement under section [RIGHT TO REVOKE].

name: Conditions Precedent on One Party
description: Conditions Precedent to Obligations of [PARTY A]. The obligations of the [PARTY A] to effect the [AGREEMENT] are subject to the satisfaction at or prior to the [EFFECTIVE TIME OF AGREEMENT] of the following conditions:Representations and Warranties. The representations and warranties of the [PARTY B] contained in this agreement and any certificate or other writing delivered pursuant hereto must be correct in all respects.Performance of [PARTY B]'s Obligations. The [PARTY B] must have performed and complied in all material respects with all agreements, covenants, and conditions required of the [PARTY B] under this agreement prior to or on the [EFFECTIVE TIME OF AGREEMENT].No Action, Injunction, or Restraining Order. No Action, injunction, or restraining order must have been commenced or still be in effect against the [PARTY A] or the [PARTY B], which would prevent the [EFFECTUATION OF THIS AGREEMENT], or which restrains or prohibits any transaction under this agreement.Approvals Consents and Waivers. The [PARTY A] must have obtained and received notice of all approvals, consents, and waivers that are listed on any Disclosure Schedule, or required by the [PARTY A]'s principal [FINANCING SOURCE].No Material Adverse Effect. From the date of this agreement, there must not have occurred any event or events that, individually or in the aggregate, has had, or could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY B].Deliverables. The [PARTY B] must have delivered each of the closing deliverables listed in the [CLOSING DELIVERABLES] subclause.Required Financial Information. The [PARTY B] must have obtained the Financing required under the [FINANCING] subclause, and delivered evidence of such financing to the [PARTY A].

name: Conditions Precedent to Each Party
description: CompareConditions Precedent to Obligations of Both Parties. The respective obligations of each party to effect the [AGREEMENT] are subject to the satisfaction at or prior to the [EFFECTIVE TIME OF AGREEMENT] of the following conditions:No Adverse Governmental Order. No Order has been enacted, issued, or enforced by any Governmental Authority that has the effect of making the transactions under this agreement illegal, otherwise restrains or prohibits the consummation of such transactions, or causes any of such transactions to be rescinded following completion thereof.Consents, Authorizations, Orders, and Approvalseach party must have received all consents, authorizations, orders, and approvals from the Governmental Authorities referred to in each party's respective [NO CONFLICTS/CONSENTS REPRESENTATION]; andall such consents, authorizations, orders, and approvals must still be in effect at the time of [EFFECTIVE TIME OF AGREEMENT].

name: Standard
description: Conditions Precedent to Obligations of [PARTY A]. The obligations of the [PARTY A] to effect this agreement are also subject to the satisfaction, or waiver by the [PARTY A], at or prior to the Closing of the following conditions:Representations and Warranties. The representations and warranties of the [PARTY B] must be correct on and as of the date of this agreement, and on and as of the Closing Date with the same effect as though made at and as of such date.Performance of [PARTY B]'s Obligations. The [PARTY B] must have performed and complied in all material respects with all agreements, covenants, and conditions required by this agreement to be performed or complied with by the [PARTY B] prior to or on the Closing Date.Legal Counsel. The [PARTY A] must have received a legal opinion, dated as of the Closing Date, from counsel for the [PARTY B].No Material Adverse Effect. From the date of this agreement, there must not have occurred any event or events that, individually or in the aggregate, has had, or could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY B].

name: Customizable
description: CompareConditions Precedent to Obligation of the [PARTY A]. The obligation of the [PARTY A] to effect this [AGREEMENT] is also subject to the satisfaction, or waiver by the [PARTY A], at or prior to the [EFFECTIVE TIME OF THE AGREEMENT] of the following conditions:[ENUMERATED LIST OF CLOSING CONDITIONS]

name: Asset Purchase Agreement
description: CompareConditions Precedent to Obligations of [PARTY A]. The obligations of the [PARTY A] to effect this agreement are also subject to the satisfaction, or waiver by the [PARTY A], at or prior to the Closing of the following conditions:Representations and Warranties Representations and Warranties in General. Other than the [PARTY B]'s representations and warranties in [ORGANIZATION AND AUTHORITY], [AUTHORITY; BOARD AND STOCKHOLDER APPROVAL], [FINANCIAL STATEMENTS], [UNDISCLOSED LIABILITIES], and [BROKERS], the representations and warranties of the [PARTY B] contained in this agreement and any certificate or other writing delivered under this agreement must be correct (in the case of any representation or warranty qualified by materiality or Material Adverse Effect), or in all material respects (in the case of any representation or warranty not qualified by materiality or Material Adverse Effect) on and as of the date of this agreement, and on and as of the Closing Date, with the same effect as though made at and as of such date (except those representations and warranties that address matters only as of a specified date, the accuracy of which will be determined as of that specified date in all respects).Representations and Warranties Only Required for Closing Date. The [PARTY B]'s representations and warranties in [ORGANIZATION AND AUTHORITY], [AUTHORITY; BOARD AND STOCKHOLDER APPROVAL], [FINANCIAL STATEMENTS], [UNDISCLOSED LIABILITIES], and [BROKERS] must be correct on and as of the date of this agreement, and on and as of the Closing Date, with the same effect as though made at and as of such date (except those representations and warranties that address matters only as of a specified date, the accuracy of which will be determined as of that specified date in all respects).Performance of [PARTY B]'s Obligations. The [PARTY B] must have performed and complied in all material respects with all agreements, covenants, and conditions required by this agreement to be performed or complied with by it prior to or on the Closing Date.No Action, Injunction, or Restraining Order. The parties must not be subject to any Action, injunction, or restraining order, commenced and still in effect, which would prevent the Closing or which restrains or prohibits any transaction under this agreement.Approvals, Consents, and Waivers. The [PARTY A] must have obtained and received notice of all approvals, consents, and waivers that are listed on the [PARTY A]'s Disclosure Schedule, or that are required by the Financing Source.No Material Adverse Effect. From the date of this agreement, there must not have occurred any event or events that, individually or in the aggregate, has had, or could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY B].Deliverables. The [PARTY B] must have delivered each of the closing deliverables required of it under the [CLOSING DELIVERABLES] subclause.Closing Certificate. The [PARTY B] must have delivered to the [PARTY A] a Closing Certificate signed by the [PARTY B].

name: Merger Agreement
description: CompareConditions Precedent to [PARTY A] and Merger Sub's Obligations. The obligations of the [PARTY A] and Merger Sub to effect the Merger are also subject to the satisfaction, or waiver by the [PARTY A] or Merger Sub, at or prior to the Effective Time of the following conditions:Representations and Warranties. In the case of each of the three following subsections, as of the date of this agreement and as of the Effective Time as though made at and as of the Effective Time (except to the extent that such representation and warranty is expressly made as of a specified date, in which case such representation and warranty must be correct as of such specific date):each of the representations and warranties of the [PARTY B] listed in this agreement (other than the representations and warranties of the [PARTY B] listed in [COMPANY CAPITALIZATION REPRESENTATION] and [AUTHORITY REPRESENTATION] representations) must be correct (without giving effect to any limitation as to materiality or [PARTY B] Material Adverse Effect listed therein), except where the failure to be correct has not had or would not reasonably be expected to have a [PARTY B] Material Adverse Effect;each of the representations and warranties of the [PARTY B] listed in the [COMPANY CAPITALIZATION REPRESENTATION] and [AUTHORITY REPRESENTATION] representations must be correct in all material respects; andthe representations and warranties listed in the [PARTY B]'s [COMPANY'S ABSENCE OF CERTAIN CHANGE REPRESENTATION] representation must be true and correct in all respects.Performance of Obligations of [PARTY B]. The [PARTY B] must have performed in all material respects all covenants and agreements required by it under this agreement at or prior to the Closing Date.No Material Adverse Effect. Since the date of this agreement, there must not have occurred any event, development, change, effect, or occurrence that, individually or in the aggregate, has had, or would reasonably be expected to have, a [PARTY B] Material Adverse Effect.Officer's Certificate. The [PARTY A] must have received a certificate signed by the [PARTY B], certifying the satisfaction by the [PARTY B] of the above [REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES CONDITION], [PERFORMANCE OF OBLIGATIONS OF THE COMPANY CONDITION], and [NO MATERIAL ADVERSE EFFECT CONDITION] conditions.Required Financial Information. The [PARTY A] must have received the Required Financial Information, as listed in the [COMPANY FINANCING COOPERATION SUBCLAUSE] subclause.

name: Standard
description: Conditions Precedent to [PARTY B]'s Obligations. The obligation of the [PARTY B] to effect this [AGREEMENT] is also subject to the satisfaction, or waiver by the [PARTY B], at or prior to the [EFFECTIVE TIME OF THE AGREEMENT] of the following conditions:[ENUMERATED LIST OF CONDITIONS]

name: Merger Agreement
description: CompareConditions Precedent to [PARTY B]'s Obligation to Effect Merger. The obligations of the [PARTY B] to effect the Merger are also subject to the satisfaction, or waiver by the [PARTY B], at or prior to the Effective Time of the following conditions:Representations and Warranties.
