Describe what work is added or removed.>Schedule<How does this change affect the timeline of the schedule? List the duration in days. Describe any major milestone target date modifications or if the end date of the schedule has changed.>Resources<Define the staff needs or adjustments required for this change.>Budget<State the cost to complete this change.Assumptions<List any business and/or technical assumptions for this change.>RiskRisk with Implementing the Change<List any risks associated with implementing the change.>Risk with Not Implementing the Change<List any risks associated with not implementing the change>DeliverablesList any new deliverablesOther<If applicable - state any other factors, such as impact on other interrelated projects.>Recommended Action<List in bullet form, the action steps needed to carry out the change.>Other relevant informationAlternative Solutions<Optional Section - List any alternative solutions if applicable.>Employment Authorization Verification and Indemnification<Optional Section - As applicable, this language is to be included for any off-shore resource assigned to work in the United States.>The responsibility for completion of Employment Eligibility Verification Forms I-9 for all individuals providing services under this CO rests solely with their employer, _______________. ____________ will in fact fully and properly complete Forms I-9 for all such individuals providing services under this CO. _____________ shall not provide individuals to Client who it knows or has reason to believe are unauthorized to work for _______________ in the United States. _____________ shall also indemnify Client for any fines or penalties assessed against Client by the U.S. Government with regard to the knowing hiring of unauthorized workers and/or Form I-9 compliance paperwork violations, as well as any legal fees incurred by Client in defense of a related investigation by any branch of the U.S. Government.This Change Order (as incorporated into the Statement of Work) embodies the entire understanding between ____________ and Client, and there are no contracts, understandings, conditions, or representations, oral or written, with reference to the subject matter hereof which are not merged herein. Except as otherwise specifically stated, no modification hereto, including without limitation, subsequently issued invoices or purchase orders (even if they so state that they supersede prior agreements with respect to the subject matter stated in this Change Order) shall be of any force or effect unless (a) reduced to writing and signed by both parties hereto, and (b) expressly referred to as being a modification of this Change Order.Unless otherwise agreed to in writing by Client, the Services that are the subject of this Change Order shall not begin and Supplier will not be paid for any Services performed before the execution of this Change Order by both parties.This Change Order has been executed by the parties, acting by and through their duly authorized representatives, in duplicate original, either of which may be deemed the original, but together constituting one agreement, and each party receiving one fully completed and executed duplicateSupplierBy:Name:Title:Date:ClientBy:Name:Title:Date:

name: Single Party Plan
description: Compare This plan has been signed by [PARTY A].[PARTY A NAME]Name: [PARTY A SIGNATORY NAME]Title: [PARTY A SIGNATORY TITLE]

name: SAAS Agreement — Service levels included in agreement
description: CompareThis agreement has been executed by the parties.[COMPANY NAME]By:Name:Title:[CUSTOMER NAME]By:Name:Title:EXHIBIT APremium Service Support1. Premium Support ServicesPremium Services Support ("Premium Support") services entitles the Customer to the following:(a) Telephone or electronic support in order to help the Customer locate and correct problems with the Software.(b) Bug fixes and code corrections to correct Software malfunctions in order to bring the Service into substantial conformity with the operating specifications.(c) All extensions, enhancements and other changes that the Company makes or adds to the Service and which the Company offers, without charge, to all other Subscribers of the Service.(4) Up to [NUMBER OF DEDICATED CONTACTS] dedicated contacts designated by the Customer in writing that will have access to support services.2. Response and Resolution Goals2.1 Severity 1: The Production system / application is down, seriously impacted and there is no reasonable workaround currently.Upon confirmation of receipt, the Company will begin continuous work on the issue, and a customer resource must be available at any time to assist with problem determination.Once the issue is reproducible or once we have identified the Software defect, the Company support will provide reasonable effort for workaround or solution within 24 hours.2.2 Severity 2: The system or application is seriously affected. The issue is not critical and does not comply with the Severity 1 conditions. There is no workaround currently available or the workaround is cumbersome to use.The Company will work during normal business hours to provide reasonable effort for workaround or solution within 7 business days, once the issue is reproducible.2.3 Severity 3: The system or application is moderately affected. The issue is not critical and the system has not failed. The issue has been identified and does not hinder normal operation, or the situation may be temporarily circumvented using an available workaround.The Company will work during normal business hours to provide reasonable effort for workaround or solution within 10 business days, once the issue is reproducible.2.4 Severity 4: Non-critical issues.The Company will seek during normal business hours to provide a solution in future releases of the Service.SCHEDULE BSoftware Service and PricingThis Software Service and Pricing Schedule is effective upon the Software as a Service Agreement Effective Date, documents the Service (defined below) being purchased by ________________ ("Customer") under the terms and conditions of the Software as a Service Agreement.1. Services2. TermThe term begins upon the Schedule Effective Date and ends _____________ year (s) thereafter ("Subscription Term").3. Subscription FeeThe total value of this Schedule is $ _______. Upon execution of this Schedule, the Company shall issue an invoice in accordance with the Software as a Service Agreement.4. Customer Billing InformationBilling Department Name:Billing Department Address:Contact Name:Contact Phone number:Contact email:5. Premium SupportPremium Support is [not] included in the Subscription Fee.

name: Escrow Agreement
description: Compare This agreement has been signed by the parties.[PARTY A NAME]Name: [PARTY A SIGNATORY NAME]Title: [PARTY A SIGNATORY TITLE][PARTY B NAME]Name: [PARTY B SIGNATORY NAME]Title: [PARTY B SIGNATORY TITLE][ESCROW AGENT NAME]Name: [ESCROW AGENT SIGNATORY NAME]Title: [ESCROW AGENT SIGNATORY TITLE]

name: Signature
description: CompareSigned:(President) or (Chairman)

name: Standand
description: Permitted Uses. [PARTY B] may install and use the Licensed Software solely for [PARTY B]'s [personal, non-commercial][internal business] use.

name: Pro-Licensee
description: ComparePermitted UsesInstallation. You may install and use the number of copies of the Software that you purchased or for which you were granted a license.Evaluation Use. If you ordered an evaluation license, you may use the Software only for evaluation purposes and only during the applicable evaluation period. Any other use of the Software or beyond the applicable evaluation period is strictly prohibited.Server Deployment. You may install [NUMBER OF SERVER COPIES] of copies of the Software on an internal file server for purposes of downloading and installing the Software on licensed computers within the same internal network.Home Use. You may install a copy of the Software on a personal or home computer, provided both copies of the Software are not used at the same time.Backup and Archival Copies. You may make one copy of the Software solely for backup or archival purposes.

name: Product Resale, Distribution, and Supply Agreements
description: End User SupportDistributor Responsibility. [PARTY B] shall be responsible forobtaining orders from end users,providing First-Level Support,training end users to use Products, andhandling all other interactions with end users in the Territory relating to the Products.Understanding of Products. [PARTY B] shall maintain a sufficient level of understanding of the Products to enable it toprovide basic technical information to end users regarding the Products,effectively sell and service the Products, andobtain orders from and provide assistance to end users in determining and fulfilling their Products requirements.No Other Company Obligations. [PARTY A] will not have any other obligations to respond to or otherwise interact with any end users in the Territory.

name: Enforcement
description: Enforcement. Each party hereby acknowledges that it is entering into this agreement and assuming its obligations under this agreementto induce the other party's entering into and performance of this agreement, andinduced by the other party's entering into and performance of this agreement.

name: Engagement
description: Engagement. [Effective [CONSULTING START DATE], ]Company retains the Consultant and the Consultant agrees to provide Company with [[DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES]/consulting services described in the attached Statement of Work] (the "Services").

name: Investment Bank Engagement Letter
description: EngagementParties' Bargain. In connection with the investigation, solicitation, preparation, and facilitation of a Financing Transaction or Sale Transaction (either one, a "Contemplated Transaction") for [PARTY A]:[PARTY B] hereby agrees to provide [PARTY A] the investment banking services and advice listed in section [SERVICES]; and[PARTY A] hereby agrees to pay [PARTY B] the fees provided for in this agreement.DefinitionsFinancing Transaction. "Financing Transaction" means the possible placement of senior secured debt, unsecured or non-senior debt or preferred shares, or equity.Sale Transaction. "Sale Transaction" means a sale transaction involving a merger or exchange offer, leveraged recapitalization, acquisition or sale of assets or equity interests, or similar transaction involving all or a majority of [PARTY A]'s business, assets, or equity interests.

name: Short form
description: Entire Agreement. This agreement represents the entire understanding between the parties with respect to its subject matter and supersedes any previous communication or agreements that may exist.

name: Standard
description: CompareEntire Agreement. The parties intend that this agreement, together with all attachments, schedules, exhibits, and other documents that both are referenced in this agreement and refer to this agreement,represent the final expression of the parties' intent relating to the subject matter of this agreement,contain all the terms the parties agreed to relating to the subject matter, andreplace all of the parties' previous discussions, understandings, and agreements relating to the subject matter of this agreement.

name: Entire Taking
description: Entire Taking. If all of the Premises or Parking Spaces required for reasonable access to, or use of, the Premises are taken by eminent domain, this Lease shall automatically terminate on the date title vests.

name: Pro-Lessee
description: CompareEntire TakingTaking. If the Premises shall be taken or condemned for any public purpose, or purchased under threat of such taking, to such an extent as to materially and adversely affect Tenant's ability to operate its business within the Premises, in Tenant's reasonable judgment, this Lease shall forthwith cease and terminate as of the date title vests in the condemning authority or the date the condemning authority takes possession, whichever shall occur first.Negotiations. In any negotiations for the sale of the Premises under threat of condemnation, Landlord shall keep Tenant informed of the status and substance of the negotiations, copy Tenant on all correspondence and written communications sent and received by Landlord, permit Tenant to attend meetings and teleconferences as an observer; Landlord further agrees to consult with Tenant before agreeing to final disposition of the Premises, but such consultation is not binding on Landlord.

name: Verification of Compliance
description: Right of InspectionInspection. On reasonable notice from [PARTY A], [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] access to the Premise during normal business hours to inspect and verify that [PARTY B] is in compliance with the terms of this agreement, and cooperate with [PARTY A]'s verification.Conduct of Inspection. [PARTY A] shall conduct any inspection in a manner so as not to unreasonably disrupt [PARTY B]'s business, and restrict the scope, manner, and duration of its inspection to only what is reasonably necessary to verify compliance.Confidentiality of Inspection Information. [PARTY A] shall keep confidential any information it obtains from any inspection, except as may be required to exercise its rights under this lease.

name: Right of Entry
description: CompareEntry by [PARTY A] Right to Enter. [PARTY A] and its agents may enter the Premiseat any time, in the case of an emergency,at reasonable times to inspect, clean, or make alterations, repairs, improvements, or additions to the Premise or to the building that [PARTY A] deems necessary, andon 48 hours notice, to show the Premise to prospective purchasers, lenders, or tenants.No Abatement of Rent. [PARTY B] will not be entitled to any abatement of Rent or damages because of [PARTY A]'s entry under this section.

name: Lease Agreements
description: Environmental MattersCompliance with Environmental Laws. [PARTY B] will not use the Premise, or permit the Premise to be used, in a manner that violates any applicable environmental Law including Laws related to air or water quality or emissions, the handling, transportation, storage, treatment, usage, or disposal of toxic or hazardous substances, or any other environmental matters. Notice of Environmental Concerns. [PARTY B] shall promptly notify [PARTY A] of any spills, releases, or other potential failures to comply with applicable environmental Law.Inspection of Premise. [PARTY A], its officers, employees, contractors, or agents, may inspect the Premise, including [PARTY B]s records related to environmental compliance, and conduct any sampling or tests necessary to verify [PARTY B]'s compliance with environmental Law.Remedying Noncompliance or Contamination. If [PARTY B] is found to be in violation of this agreement or any environmental Law, or if any [PARTY A] detects any environmental contamination, [PARTY B] shall be responsible for all costs associated with remedying that noncompliance or contamination.Indemnification Regarding Environmental MattersIndemnification Obligations. [PARTY B] shall indemnify and defend [PARTY A], and [PARTY A]'s officers, directors, employees, contractors, and agents against all losses or damages arising from any environmental contamination or noncompliance with environmental Law resulting from [PARTY B]'s operations, or operations by [PARTY B]'s agents, employees, contractors, or invitees.Time Limitations for Indemnification. [PARTY B]'s indemnification obligations under this section will survive the expiration or termination of this agreement.

name: [PARTY A]
description: Environmental Matters. Except as would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY A]:No Notice or Order. The [PARTY A] has not received any written notice, Order, complaint, or penalty related to any environmental Laws;No Proceedings. The [PARTY A] is not subject to any judicial, administrative, or other actions, suits, or proceedings pending or, to the [PARTY A]'s knowledge, threatened, alleging it or any of its Subsidiaries has violated, or is subject to liability under, any environmental Laws; Permits. The [PARTY A] and each of its Subsidiaries have all environmental Permits necessary to comply with all applicable environmental Laws, and are in compliance with the terms of such Permits; Operations. The [PARTY A]'s operations and those of its Subsidiaries are and have been in compliance with all applicable environmental Laws; and No Hazardous Materials. To the [PARTY A]'s knowledge, there have been no releases of hazardous materials at any of the [PARTY A]'s currently or formerly owned, leased or operated real property, or that of any of its Subsidiaries, that would reasonably be expected to result in material liability to the [PARTY A] or any of its Subsidiaries under applicable environmental Law.

name: [PARTY B]
description: Compare Environmental Matters. Except as would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY B]:No Notice or Order. The [PARTY B] has not received any written notice, Order, complaint, or penalty related to any environmental Laws;No Proceedings. The [PARTY B] is not subject to any judicial, administrative, or other actions, suits, or proceedings pending or, to the [PARTY B]'s knowledge, threatened, alleging it or any of its Subsidiaries has violated, or is subject to liability under, any environmental Laws; Permits. The [PARTY B] and each of its Subsidiaries have all environmental Permits necessary to comply with all applicable environmental Laws, and are in compliance with the terms of such Permits; Operations. The [PARTY B]'s operations and those of its Subsidiaries are and have been in compliance with all applicable environmental Laws; and No Hazardous Materials. To the [PARTY B]'s knowledge, there have been no releases of hazardous materials at any of the [PARTY B]'s currently or formerly owned, leased or operated real property, or that of any of its Subsidiaries, that would reasonably be expected to result in material liability to the [PARTY B] or any of its Subsidiaries under applicable environmental Law.

name: Equal Rights and Privileges
description: Equal Rights and Privileges.Equal Rights and Privileges. All Eligible Employees of the Company (or of any Designated Subsidiary) will have equal rights and privileges under the Plan so that the Plan qualifies as an "employee stock purchase plan" within the meaning of Section 423 of the Code or applicable Treasury Regulations under this Agreement.Reformation of Plan to Conform to Section 423 of Internal Revenue Code. Any provision of the Plan that is inconsistent with Section 423 or applicable Treasury Regulations under this Agreement will, without further act or amendment by the Company, the Board or the Administrator, be reformed to comply with the equal rights and privileges requirement of Section 423 or applicable Treasury Regulations under this Agreement.

name: Standard
description: Equipment. [Subject to [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule,] [PARTY B] shall maintain sole control and ownership of all equipment, instruments, and materials it uses in connection with providing the [DELIVERABLE].

name: Limited to Breach of Specific Obligations
description: Equitable ReliefAcknowledgment of Irreparable Harm. Each party acknowledges that their breach or threatened breach of their obligations under this agreement would result in irreparable harm to the other party that cannot be adequately relieved by money damages alone.Intent to Allow for Equitable Remedies. Accordingly, the parties hereby acknowledge their mutual intent that after any breach of the obligations listed in the paragraph directly above, the non-breaching party may request any applicable equitable remedies from a court, including injunctive relief, without the need for that party to post any security.

name: Any Breach
description: CompareEquitable ReliefAcknowledgment of Irreparable Harm. The parties acknowledge that breach or threatened breach of any of the obligations in this agreement would result in irreparable harm to the non-breaching party that cannot be adequately relieved solely by monetary damages.Intent to Allow for Equitable Remedies. Accordingly, the parties intend, and hereby agree that after such breach, the non-breaching party may request from a court any applicable equitable remedies, including injunctive relief, without the need to post any security.

name: Robust Equitable Relief Language
description: CompareEquitable Relief. The parties acknowledge that if either party violates the specific obligations of this agreement, it could lead the other party to suffer irreparable harm, that is, harm for which monetary damages would be an inadequate remedy. Further, the parties acknowledge that if in order to obtain [TYPE OF EQUITABLE RELIEF REQUESTED] the injured party was required to prove irreparable harm, the delay needed to prove irreparable harm could increase the harm the injured party would suffer. Therefore, parties intend that if either party violates the specific obligations of this agreement, then for the purposes of determining whether to grant equitable relief any court should assume that that violation would cause injured party irreparable harm.

name: Equity Compensation
description: Equity Compensation. The Executive may, at the Company's discretion, be eligible to participate in such equity incentive plans that the Company may establish from time to time.

name: Pro-Employee
description: CompareLong-Term Incentive Plans. The Executive will participate in any long-term incentive plans, including stock option plans, that the Company may adopt from time to time on a basis no less favorable than that provided to any other executive officer.

name: ERISA Plan
description: ERISA Plan. The parties hereby acknowledge their mutual intent that this [agreement / plan] is intended to bean employee welfare plan as defined in Section 3(1) of ERISA, anda "top-hat" plan maintained for the benefit of a select group of management or highly compensated employees of [PARTY A].

name: Standard
description: Escrow Agent's DutiesKeep Escrow Materials Safe. The Escrow Agent shall retain the [DELIVERABLE] in a safe and secure environment.Specified Obligations Only. The Escrow Agent will have only the obligations specifically listed in this agreement.

name: Robust: Merger and Acquisition Language
description: CompareEscrow Agent's DutiesKeep Escrow Materials Safe The Escrow Agent shall retain the [DELIVERABLE] in a safe and secure environment.Specified Obligations Only. The Escrow Agent will have only the obligations specifically listed in this agreement.Degree of Care. The Escrow Agent shall exercise the degree of care with respect to the [DELIVERABLE] that it would for its own property, but in no case less than an reasonable degree of care.No Fiduciary Duty. The Escrow Agent does not owe any fiduciary duties to any of the parties.No Legal Actions. The Escrow Agent will not be required to take any legal or other action under this agreement that might, in its judgment, involve or cause it to incur any expense or liability, unless it is provided with acceptable indemnification.

name: Standard + Copies Permitted
description: CompareEscrow Agent's DutiesKeep Escrow Materials Safe. The Escrow Agent shall retain the [DELIVERABLE] in a safe and secure environment.Specified Obligations Only. The Escrow Agent will have only the obligations specifically listed in this agreement.Necessary Copies Permitted. The Escrow Agent may make copies of the [DELIVERABLE] if and to the extend necessary for the purposes of this agreement.

name: Standard
description: Escrow Agent's Liability. The Escrow Agent will not be liable for any losses or damages arising out of its performance of its obligations under this agreement (including omissions), except for liability arising out of its willful misconduct on gross negligence.

name: Robust: Merger and Acquisition Language
description: CompareEscrow Agent's LiabilitiesNot a Party. The Escrow Agent is not a party to any of the agreements referred to or described in this agreement (including the [Underlying Agreement]).Extent of Escrow Agent's LiabilityLiability for Gross Negligence and Willful Misconduct. Escrow Agent will only be liable for losses, damages, or expenses to the parties that result from its gross negligence or willful misconduct.No Liability for Acts or Omissions Made in Good Faith and Reasonable Care. The Escrow Agent will not be liable for any losses, damages, or expenses resulting from any act or omission it makes in good faith and exercising reasonable care.No Liability for Acts or Omissions Made in Reliance. The Escrow Agent will not be liable for any losses, damages, or expenses resulting from any act or omission it makes in good faith reliance onany instruction or information it receives from [PARTY A] or [PARTY B],any instrument it reasonably believes to be genuine and to have been signed or presented by the parties,the identity and authority of any Person purporting to be or act on behalf of any party to this agreement, orthe advice of legal counsel retained in connection with this agreement.No Liability for Compliance with Laws and OrdersConflicts Between Instructions and Laws. If the Escrow Agent receives any instructions, commands, or warnings from any other party which conflicts with any Law, Order, or other final, non-appealable judgment by any Governmental Authority with relevant jurisdiction, the Escrow Agent shall comply with such Law, Order, or judgment so entered or issued, which it is advised by legal counsel of its own choosing is binding on it.Compliance with Court Order. If any [DELIVERABLE] are or become attached, garnished, or levied by, or if the delivery of any [DELIVERABLE] is stayed or enjoined by, any court Order, any Order, judgment or decree is made or entered by any court Order affecting the [DELIVERABLE],the  Escrow Agent shall comply with all writs, orders, or decrees so entered or issued, which it is advised by legal counsel of its own choosing is binding on it.No Liability. Under either of the above paragraphs [CONFLICTS BETWEEN INSTRUCTIONS AND LAWS] or [COMPLIANCE WITH COURT ORDER], the Escrow Agent will not be liable for any resulting damages, losses, or expenses to [PARTY A] or [PARTY B] resulting from the Escrow Agent complying with that Law, Order, or judgment, even if that Law, Order, or judgment is subsequently reversed, modified, annulled, set aside, vacated, or found to have been entered without jurisdiction.No Liability for Unforeseeable Losses. The Escrow Agent will not be liable for any losses, damages, or expenses of any party that were remote, speculative, or otherwise unforeseeable on entering into this agreement.Cap on Liability. The Escrow Agent's total liability under this agreement will not exceed $[MAXIMUM LIABILITY].No Implied Notice. The Escrow Agent will not be deemed to have notice or Knowledge of any fact or circumstance not specifically listed in this agreement.

name: Robust
description: CompareEscrow Agent's LiabilitiesNot a Party. The Escrow Agent is not a party to any of the agreements referred to or described in this agreement (including the [Underlying Agreement]).Liability for Gross Negligence and Willful Misconduct. The Escrow Agent will only be liable for losses, damages, or expenses to the parties that result from the Escrow Agent's gross negligence or willful misconduct.No Liability for Unforeseeable Losses. The Escrow Agent will not be liable for any losses, damages, or expenses of any party that were remote, speculative, or otherwise unforeseeable on entering into this agreement.No Implied Notice. The Escrow Agent will not be deemed to have notice or Knowledge of any fact or circumstance not specifically listed in this agreement.Cap on Liability. The Escrow Agent's total liability under this agreement will not exceed $[MAXIMUM LIABILITY].

name: Software Development Agreement
description: Escrow of Source CodeDelivery of Object Code. [PARTY A] will be required to provide the [DELIVERABLE] to [PARTY B] in object code form only.Escrow of Source Code. Within [ESCROW DELIVERY DAYS] Business Days' after delivering the object code of the [DELIVERABLE] to [PARTY B], [PARTY A] shall deposit one copy, on [PARTY B]'s behalf, of the [DELIVERABLE] in source code with an escrow agent specializing in software escrows who the parties agree on in writing.Updates of Source Code. If [PARTY A] makes any updates, enhancements, or modifications to the [DELIVERABLE], [PARTY A] shall promptly deposit one copy, on [PARTY B]'s behalf, of that update, enhancement, or modification, and any documentation related to the update, enhancement, or modification, to the escrow agent.Upkeep of Escrow Account. [PARTY B] shall pay all fees necessary to establish and maintain the escrow.Contingent License. [PARTY A] hereby grants to [PARTY B] a contingent license to receive the source code from the escrow agent and to use the source code to support its use of the [DELIVERABLE] in machine-readable form if [PARTY A]whether directly or through a successor or affiliate, ceases to be in the software business,fails to fulfill its obligations to maintain the [DELIVERABLE] as provided in this agreement,becomes insolvent or admits insolvency or a general inability to pay its debts as they become due, files a petition for protection under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code, or an involuntary petition is filed against it and is not dismissed within 60 Business Days, or comes under the control of a competitor of [PARTY B].

name: Software License Agreement
description: CompareSource Code Escrow. On [PARTY B]'s written request, [PARTY A] shall place the source code for the Software into escrow with [ESCROW COMPANY NAME] (the "Escrow Company") for [PARTY B]'s benefit, subject to [PARTY B]'s execution of (and the terms and conditions of) [PARTY A]'s standard form of Software Escrow Agreement with Escrow Company and [PARTY B]'s payment of all applicable escrow fees.

name: Standard
description: Establish Escrow Account. On or before the [Effective Date / commencement of the Offering / Closing Date], the parties shall establish an escrow account with [PARTY C], and name the account as follows (the "Escrow Account"): [FULL TITLE OF ESCROW ACCOUNT].

name: Standard
description: Estoppel CertificatesProvide Certificates. On [10] days notice from the other party, either party shall execute and deliver to the other party a certificate stating that this agreement is unmodified and in full force and effect, or in full force and effect as modified, and stating the modification,the Rent, the dates to which rent has been paid in advance, and the Security Deposit or prepaid Rent, if any, and that there are not, to that party's knowledge, any uncured Defaults on the part of the other party, or specifying existing Defaults.Deemed Conclusions for Failure to Deliver. If a party fails to deliver a certificate the other party requests, that failure will be deemed conclusive on the party failing to deliver the certificate that this agreement is in full force and effect, that there are not uncured Defaults under this agreement, and that this agreement not been modified except as may be represented by the party requesting the certificate.

name: European Patents
description: European Patents. Where the assignment concerns European patents and patent applications, Assignor does hereby declare that it is the owner of said Assigned Patents and that Assignor has assigned same, along with all rights and duties , to Assignee and agree that the assignment will be recorded in the register with the European Patent Office; and Assignee hereby declares that Assignee has agreed to the assignment of the aforementioned Assigned Patents to it and that Assignee will simultaneously apply for recording of the assignment in the register with the European Patent Office.

name: Alternative 1
description: Evaluation Factors. [COMPANY NAME] will rate proposals based on the following factors, with cost being the most important factor:Responsiveness to the requirements set forth in this Request for ProposalRelevant past performance/experienceSamples of workCost, including an assessment of the total cost of ownershipTechnical expertise/experience of bidder and bidder’s staff[COMPANY NAME] reserves the right to award to the bidder that presents the best value to [COMPANY NAME] as determined solely by [COMPANY NAME] in its discretion

name: Cancellation and Termination Fees
description: Termination FeesEarly Termination by [PARTY B]. If [PARTY B] cancels the Event more than [NON-CANCELLATION PERIOD] Business Days' from the Event Date, [PARTY A] shall return the full amount of any deposits and pre-payments of Compensation [PARTY B] made according to the fee schedule in [ATTACHMENT].Late Termination by [PARTY B]. If [PARTY B] cancels the Event less than [NON-CANCELLATION PERIOD] Business Days' from the Event Date, [PARTY B] will be deemed to forfeit the full amount of any deposits and pre-payments of Compensation it made according to the fee schedule in [ATTACHMENT].Early Termination by [PARTY A]. If [PARTY A] terminates this agreement for any reason (unless it is for a material breach by [PARTY B]) more than [NON-CANCELLATION PERIOD] Business Days' from the Event Date, [PARTY A] shall return the full amount of any deposits and pre-payments of Compensation [PARTY B] made according to the fee schedule in [ATTACHMENT] within [10] Business Days' of the termination.Late Termination by [PARTY A]. If [PARTY A] terminates this agreement for any reason (unless it is for a material breach by [PARTY B]) less than [NON-CANCELLATION PERIOD] Business Days' from the Event Date, [PARTY A] shall return the full amount of any deposits and pre-payments of Compensation [PARTY B] made according to the fee schedule in [ATTACHMENT], and an additional $[TERMINATION FEE] within [10] Business Days' of the termination.Liquidated Damages. The parties hereby acknowledgethat the damages [PARTY B] would suffer if [PARTY A] terminated this agreement less than [NON-CANCELLATION PERIOD] Business Days' from the Event Date would be serious but hard to calculate, andtherefore, that the fee required under paragraph [LATE TERMINATION BY PARTY A] is not intended as a penalty to [PARTY A], but intended as a reasonable estimation of [PARTY B]'s damages that would result from [PARTY A]'s late termination.

name: Event Details
description: Event Details. Unless the parties agree otherwise in writing, [PARTY A] shall provide the [DELIVERABLE]at [ADDRESS OF VENUE] (the "Event Venue"),on [DATE, MONTH] (the "Event Date"),beginning at [START TIME], and for a period of [DURATION HOURS] (the "Event Time"), and for an estimated [INITIAL ESTIMATE OF GUESTS], to be finalized according to section [ATTENDANCE] (together, [PARTY B]'s event at the time, date, and venue listed in this section is the "Event").

name: Standard
description: Event FoodOnly [PARTY A] Food. [PARTY B] will only use food provided by [PARTY A] for the Event[, except for specialty cakes [PARTY A] agree to in writing].No Outside Food. [PARTY B] shall use reasonable efforts to ensure Event guests do not bring outside food to the Event,dispose of any outside food Event guests bring to the Event, and[except for leftovers taken off-premise after the Event,] ensure Event guests do not take event food off-premise.Compliance with Food and Beverage Laws. [PARTY A] shall ensure that all federal, state, and local Laws related to food and beverage purchases and consumption are strictly enforced.

name: Standard
description: PersonnelAmount of Personnel. [PARTY A] shall provide the appropriate amount of personnel necessary and desirable to provide the [DELIVERABLE] to the Final Estimated Attendance.Dress of Personnel. [PARTY A] shall use reasonable efforts to ensure its personnel is dressed appropriately,as agreed on by the parties in [ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement, for the duration Event.Increase in PersonnelOption to Increase Personnel. [PARTY A] may increase or decrease the number of personnel if the actual attendance at the Event is 10% higher or lower than the Final Estimated Attendance.Changes in Costs. [PARTY A] shall adjust the Compensation to account for any changes to the amount of personnel, making these adjustments at [PARTY A]'s staffing rates listed in the fee schedule listed in the [ATTACHMENT].

name: Event Rentals
description: Event RentalsRentals from [PARTY A]. [PARTY A] shall be responsible for set-up and safety of all equipment [PARTY B] rents from [PARTY A] for the Event.Non-Rentals and Rentals from Third Parties. [PARTY B] shall be responsible for set-up and safety of all equipment it provides or is renting from a third party for the Event.

name: [PARTY B] responsible for security
description: Event Security. [PARTY B] shall provide the security personnel and mechanisms the parties agree to in writing.

name: [PARTY A] responsible for security
description: CompareEvent Security. [PARTY A] shall provide the security personnel and mechanisms the parties agree to in writing.

name: Events of Default
description: Defaults. The following events shall be Events of Default: The occurrence of an Event of Default (as defined in the Notes) under the Notes; Any representation or warranty of the Company in this Agreement or in the Loan Agreement shall prove to have been incorrect in any material respect when made; The failure by the Company to observe or perform any of its obligations hereunder or in the Loan Agreement for ten (10) days after receipt by the Company of notice of such failure from the Secured Party; and Any breach of, or default under the terms of this Agreement.

name: Events Serving Alcohol
description: Alcohol Permits, Licenses, Registrations, and TrainingsRequired Permits, Licenses, and Registrations. [PARTY A] shall ensure that it and all its personnel responsible for serving alcohol will maintain all approvals, licenses, filing, registrations, and permits required by Law in connection with serving alcohol.Certified Training. [PARTY A] shall ensure that all its employees responsible for serving alcoholic beverages have completed TIPS certified alcohol server training and provide proof of training at the Event.

name: Except as set forth in this Agreement with respect to Covered Data as defin
description: 2. Except as set forth in this Agreement with respect to Covered Data as defined herein, nothing in this Agreement modifies any other agreements that may be in place between or among Parties hereto. However, this Agreement supersedes the 2012 UDSA and the Bridge Data Sharing Policy.

name: Mutual exchange of Information
description: Exchange of Information. The parties agree to exchange Confidential Information for the purpose of [DESCRIBE PURPOSE] (the "Purpose") in accordance with this agreement.

name: One-way disclosure
description: CompareDisclosure of Information. [PARTY A] (the disclosing party) agrees to disclose Confidential Information to [PARTY B] (the receiving party) for the purpose of [DESCRIBE PURPOSE] (the "Purpose") in accordance with the terms of this agreement.

name: Employee access to information
description: CompareAccess to Information. Employee acknowledges that during the course of employment, Employee will have access to or may develop Confidential Information on behalf of the Company or its clients and prospects.

name: Standard
description: Excluded Assets. The Purchased Assets do not include, and the [PARTY A] is not acquiring under this agreement (collectively, the "Excluded Assets"):any of the capital stock of the [PARTY B];any Employee Benefit Plan, or any interest in or right under such plan;the [PARTY B]'s capital stock records, corporate minute books, bank account records, and Tax Returns;the [PARTY B]'s cash, cash-equivalents, and securities; andany other asset identified in the [SECTION] of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule.

name: Standard
description: Excluded Liabilities. The [PARTY A] is not assuming and will not be liable for any Liabilities:of the Business;of the [PARTY B]; orrelated to the Purchased Assets, other than the Assumed Liabilities outlined in the [ASSUMED LIABILITIES] subclause above.

name: Exclusions
description: Exclusions from Indemnity. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to indemnify [PARTY B] in connection with any of the following Indemnifiable Proceedings. Insurance. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to indemnify [PARTY B] in connection with proceedings for which payment has actually been made to [PARTY B] or on [PARTY B]'s behalf under any insurance policy or other indemnity provision, except for any excess amounts beyond what was paid under any insurance policy or other indemnity provision.Excluded Acts or Omissions. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to indemnify [PARTY B] in connection with proceedings that may not be indemnified against or otherwise relieved of liability for under applicable Law.Unauthorized Settlements. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to indemnify [PARTY B] in connection with proceedings for which any settlement amounts have already been paid, unless [PARTY A] consents to the settlement in writing.Section 16(b) of Exchange Act. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to indemnify [PARTY B] in connection with proceedings arising out ofan accounting of profits [PARTY B] made from buying and selling (or selling and buying) [PARTY A] securities within the meaning of Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act or similar provisions of state statutory Law or common Law, orany reimbursement of [PARTY A] by [PARTY B] of any bonus or other incentive-based or equity-based compensation or of any profits [PARTY A] realized from selling [PARTY A] securities, as required in each case under the Exchange Act.Claim Initiated by [PARTY B]. [PARTY A] will not be obligated to indemnify [PARTY B] in connection with proceedings (or any part of any proceeding) [PARTY B] initiates, including any proceedings (or any part of any proceeding) [PARTY B] initiates against [PARTY A], its directors, officers, employees, or other indemnitees, unless[PARTY A]'s Board authorized the proceeding (or any part of any proceeding) prior to its initiation or[PARTY A] provides the indemnification, in its sole discretion, under the powers vested in [PARTY A] under applicable Law.

name: Exclusion from Warranty
description: Exclusions from Warranty. [PARTY A]'s warranties under this agreement exclude any claims by [PARTY B] based on defects in the [DELIVERABLE] caused by [PARTY B], or by third parties beyond [PARTY A]'s control.

name: Exclusive Remedy — Broad
description: Exclusive Remedy. Each party's right to [INDEMNIFICATION, LIQUIDATED DAMAGES, REPLACEMENT, ETC.] is the exclusive remedy available in connection breach of this agreement, except for;Causes of action related to the [TAX CONSEQUENCES SUBCLAUSE, IN THE MERGER CLAUSE] subclause; and that Nothing in this [EXCLUSIVE REMEDIES SUBCLAUSE] subclause will limit either party’s right to seek and obtain any equitable relief as a remedy to the other party’s fraud.

name: Exclusive Remedy — License Agreement
description: CompareExclusive Remedy. Licensee's exclusive remedy and Licensor's entire liability for breach of this Agreement shall be limited, at Licensor's sole and exclusive discretion, to:Replacement: of any defective Software or documentation; orRefund: of the license fee paid to Licensor, payable in accordance with Licensor's refund policy.

name: Exclusive Remedy — Indemnification
description: CompareExclusive Remedy. Each party's right to indemnification is the exclusive remedy available in connection to indemnifiable proceedings, except for;Causes of action related to the [TAX CONSEQUENCES SUBCLAUSE] subclause; and that Nothing in this [EXCLUSIVE REMEDIES SUBCLAUSE] subclause will limit either party’s right to seek and obtain any equitable relief as a remedy to the other party’s fraud.

name: Standard
description: ExclusivityNo Alternative Proposals. During the [LENGTH OF EXCLUSIVITY OBLIGATIONS] period beginning on the date of this agreement (the "Exclusivity Period"), [PARTY B] will not, directly or indirectly: solicit, initiate, or encourage submission of any Alternative Proposal;participate in any negotiations regarding, furnish any non-public information with respect to, or otherwise further cooperate in any way with, assist, participate in, facilitate, or encourage any Alternative Proposal; orvote in favor of any Alternative Proposal.Conduct During Exclusivity PeriodLimited to Ordinary Course of Business. During the Exclusivity Period, [PARTY B] will not enter into any material transactions outside the ordinary course of business, consistent with its past practices.Cease Existing Discussions and Negotiations. [PARTY B] shall immediately cease any existing discussions or negotiations with any party other than [PARTY A] or its Affiliates that relate to, or may reasonably be expected to lead to:any transaction outside of its ordinary course of business, consistent with its past practices; orany Alternative Proposal.Notice to [PARTY A]Obligation. During the Exclusivity Period, [PARTY B] shall promptly notify [PARTY A] if it receives any Alternative Proposal.Contents of Notice. [PARTY B] shall include in such notice:a copy of the Alternative Proposal; andthe contents of any communications [PARTY B] makes in response.Termination of Exclusivity Period. If [PARTY A] notifies [PARTY B] in writing that it is terminating discussions regarding the potential Transaction, [PARTY B] may immediately terminate the Exclusivity Period, and all [PARTY B]'s exclusivity obligations under this clause will end. Alternative Proposal Definition. "Alternative Proposal" means any communications, inquires, or proposals from a party other than [PARTY A] related to any:merger, recapitalization, share exchange, or tender offer, involving [PARTY B], its Subsidiaries, or Affiliates;acquisition or purchase of all or a significant portion of the assets of, or any equity interest in, [PARTY B], its Subsidiaries, or Affiliates; orthe declaration or payment of any dividend or any change in the public debt or capital structure of [PARTY B], its Subsidiaries, or Affiliates.

name: Investment Bank Engagement Letter
description: CompareExclusivityExclusive Appointment. [PARTY A] will not, directly or indirectly employ or engage any other Person or entity, other than [PARTY B] to act as placement agent or underwriter for any Financing or Sale Transaction, or to perform any other financial advisory, underwriting, or investment banking services for [PARTY A] in connection with any Financing or Sale Transaction or any potential Financial or Sale Transaction.Notice of Contact. If [PARTY A], or to its Knowledge any of its Subsidiaries or Representatives, is contacted by any Person other than [PARTY B] concerning a Financing or Sale Transaction, [PARTY A] shall notify [PARTY B] and provide it with all relevant details of the contact.

name: Distribution Agreement — Limited exclusive period
description: Exclusivity Exclusive Distributor. During the period of [EXCLUSIVITY PERIOD MONTHS] months from the beginning of this agreement, [PARTY A] will not authorize or appoint any other Person to act as its distributor for the Products within the Territory.Exclusive Supplier. [PARTY B] will not obtain any Products for resale from any third party.

name: Execution of Documents
description: Execution of Documents. Subject to any limitation contained in the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, the President may, in the name and on behalf of the Corporation, execute and deliver any contract or other instrument authorized in writing by the Board of Directors.

name: Broad Officer Authority
description: CompareExecution of Documents. Subject to any limitation contained in the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, any officer of the Corporation may, in the name and on behalf of the Corporation, execute and deliver any contract or other instrument authorized in writing by the Board of Directors.

name: Standard
description: CompensationBase SalaryAmount. [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] a base salary ("Base Salary") of $[BASE SALARY] per year in equal installments in accordance with its standard payroll practices.Adjustments. [PARTY A] may increase[ or decrease] the Base Salary on one or more occasions.[Signing Bonus. [PARTY A] shall pay [PARTY B] a signing bonus of $[SIGNING BONUS AMOUNT] upon the signature of this agreement.]BonusEligibility. [PARTY A] may pay [PARTY B] an annual bonus, as determined in [PARTY A]'s discretion.Bonus Amount. [PARTY B] shall determine the performance goals for, the amount, if any, of, and any other conditions relating to, the bonus.Bonus Payment. [PARTY B] shall pay any bonus in one lump sum, subject to deductions and withholdings, during the year immediately following the year to which it relates.

name: Robust
description: CompareCompensation and BonusesBase SalaryInitial Base Salary. [PARTY A] shall pay to [PARTY B] a base salary, paid in accordance with [PARTY A]'s normal payroll practices at an annual rate of not less than $[500,000] (the "Base Salary").Review of Base Salary. [PARTY A][, acting through its Compensation Committee,] shall review the Base Salary, in accordance with its policies and practices, at least once per year.Adjustment of Base Salary. In connection with the review discussed in paragraph [REVIEW OF BASE SALARY] directly above, [PARTY A]:may increase [PARTY B]'s Base Salary; butmay not decrease [PARTY B]'s Base Salary, unless [PARTY B] agrees to such decrease in writing.Base Salary Definition. The term "Base Salary" will include any such increases (or decreases [PARTY B] agrees to in writing) to the Base Salary.Bonus AwardsEligible for Cash Incentive Programs. In addition to the Base Salary, subject to meeting certain performance goals, [PARTY B] will be eligible to receive bonuses and to participate in [PARTY A]'s annual cash incentive programs made available to [PARTY A]'s similarly-situated employees.Eligible for Mutual Fund Bonus Awards. In addition to the Base Salary and eligibility for cash incentive programs, subject to meeting certain performance goals, and in accordance with [PARTY A]'s [stock incentive plan], [PARTY B] will be eligible to receive mutual fund share bonus awards from [PARTY A].Long-Term Incentive Awards. In addition to the Base Salary and participation in the cash incentive programs and mutual fund bonus awards, [PARTY B] will be eligible toparticipate in [PARTY A]s long-term incentive programs made available to [PARTY A]'s similarly-situated employees, andto receive long-term incentive compensation awards, in such forms and in such amounts as determined by [PARTY A][, acting through its Compensation Committee,] and in accordance with the terms of [PARTY A]'s stock incentive plan.Performance Goals and Criteria for Awarding Bonuses. [PARTY A][, acting through its Compensation Committee,] shall establish the performance goals and other criteria related to the granting of any bonus awards under this section [BONUS AWARDS], and shall communicate these goals and criteria to [PARTY B].Payment of Bonuses. [PARTY A] shall pay all bonus amounts payable under this section [BONUS AWARDS] no later than [March 1st] of the year following the calendar year in which the applicable bonus is earned.

name: Executive Perquisites
description: Executive Perquisites. During the Term, the Executive shall receive such perquisites as are customarily provided to the Company's executive officers, subject to the changes the Company may periodically make.

name: Standard
description: Offerings Exempt from RegistrationSecurities Act Exemptions. To the extent that a Contemplated Transaction is designated as one to be made pursuant to an applicable exemption from registration under the Securities Act, [PARTY A] will not, directly or indirectly, make any offer or sale of any securities which would cause the Contemplated Transaction to fail to be entitled to the applicable exemption, or unreasonably limit the availability of a public registered offering of securities, or an offering of securities in which [PARTY B] will act.Regulation D. To the extent that a Contemplated Transaction is designated as one to be made pursuant to Regulation D under the Act, the parties shall cooperate to ensure the offer and sale of the securities comply with the requirements of Regulation D, including, without limitation:[PARTY A] will not offer or sell the securities by means of any form of general solicitation or general advertising, unless [PARTY B] agrees that there may be a public form of general solicitation, which consent may be withheld in [PARTY B]'s discretion;[PARTY A] will not offer or sell the securities to any Person who is not an "accredited investor" (as defined in Rule 501 under the Securities Act);to the extent any offer is made pursuant to Rule 506(c), the parties shall cooperate to obtain the necessary verifications that any investor is an accredited investor, as [PARTY A] determines necessary;[PARTY A] shall exercise reasonable care to assure that the purchasers of the securities are not underwriters within the meaning of Section 2(11) of the Securities Act and that such purchasers will comply with Rule 502(d) of the Securities Act;[PARTY A] shall obtain verification that none of its officers, directors (or equivalent), and 20% shareholders of [PARTY A] are not subject to the "bad boy" disqualifications listed in Rule 506(d); and[PARTY A] will not make any filings with the Commission with respect to the offer and sale of the securities without notifying [PARTY B].Representation. [PARTY A] represents and warrants to [PARTY B] that it has not, directly or indirectly, made any offers or sales of securities which would cause a Contemplated Transaction to fail to be entitled to the exemption from registration afforded by Section 4(2) of the Securities Act.Definitions. As used in this section [OFFERINGS EXEMPT FROM REGISTRATION], the terms "offer" and "sale" have the meanings specified in section 2(3) of the Securities Act.

name: Exercise of Voting Rights
description: Exercise of Voting RightsVoting Discretion. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, Proxy possesses and is entitled to exercise in their sole and absolute discretion, with respect to any and all of the Shares at any time covered by the Agreement, the right to vote the same or to consent to any and every act of Company in the same manner and to the same extent as if they were the absolute owners of such Shares in their own right.Actions Requiring Approval. Proxy is not authorized to take any of the following actions without the express written approval of Shareholder:the sale or disposal, in any manner, of capital assets or business of Company where an individual sale or disposition exceeds [25%] of the assets of Company or where sales or dispositions in the aggregate exceeds [45%] of the assets of Company,the pledging, mortgaging or encumbering of the assets of Company for purposes other than obtaining working capital or funds for capital improvements,any merger, consolidation, reorganization or dissolution of Company, orthe filing or making of any petition under the federal bankruptcy laws or any similar law or statute of any state or any foreign country.Action Upon Approval. Upon written request by Shareholder, Proxy shall take such action necessary to recommend, authorize, or approve the actions specified in Section 2.2. Proxy shall consult with Shareholder concerning such action so that the Shareholder may have sufficient information to ensure that all such actions will be taken in accordance with applicable laws. Any action of Proxy with respect to the matters specified in Section 2.2 that is taken without the approval of Shareholder shall be void and shall have no effect.Limitations on Liability. Proxy shall vote and act on all matters in accordance with their best judgment, but they assume no responsibility with respect to any action taken by them or taken in pursuance of their vote as cast. No Proxy shall incur any responsibility by reason of any error in law, mistake of judgment, or any matter or thing done, suffered, or omitted to be done under this Agreement, except for his or her own individual gross negligence or willful misconduct.

name: Broad Discretion
description: CompareExercise of Voting RightsVoting Discretion. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, Proxy possesses and is entitled to exercise in their sole and absolute discretion, with respect to any and all of the Shares at any time covered by the Agreement, the right to vote the same or to consent to any and every act of Company in the same manner and to the same extent as if they were the absolute owners of such Shares in their own right.Limitations on Liability. Proxy shall vote and act on all matters in accordance with their best judgment, but they assume no responsibility with respect to any action taken by them or taken in pursuance of their vote as cast. No Proxy shall incur any responsibility by reason of any error in law, mistake of judgment, or any matter or thing done, suffered, or omitted to be done under this Agreement, except for his or her own individual gross negligence or willful misconduct.

name: Exercise Right to Purchase Shares
description: Exercise Right To Purchase SharesPurchase of SharesAutomatic Purchase. Unless a Participant withdraws from this plan under section [WITHDRAWAL], on the Exercise Date a Participant's option to purchase shares of [PARTY A] common stock will automatically vest, and the maximum number of full shares subject to the option will be purchased for the Participant at the applicable Purchase Price with the accumulated payroll deductions from the Participant's account.Fractional SharesNo Fractional Shares Purchased. No fractional shares of [PARTY A] common stock will be purchased under this plan.Treatment of Funds Insufficient to Purchase a Full Share. Any payroll deductions accumulated in a Participant's account which are not sufficient to purchase a full share of [PARTY A] common stock will remain in the Participant's account for the subsequent Offering Period, unless the Participant withdrawals these shares earlier under section [WITHDRAWAL].Residual Funds. [PARTY A] shall return any other funds left over in a Participant's account after the Exercise Date to the Participant.Exclusivity of Right. During a Participant's lifetime, a Participant's option to purchase shares under this Agreement is exercisable only by Participant.Pro Rata Allocation. Notwithstanding any additional shares [PARTY A] is authorized to issue under this plan, if on a given Exercise Date, the number of shares of [PARTY A] common stock in connection with which options will be exercised will exceedthe number of shares of [PARTY A] common stock that were available for sale under this plan on the Enrollment Date of the applicable Offering Period, orthe number of shares of [PARTY A] common stock available for sale under this plan on such Exercise Date,the Administrator shall provide that [PARTY A] make a pro rata allocation of the shares of its common stock available for purchase on such Enrollment Date or Exercise Date, as applicable, in as uniform a manner as practicable and as it determines to be equitable among all Participants exercising options to purchase its common stock on such Exercise Date, and eithercontinue all Offering Periods then in effect, orterminate any or all Offering Periods then in effect according to section [TERMINATION].Automatic Transfer to Low Price Offering Period. To the extent permitted by applicable Law, if the Fair Market Value of [PARTY A]'s common stock on any Exercise Date in an Offering Period is lower than the Fair Market Value of the same stock on the Enrollment Date of such Offering Period, then all Participants in such Offering Period will be automaticallywithdrawn from that Offering Period immediately after the exercise of their option on such Exercise Date, andre-enrolled in the immediately following Offering Period as of the first day of that period.

name: Alternative 1
description: Exhibit AStock Option GrantsName Number of Shares Stock Plan and Vesting Schedule

name: Expansion Option
description: Right to ExpandGeneral Conditions. Tenant under this Lease shall have the option to expand the Premises to include [Contemplated Expansion Premises], upon all terms and conditions set forth in this Lease (excluding an improvement allowance) for the initial Premises, except as otherwise set forth herein.Written Notice. To exercise the Expansion Option, Tenant must deliver written notice to Landlord.Term of Tenant's Liability for Expansion Premises. If Tenant exercises Expansion Option, within time limits, then the term of Tenant's liability for Basic Rent for Expansion Premises, shall commence on the date 30 days after the applicable Expansion Premises Delivery Date and shall be coterminous with the Term for the Premises originally demised by this Lease.Basic Rent for Expansion Premises. The Basic Rent rate for Expansion Premises shall be equal to [$X/fair market value at time notice is given by Tenant].

name: Pro-Landlord
description: CompareRight to ExpandGeneral Conditions. Tenant under this Lease shall have the option to expand the Premises to include [Contemplated Expansion Premises], upon all terms and conditions set forth in this Lease (excluding an improvement allowance) for the initial Premises, except as otherwise set forth herein.Written Notice. To exercise the Expansion Option, Tenant must deliver written notice to Landlord.Expansion Option Not Divisible. Tenant may only exercise the Expansion Option with respect to the entire (and not less than the entire) portion of each of the [Contemplated Expansion Premises].Time Limits. Failure by Tenant to notify Landlord, in writing, within [the time limits set forth] shall constitute a waiver by Tenant of the Expansion Option. In such case, the Expansion Option shall automatically lapse and be of no further force or effect.Expansion Premises Provided As-is. Tenant shall lease and accept possession of the Expansion Premises in an as is condition with all faults and without obligation of Landlord to construct any improvements to or provide any improvement allowance for Expansion Premises.Tenant Responsibility. Tenant shall be responsible for demising such Expansion Premises and all other costs associated with the use and occupancy thereof.Term of Tenant's Liability for Expansion Premises. If Tenant exercises Expansion Option, within time limits, then the term of Tenant's liability for Basic Rent for Expansion Premises, shall commence on the date 30 days after the applicable Expansion Premises Delivery Date and shall be coterminous with the Term for the Premises originally demised by this Lease.Basic Rent for Expansion Premises. The Basic Rent rate for Expansion Premises shall be equal to [$X/fair market value at time notice is given by Tenant].

name: Pro-Tenant
description: CompareRight to ExpandGeneral Conditions. Tenant under this Lease shall have the option to expand the Premises to include [Contemplated Expansion Premises], upon all terms and conditions set forth in this Lease (excluding an improvement allowance) the same as for the initial Premises, except as otherwise set forth herein.Written Notice. To exercise the Expansion Option, Tenant must deliver written notice to Landlord.Landlord Delivery of Expansion Premises. If Tenant exercises the Expansion Option within time limits, then Landlord shall deliver possession of the Expansion Premises to Tenant on the date selected by Tenant. This date shall:not be earlier than the date three (3) months, norlater than the date six (6) months, after Landlord's receipt of Tenant's notice to exercise Expansion Option.Term of Tenant's Liability for Expansion Premises. If Tenant exercises Expansion Option, within time limits, then the term of Tenant's liability for Basic Rent for Expansion Premises, shall commence on the date 30 days after the applicable Expansion Premises Delivery Date and shall be coterminous with the Term for the Premises originally demised by this Lease.Basic Rent for Expansion Premises. The Basic Rent rate for Expansion Premises shall be equal to [$X/fair market value at time notice is given by Tenant].

name: Standard — Parties pay own expenses
description: Fee and Expenses. Except as otherwise provided for in this agreement, each party will pay all expenses it incurs in connection with this agreement.

name: The hiring party simply reimburses expenses.
description: CompareExpensesReimbursement of Expenses. [PARTY A] will reimburse [PARTY B] for all reasonable and necessary expenses [PARTY B] incurs in connection with this agreement.Receipts and Records. [PARTY B] will keep all receipts and other records of [PARTY B]'s expenses.Expense InvoicesInvoice Each Pay Period. [PARTY B] will invoice [PARTY A] each [PAY PERIOD] for reimbursement of [PARTY B]'s expenses.Invoice Contents. [PARTY B] will include with each invoicean invoice number,the receipts or other records reasonably detailing each expense in the invoice, andthe routing and account number necessary for [PARTY A] to make the payment.Payment of Invoices. [PARTY A] will reimburse [PARTY B] within 10 Business Days of receiving each invoice in immediately available funds to the account [PARTY B] specifies above.

name: The hiring party reimburses expenses, with interest.
description: CompareExpensesReimbursement of Expenses. [PARTY A] will reimburse [PARTY B] for all reasonable and necessary expenses [PARTY B] incurs in connection with this agreement.Receipts and Records. [PARTY B] will keep receipts or other records of its expenses to submit to [PARTY A] for reimbursement of its expenses.Expense InvoicesInvoice Each Pay Period. [PARTY B] will invoice [PARTY A] each [PAY PERIOD] for reimbursement of [PARTY B]'s expenses.Invoice Contents. [PARTY B] will include with each invoicean invoice number,the receipts or other records reasonably detailing each expense in the invoice, andthe routing and account number necessary for [PARTY A] to make the payment.Payment of Invoices. [PARTY A] will reimburse [PARTY B] within 10 Business Days of receiving each invoice in immediately available funds to the account [PARTY B] specifies above.Interest on Late Reimbursement. [PARTY A] will pay interest on any Late Reimbursement at a rate of 1% per month (12.68% annually) or the maximum allowed by law, whichever is less.

name: The hiring party reimburses only pre-approved expenses.
description: CompareExpensesReimburse Pre-Approved Expenses. [PARTY A] will reimburse [PARTY B] for all reasonable and necessary expenses [PARTY B] incurs in connection with this agreement and that [PARTY A] pre-approves in writing.Receipts and Records. [PARTY B] will keep receipts or other records of its expenses to submit to [PARTY A] for reimbursement of its expenses.Expense InvoicesInvoice Each Pay Period. [PARTY B] will invoice [PARTY A] each [PAY PERIOD] for reimbursement of [PARTY B]'s expenses.Invoice Contents. [PARTY B] will include with each invoicean invoice number,the receipts or other records reasonably detailing each expense in the invoice, andthe routing and account number necessary for [PARTY A] to make the payment.Payment of Invoices. [PARTY A] will reimburse [PARTY B] within 10 Business Days of receiving each invoice in immediately available funds to the account [PARTY B] specifies above.

name: The hiring party advances expenses.
description: Compare Fee and Expenses Advancement of Expenses. [PARTY A] will advance to [PARTY B] $[ADVANCED EXPENSES], within 10 Business Days of the Effective Date, to cover [PARTY B]'s reasonable and necessary expenses incurred in connection with this agreement ("Advanced Expenses"). Receipts and Records. [PARTY B] will keep receipts or other records of its use of the Advanced Expenses. Refund of Unspent Advancement. Within [30] Business Days of the end of this agreement, [PARTY B] will return to [PARTY A] all unspent Advanced Expenses. [PARTY A] may require the [PARTY B] to also submit all receipts or other records detailing the reasonableness and necessity of [PARTY B]'s use of the Advanced Expenses.

name: Standard Clause + Termination Fee
description: Compare Fees and ExpensesIn General, Parties Pay Their Own Expenses. Except as otherwise provided for in this subclause or elsewhere in this agreement, each party will pay all expenses it incurs in connection with this agreement.Termination Fees. In any of the following events, the [PARTY A/PARTIES] will pay to the [PARTY B/EACH OTHER] a termination fee of $[TERMINATION FEE DOLLAR AMOUNT] (the "Termination Fee"), it being understood that under no circumstances will the [PARTY A/PARTIES] be required to pay the Termination Fee on more than one occasion: [ENUMERATED LIST OF TERMINATION EVENTS ON WHICH THE TERMINATION FEE IS OWED]

name: Reimbursement conditioned on closing the Transaction.
description: Compare Expenses. Consummation of Transaction. Subject to the [MATERIAL BREACH BY PARTY B] section below, if the Transaction is consummated:[PARTY B] will submit to [PARTY A] an invoice for all reasonable and necessary expenses that it incurs in connection with this agreement, and[PARTY A] will reimburse the [PARTY B] for such expenses using the proceeds of the Transaction.Material Breach by [PARTY B]. If [PARTY B] materially breaches this agreement, [PARTY B] will bear all expenses incurred under this agreement, regardless of whether the Transaction is consummated.

name: Executive Employment Agreement

name: [PARTY B] Pays Expenses
description: CompareFee and Expenses. Except as otherwise provided for in this agreement, [PARTY B] will pay all expenses either party incurs in connection with this agreement.

[PARTY A] will not pay expenses for any registration that is subsequently withdrawn at the request of Holders holding a majority of the Registrable Securities.

name: Pro-Investor
description: CompareExpenses of Registration. The Company will pay all expenses of each registration; provided, however, that the Company will not pay for expenses of any registration that is subsequently withdrawn at the request of Holders holding a majority of the Registrable Securities.

name: Expiration
description: Expiration. The voting proxy granted will automatically terminate and be of no further force or effect upon the expiration of the term.

name: Provider solely responsible
description: Export Compliance. [PARTY B] shall be solely responsible for obtaining all licenses, Permits or authorizations as required from time to time by the United States and any other government for any export.

name: Provider cooperation
description: CompareExport Compliance. The [PARTY B] shall be solely responsible for obtaining all licenses, permits or authorizations as required from time to time by the United States and any other government for any export. The [PARTY A] agrees to provide the [PARTY B] with reasonable assistance in obtaining licenses, permits or authorization.

name: [PARTY A] compliance
description: Export Control LawsCompliance. [PARTY A] and its Subsidiaries have conducted all export transactions in accordance in all material respects with applicable provisions of United States export and re-export controls, includingthe Export Administration Act and Regulations,the Foreign Assets Control Regulations,the International Traffic in Arms Regulations, andother controls administered by the United States Department of Commerce, the United States Department of State, and all other applicable import and export controls in other countries in which [PARTY A] conducts business.Necessary Permits and AuthorizationsPermits and Authorizations Obtained. [PARTY A] and its Subsidiaries have obtained all necessary export and import Permits, and other consents, notices, waivers, approvals, orders, authorizations, registrations, declarations, and filings with any Governmental Authority required forthe export, import, and re-export of products, services, software, and technologies, andreleases of technologies and software to foreign nationals located in the United States and abroad.Compliance with Permits and Authorities. [PARTY A] and its Subsidiariesare in compliance with the terms of all applicable Permits and authorizations, andare not subject to any pending or, to [PARTY A]'s knowledge, threatened, claims with respect to the applicable Permits and authorizations.

name: [PARTY B] compliance
description: Compare Export Control LawsCompliance. [PARTY B] and its Subsidiaries have conducted all export transactions in accordance in all material respects with applicable provisions of United States export and re-export controls, includingthe Export Administration Act and Regulations,the Foreign Assets Control Regulations,the International Traffic in Arms Regulations, andother controls administered by the United States Department of Commerce, the United States Department of State, and all other applicable import and export controls in other countries in which [PARTY B] conducts business.Necessary Permits and AuthorizationsPermits and Authorizations Obtained.
