name: Inventions
description: InventionsAssignment of Inventions. The Assignor shall assign, and hereby assigns, to the Company all his or her interest in all Inventions developed during his or her employment with the Company.Retention of Prior Inventions. Schedule A lists all the AssignorΓÇÖs Prior Inventions, none of which are assigned to the Company but remain the AssignorΓÇÖs property, subject to the terms of the following section (License of Prior Inventions). If there is no list attached, the Assignor confirms that there are no Prior Inventions.License of Prior Inventions. If the Assignor incorporates any Prior Invention into any Company product or process, the Assignor hereby grants to the Company a nonexclusive, royalty-free, irrevocable, perpetual, worldwide license to use, modify, and sell the Prior Invention as part of or in connection with the particular product, process, or machine.Inventions Assigned to US Government. The Assignor shall assign, and hereby assigns, to the United States government all the AssignorΓÇÖs interest in any Inventions whenever full title is required to be in the United States in connection with any contract between the Company and the United States government or any of its agencies.Disclosure of Inventions. The Assignor shall give the Company prompt Notice of any Invention that he or she makes during the term of his or her employment.Records of Inventions. The Assignor shall maintain complete and current written records of all Company Inventions made during the term of employment. The Company may specify the format in which the Assignor will keep these records. The Assignor shall make these records available to the Company upon its request. These records are Company property.

name: Inventions Assigned to the United States
description: Assignments to US Government. To the extent required by any agreement between [PARTY A] and the United States Government, [PARTY B] hereby assigns to the United States Government [PARTY B]'s right, title, and interest in and to any Inventions.

name: Standard
description: Prior InventionsRetention of Prior Inventions. [PARTY B] will retain all right, title, and interest in and to any Inventions [PARTY B] developed or create before its employment with [PARTY A] ("Prior Inventions"), each of which are disclosed in a schedule attached to this agreement.License to Prior Inventions Incorporated Products and Processes. If [PARTY B] incorporates any Prior Invention into any [PARTY A] product or process, [PARTY B] hereby grants to [PARTY A] a nonexclusive, royalty-free, irrevocable, perpetual, and worldwide license to use, modify, and sell that Prior Invention as part of or in connection with that particular product or process.

name: [PARTY A]
description: Inventory. Except for used, obsolete, damaged, or defective items of inventory that have been written off or are not otherwise reflected in the [PARTY A]'s Financial Statements:all of the [PARTY A]'s inventory consists of inventories of the kind, quality, and quantity regularly and currently used in the Business; andthe value at which the [PARTY A]'s inventories are carried [on the Balance Sheet/Financial Statements] reflects [PARTY A]'s inventory valuation policy is consistent with industry practice [, the [PARTY A]'s past practice], and in accordance with GAAP, consistently applied.

name: Additional Inventory Representations
description: CompareInventory. Status and Value of the Inventories. Except for used, obsolete, damaged or defective items of inventory that have been written off or are not otherwise reflected in the [PARTY]'s Financial Statements:All of the [PARTY]'s inventory consists of inventories of the kind, quality and quantity regularly and currently used in the Business; andThe value at which the [PARTY]'s inventories are carried [on the Balance Sheet/Financial Statements] reflects an inventory valuation policy of the [PARTY] which is consistent with industry practice [, the [PARTY]'s past practice] and in accordance with GAAP, consistently applied.Replenishment. Since the Balance Sheet Date, the [PARTY] has continued to replenish inventories in a normal and customary manner consistent with past practices.Continued Supply. The [PARTY] has not received written or oral notice that it will experience in the foreseeable future any difficulty in obtaining, in the desired quantity and quality and at a reasonable price and upon reasonable terms and conditions, the raw materials, supplies or component products required for the manufacture, assembly or production of its products.Unusable Inventory. Since Balance Sheet Date, adequate provision has been made on the [PARTY]'s books in the ordinary course of business in accordance with GAAP applied on a consistent basis for all material slow-moving, obsolete or unusable inventories to their estimated useful or scrap values, and such inventory reserves are adequate to provide for such slow-moving, obsolete or unusable inventory and inventory shrinkage.Full Possession. None of the Inventories are in the possession of others, except inventories in transit or on consignment in the ordinary course of its business. Inventories are not subject to any claim with respect to the use of materials held on consignment.Inventory in Distribution. As of the Balance Sheet Date, the inventory of the [PARTY] in the distribution channel does not exceed an aggregate of [a specific dollar amount].

name: [PARTY B]
description: Compare Inventory. Except for used, obsolete, damaged, or defective items of inventory that have been written off or are not otherwise reflected in the [PARTY B]'s Financial Statements:all of the [PARTY B]'s inventory consists of inventories of the kind, quality, and quantity regularly and currently used in the Business; andthe value at which the [PARTY B]'s inventories are carried [on the Balance Sheet/Financial Statements] reflects [PARTY B]'s inventory valuation policy is consistent with industry practice [, the [PARTY B]'s past practice], and in accordance with GAAP, consistently applied.

name: Escrow Agreement
description: Investment of FundsInitial Investment. Unless otherwise directed by the [PARTY B], the [PARTY C] shall initially invest and reinvest, in the [PARTY C]'s name, cash amounts of the Escrow Account as directed in the [INVESTMENT INSTRUCTIONS ATTACHMENT] attached to this agreement.Alternate Investment. On the receipt of written direction from the [PARTY B] for making such change in the investment, the [PARTY C] shall change the investment of the Escrow Account, without being required to inquire or investigate the appropriateness of such investment. Investment Earnings and Losses. All investment earnings will become part of the Escrow Account, and investment losses shall be charged against the Escrow Account.Tax Reporting Of Investment Earnings and Losses. The parties agree that, for tax reporting purposes, all investment earnings and losses will, as of the end of each calendar year and to the extent required by the Internal Revenue Service, be reported as having been earned or lost by the [PARTY A].Limits on Investment Obligations. The [PARTY C] will not be required to provide supervision, recommendations, or advice relating to either the investment of any cash amount of the Escrow Account or to the purchase, sale, retention, or other disposition of any investment described in this agreement, or to determine the market or other value of any investment, andTiming and Confirmation of Investment Instructions. With respect to any investment instructions and funds to be invested received by the [PARTY C] after 11:00 a.m., Central Time:the [PARTY C] will not be required to invest such funds, or to effect any investment instruction, until the next day the [PARTY C] is open to conduct its regular banking business;the [PARTY C] shall confirm in writing the receipt of any such funds, and the investment and reinvestment of such funds, by sending account statements to the [PARTY A] and [PARTY D]; andthe [PARTY C] shall promptly correct any errors, omissions, or inaccuracies reflected in such account statements which the [PARTY A] or [PARTY D] may inform the [PARTY C] of in writing.No Representation. The [PARTY C] does not make any representation or warranty, express or implied, as to the accuracy of any such valuations, or that any values necessarily reflect the proceeds that may be received on the sale of an investment.No Liability for Investment Performance. The [PARTY C] will not be liable or responsible for loss in the value of any investment made under this agreement, or for any loss, cost, or penalty resulting from any sale or liquidation of any such investment.

name: Standard
description: Investment Representations[PARTY] Understands Registration Status. The [PARTY] understands that the Shares [nor the Conversion Shares] have not been registered under the Securities Act.[PARTY] Understand Exemption. The [PARTY] also understands that the Shares are being offered and sold pursuant to an exemption from registration contained in the Securities Act based in part upon [PARTY]'s representations contained in the agreement.[PARTY] Bears Economic RiskThe [PARTY] has substantial experience in evaluating and investing in private placement transactions of securities in companies similar to the [OTHER PARTY] so that it is capable of evaluating the merits and risks of its investment in the [OTHER PARTY] and has the capacity to protect its own interests.The [PARTY] must bear the economic risk of this investment indefinitely unless the Shares (or the Conversion Shares) are registered pursuant to the Securities Act, or an exemption from registration is available.The [PARTY] understands that the [OTHER PARTY] has no present intention of registering the Shares[, the Conversion Shares] or any other shares of its Common Stock.The [PARTY] also understands that there is no assurance that any exemption from registration under the Securities Act will be available and that, even if available, such exemption may not allow [PARTY] to transfer all or any portion of the Shares[ or the Conversion Shares] under the circumstances, in the amounts or at the times [PARTY] might propose.Acquisition for Own Account. The [PARTY] is acquiring the Shares [and the Conversion Shares] for the [PARTY]'s own account for investment only, and not with a view towards their distribution.[PARTY] Can Protect Its Interest. The [PARTY] represents that by reason of its, or of its management's, business or financial experience, the [PARTY] has the capacity to protect its own interests in connection with the transactions contemplated in this agreement[, and the Related Agreements].No Advertisement. The [PARTY] is not aware of the publication of any advertisement in connection with the transactions contemplated in the agreement.Accredited Investor. The [PARTY] represents that it is an accredited investor within the meaning of Regulation D under the Securities Act.[OTHER PARTY] Information. The [PARTY] has had an opportunity to discuss the [OTHER PARTY]'s business, management and financial affairs with directors, officers and management of the [OTHER PARTY] and has had the opportunity to review the [OTHER PARTY]'s operations and facilities. [PARTY] has also had the opportunity to ask questions of and receive answers from, the [OTHER PARTY] and its management regarding the terms and conditions of this investment.Rule 144The [PARTY] acknowledges and agrees that the Shares[, and, if issued, the Conversion Shares] are "restricted securities" as defined in Rule 144 promulgated under the Securities Act as in effect from time to time and must be held indefinitely unless they are subsequently registered under the Securities Act or an exemption from such registration is available.The [PARTY] has been advised or is aware of the provisions of Rule 144, which permits limited resale of shares purchased in a private placement subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions, including, among other things: the availability of certain current public information about the [OTHER PARTY], the resale occurring following the required holding period under Rule 144 and the number of shares being sold during any three-month period not exceeding specified limitations.Residence. [The [PARTY] is an individual, and resides in the state or province identified in the address of the [PARTY] set out in [ATTACHMENT]] [The [PARTY] is a [PARTNERSHIP] [CORPORATION] [LIMITED LIABILITY [OTHER PARTY]] [OTHER ENTITY], and the office or offices of the [PARTY] in which its investment decision was made is located at the address or addresses of the [PARTY] set out in [ATTACHMENT]].

The [PARTY A] represents that by reason of its, or of its management's, business or financial experience, the [PARTY A] has the capacity to protect its own interests in connection with the transactions contemplated in this agreement[, and the Related Agreements].No Advertisement. The [PARTY A] is not aware of the publication of any advertisement in connection with the transactions contemplated in the agreement.Accredited Investor. The [PARTY A] represents that it is an accredited investor within the meaning of Regulation D under the Securities Act.[PARTY B] Information. The [PARTY A] has had an opportunity to discuss the [PARTY B]'s business, management and financial affairs with directors, officers and management of the [PARTY B] and has had the opportunity to review the [PARTY B]'s operations and facilities. [PARTY A] has also had the opportunity to ask questions of and receive answers from, the [PARTY B] and its management regarding the terms and conditions of this investment.Rule 144The [PARTY A] acknowledges and agrees that the Shares[, and, if issued, the Conversion Shares] are "restricted securities" as defined in Rule 144 promulgated under the Securities Act as in effect from time to time and must be held indefinitely unless they are subsequently registered under the Securities Act or an exemption from such registration is available.The [PARTY A] has been advised or is aware of the provisions of Rule 144, which permits limited resale of shares purchased in a private placement subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions, including, among other things: the availability of certain current public information about the [PARTY B], the resale occurring following the required holding period under Rule 144 and the number of shares being sold during any three-month period not exceeding specified limitations.Residence. [The [PARTY A] is an individual, and resides in the state or province identified in the address of the [PARTY A] set out in [ATTACHMENT]] [The [PARTY A] is a [PARTNERSHIP] [CORPORATION] [LIMITED LIABILITY [PARTY B]] [OTHER ENTITY], and the office or offices of the [PARTY A] in which its investment decision was made is located at the address or addresses of the [PARTY A] set out in [ATTACHMENT]].

name: IP Valid and Enforceable
description: IP Valid and Enforceable. [To the knowledge of Company,] each of Company's Intellectual Property listed in the Intellectual Property Schedule is subsisting and has not been adjudged invalid or unenforceable, in whole or in part, and [, to the best of Company's knowledge,] each Intellectual Property set forth on Intellectual Property Schedule is valid and enforceable [except those that are not currently used in Company's business in any material respect.]

name: Alternative 2
description: Compare1.1 Notice. Company has notified the Secured Party in writing of all uses of any item of Collateral [material to Company's business] of which Company is aware which could reasonably be expected to lead to such item becoming invalid or unenforceable.1.2 Complete and Accurate List. The Intellectual Property Schedule accurately lists all Intellectual Property owned or controlled by the Company, accurately reflects the existence and status of registrations pertaining to the Intellectual Property, and accurately lists all of the license agreements in connection with the Intellectual Property in effect as of the date of this Agreement.

name: Issuance
description: Issuance. The share certificates of the Corporation shall be numbered and registered in the share register or transfer books of the Corporation as they are issued. They shall be executed in such manner as the Board of Directors shall determine.

name: It is expressly understood that Peak may temporarily suspend, in whole or p
description: 2. It is expressly understood that Peak may temporarily suspend, in whole or part, the provision of Covered Data to any Data Recipient in the event that Peak has a reasonable basis for doing so, including, without limitation, emergencies, maintenance, or other operational requirements of the Grid.

name: Standard
description: Joint and Several. If there is more than one tenant of [PARTY A] under this agreement, the obligations imposed on them under this agreement will be joint and several.

name: Judgment
description: Arbitration Judgment. Judgment may be entered on the arbitrator's award in any court having jurisdiction; provided, however, that the Executive shall be entitled to seek specific performance of his right to be paid during the pendency of any dispute or controversy arising under or in connection with this Agreement.

name: Standard
description: Jurisdiction and Venue. The parties herebyagree that any litigation arising under this agreement will be brought and venued exclusively in [JURISDICTION], consent to the personal jurisdiction of these courts, andwaive any objection that such venue is inconvenient or improper.

name: Jury Trial Waiver
description: Waiver of Jury Trial. Each party hereby irrevocably waives its rights to trial by jury in any Action or proceeding arising out of this agreement or the transactions relating to its subject matter.

name: Standard
description: Key Man Insurance [PARTY B]'s Acknowledgement and Consent. [PARTY B] hereby acknowledges that [PARTY A] or its Affiliates may seek and purchase one or more policies providing key man life insurance with respect to [PARTY B], the proceeds of which would be payable to [PARYT A] or the applicable Affiliate, andconsents to [PARTY A] or its Affiliates seeking and purchasing key man life insurance with respect to [PARTY B].Further Assurances. If and to the extent necessary or desirable for [PARTY A] or its Affiliates to seek, purchase, and maintain key man insurance in full force and effect, [PARTY B] shall, provide information,undergo medical examinations (at [PARTY B]'s expense), execute documents, andotherwise take any and all actions reasonably necessary or desirable under this section.

name: Key Terms
description: Key Terms [DEFINE CORE TERMS]

name: [PARTY A]
description: Labor MattersEmployee Information. The [PARTY A]'s Disclosure Schedule includes a complete and accurate list of the following information for each of its employees (including each employee on leave of absence or layoff status):name;job title;primary work location;date of hiring or engagement; andcurrent compensation.Compliance with Employment Laws. The [PARTY A] and its Subsidiaries are in compliance with all applicable Laws respecting employment, discrimination in employment, terms and conditions of employment, worker classification (including the proper classification of workers as independent contractors and consultants), wages, hours, and occupational safety and health and employment practices, other than instances of noncompliance that would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY A].No Collective Bargaining Contract. Neither the [PARTY A] nor any of its Subsidiaries is a party to any material collective bargaining contract with any labor organization, works council, trade union, or other employee representative with respect to employees based in the United States. No Union Organization Activities. To the [PARTY A]’s knowledge, there are no (and since [DATE] there has not been any) ongoing or threatened union organization, decertification activities, or proceedings relating to any of its employees or the employees of its Subsidiaries.No Demand for Recognition. To the [PARTY A]’s knowledge, as of the date of this agreement no demand for recognition as the exclusive bargaining representative of any employees is pending by or on behalf of any labor organization, works council, trade union, or other employee representative.No Labor Disputes. To the [PARTY A]’s knowledge, there is no pending or threatened strike, lockout, work stoppage or other material labor disputes against or involving the [PARTY A] or any of its Subsidiaries that would reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY A]. No Charges. To the [PARTY A]’s knowledge, there are no unfair labor practice charges pending or threatened against the [PARTY A] or any of its Subsidiaries, except for such matters as would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY A].

name: [PARTY B]
description: Compare Labor MattersEmployee Information. The [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule includes a complete and accurate list of the following information for each of its employees (including each employee on leave of absence or layoff status):name;job title;primary work location;date of hiring or engagement; andcurrent compensation.Compliance with Employment Laws. The [PARTY B] and its Subsidiaries are in compliance with all applicable Laws respecting employment, discrimination in employment, terms and conditions of employment, worker classification (including the proper classification of workers as independent contractors and consultants), wages, hours, and occupational safety and health and employment practices, other than instances of noncompliance that would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY B].No Collective Bargaining Contract. Neither the [PARTY B] nor any of its Subsidiaries is a party to any material collective bargaining contract with any labor organization, works council, trade union, or other employee representative with respect to employees based in the United States. No Union Organization Activities. To the [PARTY B]’s knowledge, there are no (and since [DATE] there has not been any) ongoing or threatened union organization, decertification activities, or proceedings relating to any of its employees or the employees of its Subsidiaries.No Demand for Recognition. To the [PARTY B]’s knowledge, as of the date of this agreement no demand for recognition as the exclusive bargaining representative of any employees is pending by or on behalf of any labor organization, works council, trade union, or other employee representative.No Labor Disputes. To the [PARTY B]’s knowledge, there is no pending or threatened strike, lockout, work stoppage or other material labor disputes against or involving the [PARTY B] or any of its Subsidiaries that would reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY B]. No Charges. To the [PARTY B]’s knowledge, there are no unfair labor practice charges pending or threatened against the [PARTY B] or any of its Subsidiaries, except for such matters as would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Material Adverse Effect on the [PARTY B].

name: Standard
description: Landlord Consent Required[PARTY A]'s Responsibility to Obtain Consent. The sublease and this agreement are subject to [PARTY A] obtaining the written consent of [NAME OF LANDLORD], the [owner / landlord] of the Premise.Reasonable Efforts to Obtain Consent. [PARTY A] shall use reasonable efforts to obtain the consent required under this section.Right to Terminate for Lack of Consent. If [PARTY A] cannot obtain the consent required under this section by the Effective Date,either party may terminate this agreement with immediate effect, andif this agreement is terminated under this section, [PARTY A] shall return to [PARTY B] any amounts already paid under this agreement, including the Security Deposit and any Rent paid.

name: Landlord Consent to Alterations
description: Landlord Consent to Alterations. Tenant shall not make any alterations and additions to the Premises without the prior written consent of Landlord, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.

name: Pro-Tenant
description: ComparePermitted Alterations. Tenant may make the following alterations without the prior written consent of Landlord:Alterations that are part of Tenant's duties in the lease agreement, orAlterations that are cosmetic in nature, and the aggregate cost of any such alterations does not exceed [COST CAP] in any [NUMBER OF MONTHS] month period. Tenant shall give Landlord at least [NUMBER OF DAYS] days prior notice of such cosmetic alterations, which shall be accompanied by reasonably adequate evidence that such changes do not:require any structural or other substantial modifications to the premises,require any changes to, or adversely affect, the systems and equipment of the premises,affect the exterior appearance of the premises ortrigger any legal requirement which would require Landlord to make any alteration or improvement to the premises.

name: Landlord Insurance
description: Landlord Insurance. The Landlord shall obtain and maintain fire and extended coverage insurance on the Building and the Premises, but excluding coverage of the Tenant improvements and all the Tenant's personal property located on or in the Premises, in the amounts that the Landlord deems appropriate.

name: Detailed
description: CompareLandlord Insurance. Landlord shall maintain the following insurance:Commercial General Liability insurance applicable to the Property, Building and Common Areas providing, on an occurrence basis, a minimum combined single limit of at least [$3,000,000];Special Cause of Loss Insurance on the Building at replacement cost value as reasonably estimated by Landlord;Worker's Compensation insurance to the extent required by Law;Employers Liability Coverage to the extent required by Law; andsuch other insurance coverage as Landlord, in its reasonable judgement, may elect to maintain.

name: Landlord Option to Repair
description: Landlord Option to RepairLandlord may elect to:commence promptly to repair and restore the Premises, in which event this Lease shall remain in full force and effect, ornot to repair or restore the Premises, in which event this Lease shall terminate.

name: Pro-Tenant
description: CompareLandlord may so elect only if the Building or a substantial portion is materially damaged by fire or other casualty or cause, whether or not the Premises are affected, and one or more of the following conditions is present:repairs to be made by Landlord cannot reasonably be completed within [210] days after the date Landlord first has knowledge of the damage; orthe damage which is required to be repaired by Landlord is not fully covered, except for deductible amounts, by Landlord's insurance policies.If Landlord does not elect to terminate this Lease pursuant to Landlord's termination right as provided above, and the repairs cannot, in the reasonable opinion of Landlord, be completed within [210] days after the date Landlord first has knowledge of the damage, Tenant may elect, no earlier than [60] days and not later than [90] days after the date Landlord first has knowledge of the damage, to terminate this Lease by written notice to Landlord effective as of the date specified in the notice.The specified notice date shall not be less than [30] days nor more than [60] days after the date such notice is given by Tenant.

name: Landlord Property
description: Landlord Property. All additions and alterations made to the Premises shall become the property of Landlord and be surrendered with the Premises upon the expiration of the Term.

name: Pro-Tenant
description: CompareRemoval of PropertyBefore the expiration or earlier termination hereof, Tenant, without expense to Landlord, shall:remove from the Premises all debris and rubbish and all furniture, equipment, trade fixtures, Lines, free-standing cabinet work, movable partitions and other articles of personal property that are owned or placed in the Premises by Tenant, andrepair all damage to the Premises and Building resulting from such removal.If Tenant fails to timely perform such removal and repair, Landlord may do so at Tenant's expense (including storage costs).If Tenant fails to remove such property from the Premises, or from storage, within [30] days after notice from Landlord, any part of such property shall be deemed, at Landlord's option, either conveyed to Landlord without compensation, or abandoned.

name: Landlord Right to Cure
description: Landlord Right to CureCure. If Tenant shall fail to perform any of its obligations under this Lease, within a reasonable time after such performance is required by the terms of this Lease, Landlord may, but shall not be obligated to, after reasonable prior notice to Tenant (except in the case of an emergency), make any such payment or perform any such act on Tenant's part without waiving its rights based upon any Default of Tenant and without releasing Tenant from any obligations hereunder.Tenant Reimbursement. Tenant shall pay to Landlord, within [15] days after delivery by Landlord to Tenant of notice, sums equal to expenditures reasonably made and obligations incurred by Landlord in connection with the remedying by Landlord of Tenant defaults.

name: Landlord Right to Recapture
description: Right of RecaptureRecapture. In the event of a proposed assignment or sublease, Landlord may terminate this Lease with respect to the contemplated Transfer space by notifying the Tenant within [RECAPTURE NOTICE] days of receiving the Transfer notice.Recapture of Portion of Premises. If the contemplated Transfer space is a portion of the whole Premises, then Tenant's Rent will be adjusted on the basis of the percentage of the original square footage retained by Tenant.

name: Pro-Tenant
description: CompareRight of RecaptureRecapture. In the event of a proposed assignment or sublease, Landlord may take take the contemplated Transfer space for the contemplated Transfer Period by notifying the Tenant within [RECAPTURE NOTICE] days of receiving the Transfer notice.Recapture of Portion of Premises. If the contemplated Transfer space is a portion of the whole Premises, then Tenant's Rent will be adjusted on the basis of the percentage of the original square footage retained by Tenant.Permitted Transfers Exception. A Landlord may not exercise Recapture for a Permitted Transfer.

name: Landlord's Maintenance Obligation
description: Landlord's MaintenanceRepairs. The Landlord shall, at its expense, perform all replacements and repairs necessary to maintain the exterior of the Building in good repair and proper working order.Advance Notice of Work. The Landlord shall give the Tenant [48] hours' advance Notice of the scope and necessity of any work to be performed. In an emergency, however, the Landlord may, without advance Notice to the Tenant, undertake any temporary corrective action that is necessary to abate the emergency until the Landlord can give the required Notice to the Tenant of the "permanent" corrective action to be undertaken.Partial Destruction - Insured Loss. If a Premises Partial Damage Event that is an Insured Loss occurs, the Landlord shall, at its own expense, repair the damage (but not including the Tenant's personal property) as soon as reasonably possible and this lease will continue in effect.Partial Destruction - Uninsured Loss. If a Premises Partial Damage Event that is not an Insured Loss occurs, unless caused by an act of negligence or willful misconduct of the Tenant (in which case the Tenant shall make the repairs at its own expense), the Landlord may eitherrepair the damage as soon as reasonably possible at its own expense, in which case this lease will continue in effect, orterminate this lease by giving Notice to the Tenant within [20] Business Days after the Landlord acquires knowledge of the occurrence of the damage.

name: Pro-Landlord
description: CompareLandlord's Obligations. The Landlord shall keep the Building, including the Premises, interior and exterior walls, roof, and common areas and the equipment, whether used exclusively for the Tenant or in common with the Landlord or other tenants, in good condition and repair [in a manner consistent with similar first class buildings in the [CITY]].No Reduction of Rent. The Landlord will not reduce Rent or be liable for loss or injury to or interference with Tenant's property, profits or business arising from or in connection with Landlord's performance of its obligations under this section.

name: Standard
description: Late or Non-Delivery of PossessionLiability and Rent for Late Delivery. If, through no fault of [PARTY A], [PARTY A] cannot deliver possession of the Premise to [PARTY B] on the first day of the Term,[PARTY A] will have no liability to [PARTY B], and[PARTY A] will not charge [PARTY B] for Rent until possession is given, and prorate the Rent amount for that first month in accordance with section [PAYMENT OF RENT].Termination for Non-Delivery. If , through no fault of [PARTY A], [PARTY A] cannot deliver possession of the Premise to [PARTY B] within [30] days after the first day of the Term, this agreement will automatically terminate without liability for [PARTY B].

name: Pro-Landlord
description: CompareLate or Non-Delivery of PossessionLiability and Rent for Late Delivery. If, for any reason, [PARTY A] cannot deliver possession of the Premise to [PARTY B] on the first day of the Term,[PARTY A] will have no liability to [PARTY B], and[PARTY A] will not charge [PARTY B] for Rent until possession is given, and prorate the Rent amount for that first month in accordance with section [PAYMENT OF RENT].Termination for Non-Delivery. If , through no fault of [PARTY A], [PARTY A] cannot deliver possession of the Premise to [PARTY B] within [30] days after the first day of the Term, this agreement will automatically terminate without liability for [PARTY B].

name: Interest on Late Payments
description: Interest on Late Payments. Any amount not paid when due will bear interest from the due date until paid at a rate equal to [1]% per month ([12.68]% annually) or the maximum allowed by Law, whichever is less.

name: Right to Suspend + Reinstatement Fee + Interest on Late Payments
description: CompareLate PaymentsRight to Suspend. If [PARTY B] fails to make payments when due [three] times over any [six]-month period, [PARTY A] may suspend the [DELIVERABLE] until [PARTY B] pays all outstanding fees plus a $[REINSTATEMENT FEE] reinstatement fee.Interest on Late Payments. Any amount not paid when due will bear interest from the due date until paid at a rate equal to [1]% per month ([12.68]% annually) or the maximum allowed by Law, whichever is less.

name: Right to Suspend + Interest on Late Payments
description: CompareLate PaymentsRight to Suspend. If [PARTY B] fails to make payments when due [three] times over any [six]-month period, [PARTY A] may suspend the [DELIVERABLE] until [PARTY B] pays all outstanding fees.Interest on Late Payments. Any amount not paid when due will bear interest from the due date until paid at a rate equal to [1]% per month ([12.68]% annually) or the maximum allowed by Law, whichever is less.

name: Lease Agreement
description: CompareInterest on Late Payments. If [PARTY B] fails to pay any Rent installment or other payment required under this agreement within [five days] of when that payment is due, [PARTY B] shall pay [PARTY A] a late charge equal to [5%] of the amount due to compensate [PARTY A] for extra costs incurred as a result of the late payment.

name: Standard
description: Lease Agreement[PARTY B] Responsibility for Obligations in Lease Agreement. [PARTY B] shall perform all of [PARTY A]'s obligations under the Lease Agreement which relate to the Premise.Lease Agreement Controls. This agreement is subject and subordinate to the terms and conditions of the Lease Agreement, so that the terms of the Lease Agreement will control in case of any conflict between the terms of this agreement and those in the Lease Agreement.

name: Lease Assignment
description: Assignment. As of Effective Date, Assignor transfers to Assignee all its interest in Lease.

name: Alternatives
description: CompareThe Assignment clause in a Lease Assignment is very standard with no common alternatives.

name: Lease Assumption
description: Assumption of Lease Obligation. Assignee agrees to be bound by entirety of the Lease as of Effective Date.

name: Assignee Favored
description: CompareAssumption of Lease ObligationAssignee's Obligation. Assignee agrees to be bound by entirety of the Lease as of Effective Date.Assignor's Obligation. Assignor agrees to fulfill all of the terms of the Lease prior to the Effective Date.

name: Assignor Favored
description: CompareAssumption of Lease ObligationAssignee's Obligation. Assignee agrees to be bound by entirety of the Lease as of Effective Date.Condition of the Premises. Assignee accepts Premises in "As is" condition. Assignor makes no representations or warranties, express or implied, regarding the Premises.

name: Standard
description: Lease Grant to Premises Lease Grant. [PARTY A] hereby leases to [PARTY B], and [PARTY B] hereby accepts the lease from [PARTY A] to the premises described in paragraph [PREMISE DEFINITION] below (the "Premise").Premise DefinitionDescription: [PREMISES DESCRIPTION]Premises Address: [RENTAL ADDRESS]Building: [BUILDING DESCRIPTION AND ADDRESS]Terms of Lease: [Single/Double/Triple] netEstimated Lease Start Date: [ESTIMATED LEASE START DATE][Brokers: [BROKER NAMES AND ADDRESSES]]

name: Short Form
description: CompareLease Grant to Premises. [PARTY A] hereby leases to [PARTY B], and [PARTY B] hereby accepts the lease to the [Premise / Equipment] from [PARTY A].

name: Sublease
description: CompareSublease Grant to PremiseSublease Grant. Subject to section [LANDLORD CONSENT], [PARTY A] hereby subleases to [PARTY B], and [PARTY B] hereby accepts the sublease from [PARTY A] to the premise described in paragraph [PREMISE DEFINITION] below (the "Premise").Premise DefintionDescription: [PREMISES DESCRIPTION]Premises Address: [RENTAL ADDRESS]Building: [BUILDING DESCRIPTION AND ADDRESS]Terms of Lease: [Single/Double/Triple] netEstimated Lease Start Date: [ESTIMATED LEASE START DATE][Brokers: [BROKER NAMES AND ADDRESSES]]

name: Leftovers
description: LeftoversAvailability of Leftovers Subject to Local Law. Subject to state and local Law, [PARTY A], [PARTY B], or guests of the Event may package up any leftovers [PARTY A] is not able to reuse for guests to take after the Event.Containers for Leftovers. If allowed by state and local Law, [PARTY A] shall provide the appropriate containers for guests to take the leftovers.Food Not Claimed As Leftovers[PARTY A]'s Responsibility. [PARTY A] shall dispose of or take back to its kitchen, all food not taken as leftovers.Food Returned to [PARTY A]'s Kitchen. [PARTY B] will have no right to any food [PARTY A] returns to its under this section. Compliance with Health Codes. According to applicable health codes, [PARTY A] may discard any food items where it believes there is a reasonable risk of food-borne illness.

name: No Leftovers
description: CompareLeftovers. No leftovers are permitted.

name: Standard
description: Legal CounselRetention of Counsel. [PARTY A] has engaged [Mayer Brown LLP] (together with its affiliates, “Mayer Brown”) as its legal counsel in connection with the Transaction.[PARTY B]'s Consent. [PARTY B] hereby:consents to the continued representation of [PARTY A by [Mayer Brown] in relation to the Transaction, notwithstanding the fact that Mayer Brown may have represented, and may currently or in the future represent, [PARTY B] or any of its affiliates with respect to unrelated matters; andacknowledges that its consent and waiver under this paragraph [PARTY B'S CONSENT] is voluntary and informed. [PARTY B]'s Waiver. [PARTY B] hereby waives any actual or alleged conflict and actual or alleged violation of ethical or comparable rules applicable to [Mayer Brown] that may arise from its representation of [PARTY A] in connection with the Transaction, including representing [PARTY A] against [PARTY B] or any of [PARTY B]'s Affiliatesin any proceedings.

name: Standard — Merger Agreement
description: Legal RepresentativeThe Parent, Merger Sub, and Company each acknowledge that the Shareholders’ Representative and any of the Company Shareholders may employ [LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE] in connection with any dispute, litigation, claim, proceeding or obligation arising out of or relating to this agreement.Waivers. The Parent, Merger Sub, and Company, on their own behalf and on behalf of the Surviving Corporation and their current and future directors, managers, equity holders, members, partners, officers, employees and Affiliates and each of their successors and assigns (all, the "Waiving Parties"), hereby will waive:Waiver of Conflicts of Interest. Any conflict of interest or any objection arising from [LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE]’s representation of the Shareholders' Representative or any of the Company Shareholders, regardless of whether or not [LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE] provides legal services to the Surviving Corporation or it subsidiary after the Closing Date; andWaiver of Attorney-Client Privilege. Waiver of Privilege. Subject to the [NEXT SECTION], any attorney-client privilege with respect to any communication among [LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE], the Company, any Company Subsidiary, the Shareholders' Representative or any Shareholders and/or any director, officer, manager, member, employee or representative of any such person or party. Exceptions to Waiver. If a dispute arises between the Parent, the Surviving Company, the Company or any Company Subsidiary and a third party other than a party to this agreement after the Merger, the Company may assert the attorney-client privilege to prevent disclosure of confidential communications by [LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE], the Company Shareholders, the Shareholders' Representative, the Company or any Company Subsidiary to such third party, provided, however, that:  The Company may not waive such privilege without the prior written consent of the Shareholders' Representative; and  Neither the Shareholders' Representative nor any Shareholder may waive such privilege without the prior written consent of Parent.

name: Legal Right
description: 1. Legal Right. The [PERFORMING PARTY] has the[ exclusive] right to [perform its fundamental obligations under the agreement].

name: Legal Right - License Agreement
description: Compare1. Legal Right. The Licensor has the[ exclusive] right to use and grant rights to the [Licensed IP][in the Licensed Territory].

name: Legal Right - Services Agreement
description: Compare1. Legal Right. The [PERFORMING PARTY] has the right to [provide the Services / disclose the Confidential Information to the other party] under this agreement.

name: Legal Right - Transfer Agreement
description: Compare1. Legal Right. The [Transferor] has the exclusive right to[ possess and] [transfer / assign] the [Transferred Property].

name: Standard
description: Legend. The [PARTY B] must mark the certificates representing the Shares delivered under this agreement with a legend in the following form:"The shares represented by this certificate have not been registered under the Securities Act of 1933 (the "Act"), as amended, or any other applicable federal or state securities acts; and are 'restricted securities' as defined by Rule 144 of the Act. The shares may not be transferred, sold or otherwise disposed of unless: (1) a registration statement with respect to the shares shall be effective under the Act or any other federal or state securities acts or an exemption from registration requirements under the Act is effective, and (2) the [PARTY B] has received an opinion of counsel for the [PARTY B] that no violations of any securities acts will be involved in any transfer."

name: Legend Upon Request
description: CompareLegending of Shares. If so requested by Company, the Stockholder hereby agrees that the Shares shall bear a legend stating that they are subject to this Agreement.

name: Voting Agreement
description: CompareLegend. Until the termination of this Agreement, each certificate representing any of the Shares subject to this Agreement shall be marked by the Company with a legend reading as follows:"THE SHARES EVIDENCED HEREBY ARE SUBJECT TO A VOTING AGREEMENT (A COPY OF WHICH MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE ISSUER) AND BY ACCEPTING ANY INTEREST IN SUCH SHARES THE PERSON HOLDING SUCH INTEREST SHALL BE DEEMED TO AGREE TO AND SHALL BECOME BOUND BY ALL THE PROVISIONS OF SAID VOTING AGREEMENT."

name: Standard
description: Legends. The [PARTY] acknowledges that that each certificate representing the Shares may be endorsed with substantially the following legends:"The shares represented by this certificate have not been registered under the Securities Act of 1933 (the "Act"), as amended, or any other applicable federal or state securities acts; and are 'restricted securities' as defined by Rule 144 of the Act. The shares may not be transferred, sold or otherwise disposed of unless: (1) a registration statement with respect to the shares shall be effective under the Act or any other federal or state securities acts or an exemption from registration requirements under the Act is effective, and (2) the [OTHER PARTY] has received an opinion of counsel for the [OTHER PARTY] that no violations of any securities acts will be involved in any transfer."; andAny other legends required by applicable state or federal securities laws or any applicable state laws regulating the Business.

name: [PARTY A]
description: CompareLegends. description: CompareLimitations on Indemnification [THIS IS NOT REQUIRED IF THE COMPANY IS PUBLIC]Limitations. Subject to section [EXCEPTIONS FROM AND ADJUSTMENTS TO THE BASKET AND CAP], an Indemnifying Party need not indemnify an Indemnified Party against Indemnifiable Losses that are less than $[MINIMUM INDEMNIFIABLE LOSS AMOUNT] (the "Basket").Maximum Indemnifiable Losses. Subject to section [EXCEPTIONS FROM AND ADJUSTMENTS TO THE BASKET AND CAP], an Indemnifying Party need not indemnify an Indemnified Party against Indemnifiable Losses that are more than $[MAXIMUM INDEMNIFIABLE LOSS AMOUNT] (the "Cap"). Exceptions from and Adjustments to Basket and CapClaims Exempt from Basket and Cap. Neither the Basket nor the Cap apply to Indemnifiable Losses arising from Indemnifiable Proceedings related to [fraud].Claims Exempt from Basket. The Basket will not apply to Indemnifiable Losses arising from Indemnifiable Proceedings related to [EXEMPT CLAIMS].Claims Exempt from Cap. The Cap will not apply to Indemnifiable Losses arising from Indemnifiable Proceedings related sections [TITLE TO ASSETS] or [SUFFICIENCY OF ASSETS].Applicable Losses Reduced by Insurance. In determining whether the Basket or Cap applies to an Indemnified Party's Indemnifiable Losses, that Indemnified Party must reduce the Indemnifiable Losses by any amount covered by any applicable insurance policy of that Indemnified Party.Applicable Losses Reduced by Otherwise Satisfied Amounts. In determining whether the Basket or Cap applies to an Indemnified Party's Indemnifiable Losses, that Indemnified Party must reduce the Indemnifiable Losses to the extent that any such indemnification payment obligation is fully satisfied by a reduction in the [MERGER AGREEMENT CONSIDERATION OBLIGATION] owed to the Indemnifying Party. No Materiality Requirement. For the purposes of a Direct Party Claim, the breach of representation, warranty, or covenant, or other misrepresentation need not be material to give rise to a claim. Exclusions. An Indemnifying Party need not indemnify an Indemnified Party again Indemnifiable Losses to the extent the Indemnified Party acted unlawfully, grossly negligently, or intentionally to cause those losses.
