description: CompareKeys[PARTY A] Shall Deliver Keys. [PARTY A] shall provide [PARTY B] with keys to the internal and external doors of the Premise, and to the mailbox.[PARTY B] Shall Return Keys. If at the end of this agreement [PARTY B] does not return all keys [PARTY A] provides, [PARTY B] shall pay [PARTY A] $[KEY FEE].

name: Lost or Destroyed Certificates
description: Lost or Destroyed Certificates. No certificate representing shares shall be issued in place of any certificate alleged to have been lost, destroyed or stolen, except on production of evidence of such loss, destruction or theft, and if the Board of Directors shall so require, on delivery to the Corporation of a bond of indemnity in such amount, upon such terms and secured by such surety as the Board of Directors may in its discretion require.

name: Maintenance
description: Maintenance. This Agreement does not provide for any maintenance after the Website has been delivered. If Customer makes changes to the Website after delivery and requires Company's assistance to correct any changes, the corrections shall be billed on an hourly basis.

name: Standard
description: Amendments. No modification or amendment to this Agreement shall be effective unless it is in writing and executed by authorized representatives of each party. Without limiting the foregoing, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail over and against any additional or contrary terms and conditions in any format or medium whatsoever including, without limitation, shrinkwrap, click-through, or terms and conditions associated with any upgrade, update, release, patch, or other modification of the Software, unless expressly agreed to in writing by an amendment hereto executed by authorized representatives of each party.

name: Real Property Lease
description: Maintenance and Repair[PARTY A] Obligations. [PARTY A] shall, at its own expense, perform all replacements and repairs necessary to maintain the exterior of the building in good repair and proper working order, including load bearing walls,stairs and accessways,  foundation, downspouts and gutters, and common areas.[PARTY B] Obligations [PARTY B]'s Obligations to Maintain. [PARTY B], at its own expense, shall perform all repairs and replacements and all routine maintenance necessary to maintain the interior, non-structural components of the Premise and all major building systems in good repair and proper working condition, not including normal wear and tear.Reimburse for Damages Caused by [PARTY B] Negligence. On [PARTY A]'s request, [PARTY B] shall reimburse [PARTY A] for all costs [PARTY A] incurs repairing any damage to the Premise caused by [PARTY B]'s negligence or willful misconduct. [PARTY B]'s Obligations to Notify. [PARTY B] shall promptly notify [PARTY A] of any defective condition known to [PARTY B] that [PARTY A] is required to repair.Maintenance and Repair Warranty. Each party shall promptly perform all necessary maintenance and repairs in a good and workmanlike manner in compliance with Law.

name: Personal Property Lease
description: CompareMaintenance and RepairStandard Repair and Maintenance. [PARTY B] shall, at its own cost and expense, keep the Equipment in good repair, condition, and working order, and provide any parts required to keep the Equipment in good repair, condition, and working order.[PARTY A]'s Maintenance Schedule. If [PARTY A] provides a written standard maintenance schedule, [PARTY B] shallfollow that schedule to maintain the Equipment at least to the the minimum maintenance level required under that schedule, andon [PARTY A]'s request, [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] with evidence of its compliance with that schedule.

name: Sublease
description: CompareRepair and Maintenance of PremiseMaintenance. [PARTY B] shall be responsible for all maintenance reasonably necessary maintain the Premise.Repair. [PARTY B] shall be responsible for repairing any damage to the Premise or building [PARTY B] causes.Cleaning. [PARTY B] shall keep the Premise clean and free of trash and debris.End of Term Repair and Cleaning. [PARTY B] shall be responsible for repairing any damage to the Premise or building caused by the removal of [PARTY B]'s property at the end of the Term.

name: Maintenance Assistance
description: Maintenance Assistance. Assignor agrees that, whenever reasonably requested by Assignee, Assignor will execute all papers, take all rightful oaths, and do all acts which may be reasonably necessary for securing and maintaining the Assigned Patents in any country and for vesting title thereto in Assignee, its successors, assigns and legal representatives or nominees.

name: Standard
description: ManagementProject Managers. Each party shall appoint a relationship manager to manage the relationship established by this agreement (each a "Project Manager") who willhave overall managerial responsibility for the party's responsibilities under this agreement, including for [PARTY A]'s Project Manager, coordinating, overseeing, and monitoring the [PARTY A]'s performance of each [DELIVERABLE],on the other party's request, attend the other party's regularly scheduled executive level meetings and planning sessions in connection with this agreement,serve as the primary liaisons between the parties,maintain steady communication with each other regarding the performance of each [DELIVERABLE], andbe authorized to call on the experience, expertise, and resources of its respective party as necessary and desirable to properly perform their duties.Communications Though Project Managers. The parties shall direct all significant communications between themselves to the other party's Project Manager, except that [PARTY B] may direct communications regarding disruptions, outages, latency, or other issues with a [DELIVERABLE] to [PARTY A]'s emergency contact designated under paragraph [EMERGENCY CONTACT].Contact InformationProject Manager Information. Promptly after the Effective Date, each party shall provide the other party with the name, telephone number, facsimile number and e-mail address of its Project Manager.Emergency Contact. In addition to [PARTY A] Project Manager, [PARTY A] shall provide the name, telephone number, facsimile number and e-mail address of its personnel who [PARTY B] should contact in case of any disruptions, outages, latency, or other issues with a [DELIVERABLE].Change to Contacts or Contact Information. Either party may change their Project Manager or the contact information of their Project Manager, and in [PARTY A]'s case it's emergency contact and the contact information of the emergency contact, by giving written notice to the other party detailing the changes.

name: With daily communications
description: CompareManagementProject Managers. Each party shall appoint a relationship manager to manage the relationship established by this agreement (each a "Project Manager") who willhave overall managerial responsibility for the party's responsibilities under this agreement, including for [PARTY A]'s Project Manager, coordinating, overseeing, and monitoring the [PARTY A]'s performance of each [DELIVERABLE],on the other party's request, attend the other party's regularly scheduled executive level meetings and planning sessions in connection with this agreement,serve as the primary liaisons between the parties,maintain steady communication with each other regarding the performance of each [DELIVERABLE], andbe authorized to call on the experience, expertise, and resources of its respective party as necessary and desirable to properly perform their duties.Communications Though Project Managers. The parties shall direct all significant communications between themselves to the other party's Project Manager, except that [PARTY B] may direct communications regarding disruptions, outages, latency, or other issues with a [DELIVERABLE] to [PARTY A]'s emergency contact designated under paragraph [EMERGENCY CONTACT].Contact InformationProject Manager Information. Promptly after the Effective Date, each party shall provide the other party with the name, telephone number, facsimile number and e-mail address of its Project Manager.Emergency Contact. In addition to [PARTY A] Project Manager, [PARTY A] shall provide the name, telephone number, facsimile number and e-mail address of its personnel who [PARTY B] should contact in case of any disruptions, outages, latency, or other issues with a [DELIVERABLE].Change to Contacts or Contact Information. Either party may change their Project Manager or the contact information of their Project Manager, and in [PARTY A]'s case it's emergency contact and the contact information of the emergency contact, by giving written notice to the other party detailing the changes.Periodic Reports and MeetingsDaily Reports. [PARTY A], through its Project Manager, shall provide [PARTY B] with daily reports of its performance under this agreement, in a form and substance the parties agree to in writing. Feedback to Daily Reports. [PARTY B], through it's Project Manager, shall provide [PARTY A] with feedback to [PARTY A]'s daily reports, in a form and substance the parties agree to in writing.Quarterly Meetings. The parties shall meet on a quarterly basis, at a time and location determined by [PARTY B], to review and discuss the performance of each [DELIVERABLE] under this agreement and related matters, including planning, forecasting, new services, and other matters [PARTY B] deems appropriate.Meeting Minutes. [PARTY B] shall keep written minutes of what the parties discuss at each meeting, and provide a copy of the minutes of a meeting to [PARTY A] promptly after that meeting.

name: Manager-Managed
description: Management of [PARTY A]Management. [PARTY A] will be managed by [MANAGER NAME], the "Manager," appointed by the Members.Powers of Management. Except as specifically reserved to the Members under this agreement, the Manager willhave complete discretion, power, and authority in managing and controlling [PARTY A] and [PARTY A]'s business,make all decisions affecting [PARTY A]'s business, andmanage, control, and carry out [PARTY A]'s affairs, business, and purposes.Major Decisions. Major Decisions on behalf of [PARTY A] will require [two-thirds / unanimous] approval by the Members.Officers. The Manager shallappoint the individuals it deems appropriate to the offices it deems necessary to carry on [PARTY A]'s business, andauthorize those officers to the extent it deems necessary to carry on [PARTY A]'s business.Resignation and Removal of ManagerResignation. The Manager may resign at any time by giving the Members written notice, effective at the time specified in the notice, or if not time is specified, on delivery of the notice.Acceptance of Resignation. Unless otherwise specified in this agreement, the Manager's resignation does not require the Member's acceptance for resignation to be effective.Removal. The Members may remove the Manager, with or without cause.Costs and Expenses. [PARTY A] shall pay all expenses [PARTY A] or the Manager incur in connection with [PARTY A]'s activities.Reliance by Third PartiesReliance on Officer Actions Any third party dealing with [PARTY A] may assume any officers authorized to act on [PARTY A]'s behalf has the full power and authority too encumber, sell, otherwise use or transfer any [PARTY A] assets, and otherwise enter contracts on [PARTY A]'s behalf.Waiver. The Manager hereby waives any defenses or other remedies that would be available against a third party attempting to rely on an action by a [PARTY A] officer, under paragraph [RELIANCE BY THIRD PARTIES].No Inquiry Required. A third party attempting to rely on an action by a [PARTY A] officer, under paragraph [RELIANCE BY THRID PARTIES], will not be required to inquired into that officer's actual authority to rely on it.Authorized Documents. All certificates, instruments, and other documents executed on by a [PARTY A] officer on [PARTY A]'s behalf will be conclusive evidence in favor of any third party relying on or claiming under that certificate, instrument, or other document that the certificate, instrument, or other document is, at the time of execution and delivery, in full force and effect,the Person executing and delivering that certificate, instrument, or other document was authorized to do so on [PARTY A]'s behalf, andthat certificate, instrument, or other document was executed and delivered in accordance with the terms of this agreement and is binding on [PARTY A].Investment Representation. Each Member hereby acknowledges thatthey have the financial and business knowledge and experience to evaluate the merits and risks of investing in [PARTY A],they are able to bear the risk of investing in [PARTY A] for an indefinite period of time, they are acquiring their interest in [PARTY A] for investment only, not with a view to resell or distribute that interest to the public,[PARTY A]'s interests have not been registered under any securities Laws, and cannot be disposed of unless they are subsequently registered or qualified under applicable securities Laws,they have authorized the execution, delivery, and performance of this agreement and do not require any consent the Member has not obtained, andthis agreement is valid, binding, and enforceable against them.Limitation on Manager's Liability. The Manager will not be liable to [PARTY A] for any act it performs in connection with its obligations, duties, and responsibilities to [PARTY A].Indemnification of Manager. [PARTY A] shall indemnify the Manager against any losses arising out of any act the Manager performs in connection with the Manager's obligations, duties, and responsibilities to [PARTY A].

name: Member-Managed
description: CompareManagement of [PARTY A]Management. [PARTY A] will be managed by the Members.Day-to-Day Operations. Each Member will be authorized to enter into agreements in [PARTY A]'s ordinary course of business on [PARTY A]'s behalfPowers of Management. Except for those decisions and actions specifically requiring the consent of all Members, the Members will require a two-thirds affirmative vote to enter into agreements outside [PARTY A]'s ordinary course of business on [PARTY A]'s account/Officers. The Members shall, by two-thirds affirmative vote,appoint the individuals it deems appropriate to the offices it deems necessary to carry on [PARTY A]'s business, andauthorize those officers to the extent it deems necessary to carry on [PARTY A]'s business.Limitation on Manager's Liability. No Member will be liable to [PARTY A] for any act that Members performs in connection with its obligations, duties, and responsibilities to [PARTY A].Indemnification of Manager. [PARTY A] shall indemnify each Member against any losses arising out of any act that Member performs in connection with the its obligations, duties, and responsibilities to [PARTY A].

name: Management Right Transfer
description: Management Right Transfer. The Company agrees that the Investor may transfer the rights granted to it under this letter to any other investment vehicle managed by affiliate of the Investor to whom it transfers all or any of the Company's securities.

name: Manner Of Giving Notice
description: Manner Of Giving Notice. Notice of any meeting of stockholders shall be given either personally, by mail or, by electronic transmission. Notices not personally delivered shall be sent charges prepaid and shall be addressed to the stockholder at the address of that stockholder appearing on the books of the corporation or given by the stockholder to the corporation for the purpose of notice. If no address is known, such notice may be sent to the principal executive office of the corporation. Notice shall be deemed to have been given at the time when delivered personally or deposited in the mail or, if electronically transmitted. An affidavit of the secretary or other agent of the corporation that the notice has been given shall, in the absence of fraud, be prima facie evidence of the delivery.

name: Manner of Voting
description: Manner of Voting. The voting of shares pursuant to this Agreement may be effected in person, by proxy, by written consent or in any other manner permitted by applicable law.

name: Marking not required
description: Marking. Information does not need to be marked "Confidential" to be deemed Confidential Information under this agreement.

name: Marking if practical
description: CompareMarkingMarked if Practical. To the extent practical, the disclosing party shall furnish Confidential Information in documentary or tangible form marked as "Confidential".Non-Documentary Information. If disclosure of Confidential Information is in non-documentary form or if the disclosure is first made orally or by visual inspection, the disclosing party shall have the right or, if requested by receiving party, the obligation to confirm in writing the confidential nature of such disclosure within a reasonable time after such disclosure or request is made.Failure to Mark. The disclosing party's failure to mark as "Confidential" information which is in fact Confidential Information shall not reduce or otherwise alter the receiving party's obligations of confidentiality under this agreement.

name: Marking required
description: CompareMarking. Confidential Information disclosed in writing shall be marked with a confidentiality legend and Confidential Information disclosed orally shall be identified as such at the time of disclosure.

name: Marking required; catch-up term
description: Compare Marking. Confidential Information disclosed in writing shall be marked with a confidentiality legend and Confidential Information disclosed orally shall be identified as such at the time of disclosure; provided that the disclosing party shall have 14 days to mark written materials and describe information disclosed orally as confidential.

name: Mutual Notice of Material Changes
description: Changes to Material Contracts. Each party shall[, and shall cause each of their respective Subsidiaries to,] promptly notify the other party of any material changes to, breaches of, or defaults under any of its material contracts.

name: [PARTY A] Notice of Material Changes
description: CompareChanges to Material Contracts. [PARTY A] shall[, and shall cause each of its Subsidiaries to,] promptly notify [PARTY B] of any material changes to, breaches of, or defaults under any of [PARTY A]'s material contracts.

name: [PARTY B] Notice of Material Changes
description: CompareChanges to Material Contracts. [PARTY B]] shall[, and shall cause each of its Subsidiaries to,] promptly notify [PARTY A] of any material changes to, breaches of, or defaults under any of [PARTY B]]'s material contracts.

name: No Representations
description: Material Contracts. The Material Contracts Disclosure Schedule lists all contracts which are material to the Company ("Material Contracts").

name: Merger Agreement
description: CompareMaterial ContractsNo Anticipated Material Change. The Company does not anticipate any termination of, change to, or receipt of a proposal to terminate or change, any Material Contract as a result of executing this agreement.Copies Disclosed. The Company has delivered to the Parent copies of all Material Contracts together with all amendments, waivers, or other changes.Related RepresentationsNo Breach. Neither the Company, any of its Subsidiaries, or any other party, is in breach, violation of, or in default under, any Material Contract.No Notice of Default. As of the date of this agreement, neither the Company nor any of its Subsidiaries has received notice of default under any Material Contract.No Event Causing Breach. No event has occurred which would result in a breach, violation of, or a default under, any Material Contract.No Cancellation. No Material Contract has been cancelled by the Company or any other party.No Claims. There are no claims by any parties pending under any Material Contract.Material Contracts DefinitionIncluded Contracts. Subject to the [EXCLUDED CONTRACTS] subclause below, "Material Contracts" means:all contracts and agreements listed in the Material Contracts Disclosure Schedule; andas the term is defined in Item 601(b)(10) of Regulation S-K promulgated under the Securities Act.Excluded Contracts. "Material Contracts" does not include any contract:terminable on 120 days' or notice or less without a penalty or premium;that will be fully performed or satisfied as of or prior to the date of this agreement; orsolely between the Company and one or more of its Subsidiaries or, solely between the Company's Subsidiaries.

name: [PARTY A]
description: Compare Material ContractsList of Material Contracts. The [PARTY A]'s Disclosure Schedule lists all contracts which are material to the [PARTY A] ("Material Contracts").Related RepresentationsNo Breach. Neither the [PARTY A], any of its Subsidiaries, or any other party, is in breach, violation of, or in default under, any Material Contract.No Notice of Default. As of the date of this agreement, neither the [PARTY A] nor any of its Subsidiaries has received notice of default under any Material Contract.No Event Causing Breach. No event has occurred which would result in a breach, violation of, or a default under, any Material Contract.No Cancellation. No Material Contract has been cancelled by the [PARTY A] or any other party.No Claims. There are no claims by any parties pending under any Material Contract.No Anticipated Material Change. The [PARTY A] does not anticipate any termination of, change to, or receipt of a proposal to terminate or change, any Material Contract as a result of executing this agreement.

name: [PARTY B]
description: Compare Material ContractsList of Material Contracts. The [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule lists all contracts which are material to the [PARTY B] ("Material Contracts").Related RepresentationsNo Breach. Neither the [PARTY B], any of its Subsidiaries, or any other party, is in breach, violation of, or in default under, any Material Contract.No Notice of Default. As of the date of this agreement, neither the [PARTY B] nor any of its Subsidiaries has received notice of default under any Material Contract.No Event Causing Breach. No event has occurred which would result in a breach, violation of, or a default under, any Material Contract.No Cancellation. No Material Contract has been cancelled by the [PARTY B] or any other party.No Claims. There are no claims by any parties pending under any Material Contract.No Anticipated Material Change. The [PARTY B] does not anticipate any termination of, change to, or receipt of a proposal to terminate or change, any Material Contract as a result of executing this agreement.

name: Medical Benefits
description: Medical Benefits. [PARTY A] will provide [PARTY B] with the life, medical, dental, and disability coverage made available to its senior and key management executives, according to the terms, conditions, and overall administration for and policies of these coverages.

name: Meeting By Remote Communication
description: Meeting by Remote Communication. Stockholders may participate in a meeting of the stockholders by means of conference telephone or similar communication equipment by means of which all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other, and participation in a meeting pursuant to this Section shall constitute presence in person at such meeting.

name: Member Rights and Obligations
description: Members' Rights and ObligationsLimitation of Liability. The Members' liability shall be limited as set forth in this Operating Agreement, [RELEVANT STATE CORPORATE] and other applicable law.Additional Members. Additional Members may be admitted to the Company from time to time only with the unanimous approval of all of the Members, such additional Members to be issued Membership Interests in one or more classes or series, and upon such terms and conditions, and for such consideration, as shall be determined unanimously by the Members. Except as otherwise provided hereunder, upon any such admission of any additional Members to the Company, the Manager shall have the authority to adopt such amendments to this Agreement, and to execute and deliver such additional instruments and documents, as shall be necessary or appropriate in order to evidence or reflect the issuance of the same.Member MeetingsPlace, Time, Business. The annual meeting of the Members shall be held at the principal office on the [first 1st Monday in November of each year], or at such other place and at such time as may be determined by the Managers, provided, however, that whenever such day shall fall upon a legal holiday, said meeting shall be held on the next succeeding business day. At such meetings, the Members shall transact such business as may be properly brought before the meeting. Meetings of the Members for any other purpose may be held at such time and place within or without the [STATE OF INCORPORATION] as shall be stated in the notice of the meeting or in a duly executed waiver of notice thereof.Special Meetings. A special meeting of the Members may be called by the Managers. Notice thereof shall specify the object and purpose of such meeting.Notice of Annual or Special Meeting, Waiver. Notice of the time and place of all annual and special meetings of the Members shall be mailed or hand delivered by the Managers to the Members not less than seven (7) nor more than fifty (50) days before the date thereof, but this requirement as to notice may be waived at any time by the Member.Participation by Telephone Conference. A Member may participate in meetings of the Members by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment enabling all participants in the meeting to hear one another, and such participation in a meeting shall constitute presence in person at such meeting.Voting. Members entitled to vote on a matter and representing not less than 75 percent of the Percentage Interests of the Members, represented in person or by proxy, shall constitute a quorum for consideration of that matter at any meeting of the Members. Unless otherwise stated in this Agreement, if a quorum is present, the vote of Members holding not less than 75 percent of the Percentage Interests shall be the act of the Members.Members' Consent. Any action required to be taken at a meeting of the Members may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing, setting forth the action so taken, and said consent shall be filed with the regular minutes.Voting Rights. Should this Agreement expressly provide that any matter be put to the Members for a vote or for approval, the Members shall be entitled to vote or signify the extent of their approval in proportion to their Percentage Interests. By way of illustration, a Member with a Percentage Interest of 25.5 percent shall be deemed to have 25 and 1/2 votes out of 100 possible votes.

name: Standards of Conduct
description: CompareStandards of Conduct. Whenever a Member is required or permitted to make a decision, take or approve an action, or omit to do any of the foregoing, then the Member shall be entitled to consider only such interests and factors, including its own, as it desires, and shall have no duty or obligation to consider any other interests or factors whatsoever. To the extent that the Member has, at law or in equity, duties (including, without limitation, fiduciary duties) to the Company or other person bound by the terms of this Agreement, the Member acting in accordance with this Agreement shall not be liable to the Company or any such other person for its good faith reliance on the provisions of this Agreement. The provisions of this Agreement, to the extent that they restrict the duties of the Member otherwise existing at law or in equity, replace such other duties to the greatest extent permitted under applicable law.

name: Other Activities
description: CompareOther Activities. The Members, their agents, representatives and affiliates may engage or invest in, and devote their time to, any other business venture or activity of any nature and description (independently or with others), whether or not such other activity may be deemed or construed to be in competition with the Company. The Company shall not have any right by virtue of this Agreement or the relationship created hereby in or to such other venture or activity (or to the income or proceeds derived therefrom), and the pursuit thereof, even if competitive with the business of the Company, shall not be deemed wrongful or improper.

name: Memberships
description: Memberships. The Company shall reimburse the Executive for the expenses of membership in and the publications of work-related organizations as are reasonably necessary for a person in this position, as well as for any association or club that the Company authorizes.

name: Company Pays
description: CompareMemberships. The Company shall pay for the Executive's expenses of membership, receipt of publications, and other participation in the relevant programs and activities of any club membership obtained by the Executive.

name: Reimbursement Cap
description: CompareMembership. The Company shall reimburse the Executive annually up to $[AMOUNT] of any club membership obtained by the Executive.

name: Menu Cost
description: Changes to Menu[PARTY A]'s Changes to Menu Prices. [PARTY A] may change the costs of any menu item up to [14] Business Days' before the Event Date.[PARTY B]'s Changes to Ingredients. If [PARTY B] requests changes to the ingredients in a menu item, [PARTY B] shall eitherpay an updated cost for the menu item with the changed ingredient, based on current market prices and availability as determined by [PARTY A], orselect substitute menu item in order to maintain the agreed-on [per person / per platter] menu price agreed on and listed in the fee schedule of the [ATTACHMENT].

name: Menu Selection
description: Menu SelectionProvide List of Menu Items. [PARTY A] shall provide [PARTY B] with a list of menu items, including bar and beverage services, appropriate for the [per person / per platter] menu price agreed on and listed in the fee schedule of the [ATTACHMENT].Final Menu Selection. [PARTY B] shall submit its final menu selection in writing to [PARTY A], including bar and beverage services, at least [14] Business Days' before the Event Date.Changes to Menu Selection. [PARTY B] may not make changes to its final menu selection  unless [PARTY A] consents in writing.

name: Standard
description: Merger Consideration. At the Effective Time, and automatically by virtue of the Merger and without any action on the part of [PARTY A], [PARTY B], or [PARTY B] Shareholders, [PARTY A] shall pay the Merger Consideration to [PARTY B] Shareholders according to each such shareholder's Election under section [ELECTION PROCEDURES].

name: Minimum Purchase Quantity
description: Initial and Minimum Purchase OrdersInitial Purchase Order. On the Effective Date of this agreement, [PARTY B] shall place the initial purchase order of Products listed in [Exhibit A], attached to this agreement.Determine Minimum Purchase Order Quantities. At least [60] days before the beginning of each calendar year, the parties shall cooperate to determine the the minimum purchase order of Products [PARTY B] will be required to make each quarter of the upcoming year (each quarterly order, a "Minimum Purchase Order").Minimum Purchase Orders. Each calendar quarter, [PARTY B] shall purchase at least the Minimum Purchase Order.Failure to Meet Minimum Purchase Order. If [PARTY B] fails to meet the Minimum Purchase Order for any quarter, on written notice to [PARTY B], [PARTY A] may eitherconvert [PARTY B]'s exclusive rights in the Territory to non-exclusive rights for the remainder of the Term,or terminate this agreement.

name: Modification for Lender
description: Modification for Lender. If Landlord's Lender requests reasonable modifications to this Lease as a condition to financing, Tenant shall not unreasonably withhold its consent, provided such modifications do not materially and adversely affect the Tenant's rights.

name: Pro-Landlord
description: CompareModification for Lender. If Landlord's lender requests any modification to the Lease as a condition to financing, Tenant shall not withhold its consent.

name: Unlimited Right to Modify Escrow Materials
description: Modification of Escrow MaterialsRight to Modify. [PARTY A] may modify the [DELIVERABLE].Deposit Modifications. Within [MODIFICATION DEPOSIT NUMBER OF DAYS] of making a modification, [PARTY A] shall deposit the modified [DELIVERABLE] with the Escrow Agent.

name: Consent Required to Modify Escrow Materials
description: CompareModification of Escrow MaterialsConsent Required to Modify. [PARTY A] may modify the [DELIVERABLE] only if [PARTY B] gives written consent.Deposit Modifications. Within [MODIFICATION DEPOSIT NUMBER OF DAYS] of making a modification, [PARTY A] shall deposit the modified [DELIVERABLE] with the Escrow Agent.

name: Standard
description: Modifications Required for Modification. If a modification to the Premise is necessary for [PARTY A] to obtain financing for the Project, [PARTY B] shall allow [PARTY A] to make those modifications to the extent the modifications do not materially interfere with [PARTY B]'s rights under this agreement, including their right to quiet enjoyment of the premise under section [QUIET ENJOYMENT].Example NotesThis is typically an optional clause. If you do decide to include it, be sure to define "Project" in the Definitions section.

name: Public Safety/National Security
description: Monitoring and AssessmentVulnerability Assessment. The [PARTY B] will run internal and external network vulnerability scans at least quarterly and after any material change in the network configuration (e.g., new system component installations, changes in network topology, firewall rule modifications, or product upgrades). Vulnerabilities identified and rated as high risk by the Business Associate will be remediated within ninety (90) days of discovery.Application Security Assessments. For all Internet-facing applications that collect, transmit or display the Protected Information, the [PARTY B] agrees to conduct an application security assessment review to identify common security vulnerabilities as identified by industry-recognized organizations (e.g., OWASP Top 10 Vulnerabilities; CWE/SANS Top 25 vulnerabilities) annually or for all major releases, whichever occurs first. The scope of the security assessment will primarily focus on application security, including, but not limited to, a static code analysis or penetration test of the application, as well as a code review. At a minimum, it will cover the OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities (https://www.owasp.org).Third Party and Internal Review. The [PARTY B] may utilize a qualified third party to conduct the application security assessments. The [PARTY B] may conduct the security assessment review themselves, provided that the [PARTY B]’s Personnel performing the review are sufficiently trained, follow industry standard best practices, and the assessment process is reviewed and approved by the [PARTY A]. Vulnerabilities identified and rated as high risk by the [PARTY B] will be remediated within ninety (90) days of discovery.

name: Standard
description: Monitoring. [PARTY A] has no obligation, but reserves the right, to monitor and review your account information and history and the content and materials uploaded by you or others in the Software for the purpose of determining compliance with this Agreement or to detect illegal activity.

name: Mutual Acknowledgement
description: Mutual Acknowledgement. The parties acknowledge that in certain instances, applicable Law or public policy may prohibit [PARTY A] from indemnifying its directors, officers, employees, controlling Persons, agents, or fiduciaries, including [PARTY B], under this agreement or otherwise.

name: Standard
description: All representations and warranties in this agreement are for the purposes of this agreement only, and subject only to the remedies in this agreement. Neither party is asserting the truth of any representation or warranty in this agreement; rather the parties have agreed that should a representation or warranty of either party prove untrue, the other party shall have the specific rights and remedies outlined in this agreement as the exclusive remedy, and that no other rights, remedies or causes of action (whether in law or in equity or whether in contract or in tort) are permitted to either party as a result of the untruth of any representation or warranty.

name: Manufacturing; Retail
description: Network SecurityAccess The [PARTY B] shall limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).Authentication. The [PARTY B] shall authenticate or verify the identities of authorized users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to Protected Information.

name: Public Safety/National Security
description: Compare Network SecurityAccessAuthorized Users. The [PARTY B]’s security policy shall describe those employees or classes of employees or other persons under the [PARTY B]’s control granted access to the protected health information. [§164.314(f)(2)]Restricted User Access. The [PARTY B] shall limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems). [52.204-21 (b)(1)(i) & (v)]Restricted System Access. The [PARTY B] shall limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute. [52.204-21 (b)(1)(ii)]Restricted Access to External Systems. The [PARTY B] shall verify and control or limit connections to and use of external information systems. [52.204-21 (b)(1)(iii)]Restrict Distribution to Public Systems. The [PARTY B] shall restrict information posted or processed on publicly accessible information systems [52.204-21 (b)(1)(iv)]AuthenticationOrganizational Users. The [PARTY B] shall support a secure, multi-factor method of remote authentication and authorization to identified government administrators that will allow government designated personnel the ability to perform management duties on the system. The vendor shall support multi-factor authentication including [specific method of authentication].Non-Organizational Users. The [PARTY B] shall support a secure, multi-factor method of remote authentication and authorization to identified [PARTY B] administrators that will allow vendor designated personnel the ability to perform management duties on the system.[FedRAMP specific clauses: IA-2(1), (2), (3) AND (8)]Monitoring. The [PARTY B] shall maintain network security conforming to generally recognized industry standards and the network security practices it uses for its own internal network, including at a minimumnetwork firewall provisioning,intrusion detection,vulnerability assessments conducted at least three times each calendar year by independent third-party assessors, andlog management and retention of logs produced by firewalls and intrusion detection systems for a minimum period of one (1) year.Resolution of Noncompliance. The [PARTY B] shall provide an effective mechanism for resolving any issues of noncompliance with system security requirements. [52.204-21 (b)(1)(xii); §164.314(e)(2)(iii)(C)]

name: Nomination Of Directors
description: Nomination Of Directors. At any meeting of shareholders at which directors are to be elected, nominations for election to the Board of Directors may be made by the Board of Directors or, subject to the conditions described below, by any holder of shares entitled to be voted at that meeting in the election of directors. To be eligible for consideration at the meeting of shareholders, all nominations, other than those made by the Board of Directors, shall be in writing and must be delivered to Corporate Secretary not less than [60] days nor more than [90] days prior to the meeting at which such nominations will be made.

name: Nonalienation of Benefits
description: Nonalienation of Benefits. No benefit under the Plan may be assigned, transferred, pledged as security for indebtedness or otherwise encumbered by any Participant or subject to any legal process for the payment of any claim against a Participant.

name: Standard exceptions
description: Non-Confidential InformationExcluded Information. The restrictions of this agreement on the use and disclosure of Confidential Information will not apply to information that without a breach of this agreementis already known to the receiving party,is or becomes publicly known,is or subsequently comes into the possession of the receiving party from a third party, oris independently developed by the receiving party without the use of Confidential Information.Burden of Proof. The receiving party will have the burden of proof relating to all exceptions to the definition of Confidential Information.

name: Continuing Obligation
description: CompareNon-Confidential InformationExceptions. The restrictions of this agreement on use and disclosure of Confidential Information will not apply to information that is or becomes publicly known without the breach of this agreement,at the time of disclosure under this agreement is already known to the receiving party without any restriction on its disclosure,is or subsequently comes into the possession of the receiving party from a third party without violation of any contractual or legal obligation,is independently developed by the receiving party without the use of Confidential Information or breach of this agreement.Continuing Obligation. description: CompareNon-Confidential Information. name: Unilateral Obligation
description: Non-Disclosure of AgreementNon-Disclosure. Subject to paragraph [PERMITTED AND REQUIRED DISCLOSURE], [PARTY B] will not disclose the terms of this agreement, the [DELIVERABLE], or any other transaction contemplated under this agreement, including any payment obligation, to any third party, unless [PARTY A] agrees to the disclosure in writing.Permitted and Required Disclosure. Notwithstanding the prohibition on disclosure under paragraph [NON-DISCLOSURE] directly above, [PARTY B] may disclose the terms of this agreement, the [DELIVERABLE], or any other transaction contemplated under this agreement, including any payment obligationto [PARTY B]'s spouse, attorneys,to the extent necessary to prepare [PARTY B]'s income tax returns, to [PARTY B]'s accountants and tax preparers to the extent necessary to prepare [PARTY B]'s income tax returns, and to the extent disclosure is compelled by Law or Legal Proceeding.Requirements for Disclosure. [PARTY B] shall use reasonable efforts to prevent any third party to whom it  rightfully disclosed information under paragraph [PERMITTED AND REQUIRED DISCLOSURE] from further disclosing that information, including making that third party aware of the non-disclosure obligations of this agreement.Notice of Disclosure. [PARTY B] shall promptly notify [PARTY A] of any unauthorized disclosure, and use reasonable efforts to cooperate with [PARTY A] in limiting the scope of that disclosure.

name: Retirement Agreement
description: CompareNon-Disclosure of Agreement TermsNon-Disclosure. [PARTY B] will not disclose the terms of this agreement, including any payment under this agreement, to any Person, except, subject to paragraph [REQUIREMENTS FOR DISCLOSURE],to [PARTY B]'s spouse, attorneys,to the extent necessary to prepare [PARTY B]'s income tax returns, to [PARTY B]'s accountants and tax preparers to the extent necessary to prepare [PARTY B]'s income tax returns, and to the extent disclosure is compelled by Law or Legal Proceeding.Requirements for Disclosure. Before disclosing any terms of this agreement under paragraph [NON-DISCLOSURE], [PARTY B] shall obtain the agreement of any Person to whom disclosure will be made to keep such information confidential under the same to the terms listed in this section.References to Disputes. Other than the disclosure allowed under paragraph [NON-DISCLOSURE], in connection with any questions regarding any dispute the parties may have had, [PARTY B] may only say that he or she has "resolved" the dispute.

name: Mutual Obligation
description: Non-Disclosure of Discussions. Neither party may, without the other party's prior written consent, disclose the fact thatany discussions have taken place or are taking place concerning a potential business transaction or relationship between the parties, or thatany Confidential Information has been or may be disclosed between the parties.

name: Exception for financing
description: CompareNon-Disclosure of DiscussionsNon-Disclosure. Without the prior written consent of the disclosing party, or unless required by law, the receiving party will not disclose to any person that any discussions or negotiations are taking place concerning a possible transaction between the parties, including the status of such discussions or negotiations.Exceptions. The receiving party may, with disclosing party's prior written consent, have discussions with other persons relating to obtaining debt (but not equity) financing for a negotiated transaction with the disclosing party from commercial banks or other institutional sources, if the persons with whom the receiving party has such discussions agree to be bound by the terms of this agreement.

name: No disclosure without consent
description: Non-Disclosure. The receiving party will not disclose Confidential Information to a third party without the disclosing party's written consent.

name: Unilateral

[PARTY B] may make truthful statements about [PARTY A] or its Representatives, if compelled by court Order, Legal Proceeding, or otherwise required by Law, without violating the non-disparagement requirements under this section.

name: Mutual

description: Non-Merger. The rights, obligations, and representations and warranties under this agreement or under any other document entered into under this agreement will not merge on closing.

description: Non-PII Information. name: Non-Sensitive Data
description: 25. Non-Sensitive Data. Data that is not generally available publicly, but is not commercially or operationally sensitive.

name: Notice Of Adjournment
description: Notice Of Adjournment. Notice of the time and place of holding an adjourned meeting need not be given to absent directors if the time and place is fixed at the adjourned meeting.

name: Alternative 1
description: Notice of Disclosure. The receiving party shall immediately notify the disclosing party upon its becoming aware of any loss or unauthorized disclosure of any of the Confidential Information.

name: Standard
description: Notification of Certain Events. Each party shall give prompt written notice to the other parties in the event the party determines:That a condition to any of its obligations to complete this agrement cannot be fulfilled and that the party will not waive that condition.That it will not be able to comply with, perform, or satisfy in any material respect any covenant in this agreement.That the occurrence, or failure to occur, of any known event will likely cause any representation or warranty contained in this agreement to be untrue or inaccurate in any material respect;That there has been or will be any change, event, condition, or development that has had or would reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a [MATERIAL ADVERSE EFFECT].

name: Alternative 2
description: CompareConsents[Seller] shall promptly notify [Buyer] in writing of any notice or other communication from any Person alleging that the consent of such Person is or may be required in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement;Governmental Approval and Notification[Seller] shall promptly notify [Buyer] in writing of any notice or other communication from any Governmental Authority in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement.Effect of NoticeThe delivery of any notice shall not:cure any breach of, or non-compliance with, any other provision of this Agreement or (ii) limit the remedies available to the party receiving such notice.CureTo the extent any event occurs or situation arises which results or is reasonably likely to result in a breach of a representation, warranty or covenant by any party under this Agreement, such party shall use its reasonable best efforts to cure such breach prior to the Closing Date.

name: Notice of Meetings
description: Stockholder MeetingsNotice of Meetings. Written notice of every meeting of stockholders stating the place, day, hour and purposes, shall, except when otherwise required by law, be mailed at least 10 but not more than 60 days before the meeting to each stockholder of record entitled to vote.

name: Notice Of Stockholder Business And Nominations
description: Notice Of Stockholder Business And Nominations. At an annual meeting of the stockholders, only such business shall be conducted as shall have been properly brought before the meeting. To be properly brought before an annual meeting business must be: (i) specified in the notice of meeting (or any supplement thereto) given by or at the direction of the Board of Directors, (ii) otherwise properly brought before the meeting by or at the direction of the Board of Directors, or llll. otherwise properly brought before the meeting by a stockholder.

name: Notices
description: NoticesMethod of Notice. The parties will give all notices and communications between the parties in writing by (i) personal delivery, (ii) a nationally-recognized, next-day courier service, (iii) first-class registered or certified mail, postage prepaid to the address that a party has notified to be that party's address for the purposes of this section.Receipt of Notice. A notice given under this agreement will be effective onthe other party's receipt of it, orif mailed, the earlier of the other party's receipt of it and the fifth business day after mailing it.

name: Corporate Bylaws
description: CompareNoticesForm of Notice. All notices required under these bylaws will be in writing, sent by mail, postage pre-paid.Effectiveness of Notice. Notices will be deemed effective when sent.Electronic NoticeTo Directors. Notice to directors may also be given by telephone or electronically, to the extent permitted by the Laws of [GOVERNING JURISDICTION].To Shareholders. If the specific shareholder consents in writing, notice to shareholders may also be given electronically, to the extent permitted by the Laws of [GOVERNING JURISDICTION].Waiver. A person may waive any notice they are required to receive under these bylaws or the Certificate of Incorporation by a signed writing.

name: Standard
description: Notice and Failure to NotifyNotification. [PARTY B] shall promptly notify [PARTY A] in writing on being served with any summons, citation, subpoena, complaint, indictment, information, or other document relating to any proceeding or matter for which [PARTY B] may be entitled to indemnification or advancement of expenses under this agreement.Failure to Notify. [PARTY A] will be relieved of its indemnification obligations under this agreement by [PARTY B]'s failure to notify [PARTY A] to the extent [PARTY A] was prejudiced by [PARTY B]'s failure.

name: Pro-Indemnitor
description: CompareNotice by [PARTY B]Notification. Defense of Claim. [PARTY A ] may participate in, and assume the defense of any claim [PARTY B] notifies it of, at [PARTY A]'s own expense, unless otherwise provided in this agreement.

name: Public Safety/National Security
description: Notification and ResponseNotice of Security Incidents. Business Associate shall report to the Covered Entity any use or disclosure of the Protected Information not provided for by its contract of which it becomes aware, including breaches of unsecured Protected Information.Compliance with Notification Laws. Business Associate shall comply with all applicable Laws regarding the notification of individuals in the event of an unauthorized release of personally identifiable information and notification other unauthorized data and information disclosures.Procedure After Unauthorized Disclosure. Within 24 hours of discovering any breach of the Business Associate's security obligations or of any other event requiring notification under applicable Law, Business Associate shall notify Covered Entity, and any other individuals Law requires to be notified, of the breach or other events by telephone and e-mail.Proactive Procedures. Business Associate shall implement reasonable policies and procedures designed to detect and provide an appropriate response to relevant “Red Flags” that identity theft may be occurring (as defined in 16 CFR 681.2) or that may arise in the performance of Customer's activities if Business Associate has access to information protected under the Red Flag Rules. Business Associate agrees that policies and procedures to detect relevant “Red Flags” will be periodically updated. Business Associate further agrees to notify Provider of the detection of a Red Flag and to implement reasonable steps to prevent or mitigate identity theft.

name: Standard
description: Notification of Certain MattersMutual Obligation to Notify. From the date of this agreement until the [EFFECTIVE TIME/CLOSING], the parties shall promptly notify one another of any of the following:Failure of Condition Precedent. If the party determines that any of the party's conditions precedent to its obligations to effect this agreement cannot be fulfilled and the party will not waive the condition.Material Adverse Effect. If the party learns of any circumstance, development, change, event, occurrence, or effect, singularly or in the aggregate, that has or would reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect;Material Breach of any Representations, Warranties, or Covenants. Of any material breach of the party's representations, warranties, or covenants contained in this agreement that would reasonably be expected to give rise to a failure of any condition to the obligations of the other party to effect this agreement;Notices. If the party receives any notice or other communication from:any person alleging that the consent of such person is or may be required in connection with this agreement;any Governmental Authority in connection with the transactions contemplated by this agreement; andActions Commenced or Threatened. If the party learns of any Actions commenced or threatened against the party, relating to, involving, or otherwise affecting this agreement[PURCHASED GOODS, ASSUMED LIABILITIES, TARGET COMPANY]: which if pending on the date of this agreement, would have been required to be disclosed under the [LEGAL PROCEEDINGS/GOVERNMENTAL ORDERS] subclause; orthat otherwise relates to the transactions under this agreement.No Waiver. The [PARTY A], by reason of receiving information under this [NOTIFICATION OF CERTAIN MATTERS] subclause, will not be deemed to have:waived or otherwise modified the requirements of any of the [PARTY B]'s representations, warranties, or covenants under this agreement; oragreed to the amendment or supplement of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule.

name: Merger Agreement
