If the party receives any notice or other communication from:any person alleging that the consent of such person is or may be required in connection with this agreement;any Governmental Authority in connection with the transactions contemplated by this agreement; andActions Commenced or Threatened. If the party learns of any Actions commenced or threatened against the party, relating to, involving, or otherwise affecting the Merger or this agreement: which if pending on the date of this agreement, would have been required to be disclosed under the [LEGAL PROCEEDINGS/GOVERNMENTAL ORDERS] subclause; orthat otherwise relates to the transactions under this agreement.No Waiver. The [PARTY A], by reason of receiving information under this [NOTIFCATION OF CERTAIN MATTERS] subclause, will not be deemed to have:waived or otherwise modified the requirements of any of the [PARTY B]'s representations, warranties, or covenants under this agreement; oragreed to the amendment or supplement of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule.

name: Asset Purchase Agreement
description: CompareNotification of Certain MattersMutual Obligation to Notify. From the date of this agreement until the Closing, the parties shall promptly notify one another of any of the following:Failure of Condition Precedent. If the party determines that any of the party's conditions precedent to its obligations to effect this agreement cannot be fulfilled and the party will not waive the condition.Material Adverse Effect. If the party learns of any circumstance, development, change, event, occurrence, or effect, singularly or in the aggregate, that has or would reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect;Material Breach of any Representations, Warranties, or Covenants. Of any material breach of the party's representations, warranties, or covenants contained in this agreement that would reasonably be expected to give rise to a failure of any condition to the obligations of the other party to effect this agreement;Notices. If the party receives any notice or other communication from:any person alleging that the consent of such person is or may be required in connection with this agreement;any Governmental Authority in connection with the transactions contemplated by this agreement; andActions Commenced or Threatened. If the party learns of any Actions commenced or threatened against the party, relating to, involving, or otherwise affecting the Business, the Purchased Assets or the Assumed Liabilities: which if pending on the date of this agreement, would have been required to be disclosed under the [LEGAL PROCEEDINGS/GOVERNMENTAL ORDERS] subclause; orthat otherwise relates to the transactions under this agreement.No Waiver. The [PARTY A], by reason of receiving information under this [NOTIFICATION OF CERTAIN MATTERS] subclause, will not be deemed to have:waived or otherwise modified the requirements of any of the [PARTY B]'s representations, warranties, or covenants under this agreement; oragreed to the amendment or supplement of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule.

name: Changes to the Accuracy of Information
description: CompareNotification. If any event happens as a result of which any information or documents disclosed by a party under this agreement would include any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state any material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements therein not misleading in light of the circumstances under which they were made, that disclosing party shall promptly notify the other party.

name: Investment Banker Engagement Letter
description: CompareNotification of Certain ChangesNotice. [PARTY A] shall immediately notify [PARTY B]:when [PARTY A] learns of any event which occurs during the Term: as a result of which any information [PARTY A] has provided under this agreement would include any untrue statement of a material fact, or omit to state a material fact required to ensure that the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which they were made, are not misleading;the a result of which would include a material adverse effect on any of [PARTY A]'s assets or business related to a Contemplated Transaction; andof the receipt of any notification with respect to the modification, rescission, withdrawal, or suspension of the qualification or registration of any [PARTY A] securities related to a Contemplated Transaction, or of any exemption from such registration or qualification, in any jurisdiction.Efforts to Resolve. [PARTY A] shall use reasonable efforts to prevent the issuance of any such modification, rescission, withdrawal or suspension and, if any such modification, rescission, withdrawal or suspension is issued, as promptly as possible.

name: Notification of Disclosure
description: Notice of Disclosure. The receiving party will promptly notify the disclosing party if it discovers any loss or unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information.

name: Detailed notice requirements
description: CompareNotice of DisclosureNotice. The receiving party will immediately notify the disclosing party in writing upon discovery of anyunauthorized disclosure of the Confidential Information,loss, unauthorized possession, use, or Knowledge of the Confidential Information, orbreach of this agreement by the receiving party.Notice Requirements. The notice must fully detail such loss, unauthorized possession, use, or Knowledge.Cooperation. The receiving party will cooperate with the disclosing party in any reasonable fashion in order to assist the disclosing party to regain possession of the Confidential Information and prevent its further unauthorized use or disclosure.

name: Notice and cooperation
description: CompareNotice of DisclosureNotice. The receiving party will immediately notify the disclosing party in writing upon discovery of anyunauthorized disclosure of the Confidential Information, orloss, unauthorized possession, use, or knowledge of the Confidential Information.Cooperation. The receiving party will cooperate with the disclosing party in any reasonable fashion in order to assist the disclosing party to regain possession of the Confidential Information and prevent its further unauthorized use or disclosure.

name: Employee
description: CompareNotice of Disclosure. Employee will promptly notify the Company if it discovers any loss or unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information.

name: Notification of Inventions
description: Notification of Inventions. Should any invention or improvement be developed during the course of the Research, the University shall notify the Sponsor of such invention or improvement within thirty (30) days of knowledge of the invention or improvement.

name: Standard
description: Consent to Notify New Employer. If [PARTY B]'s employment relationship with [PARTY A] ends, [PARTY A] may contact any new employer of [PARTY B], notify them about [PARTY B]'s rights and obligations under this agreement, and, if appropriate, provide the new employer with a copy of this agreement.

name: Notification of Unauthorized Disclosure
description: Notification of Unauthorized Disclosure. The Receiver will promptly notify the Discloser in writing upon becoming aware of the occurrence of any material unauthorized disclosure or breach of our obligations hereunder, by us or our Representatives; such notice shall not, by itself, constitute an admission of wrongdoing

name: Notwithstanding any other terms of this Agreement, Data Recipients shall pr
description: 4. Notwithstanding any other terms of this Agreement, Data Recipients shall provide written notice to Peak, and Peak will notify any Party prior to, or as soon as practicable, following: a. Any and each release of Covered Data to a non-party, or other breach of confidentiality hereunder, with the details both of the release and breach and all measures taken to prevent a repetition thereof; and b. Every instance where Covered Data is shared with or provided to any entity’s Merchant/Market Function during a BES Emergency, as defined in the NERC Reliability Standards, with an explanation of why said event qualified as an emergency. Any notice provided under Section 2.b.ii. above, shall also constitute notice under this Section 4.

name: Standard
description: No Novation. The parties have entered into this agreement solely to amend and restate the terms of the [EARLIER AGREEMENT], this agreement it does not serve to effect a novation of the parties' obligations under that agreement, in that it will not result in any of those obligations being replaced.

name: Number, Tenure and Qualification
description: Number, Tenure and Qualification. The Board of Directors shall consist of [MINIMUM NUMBER] to [MAXIMUM NUMBER] persons. Increases or decreases to said number may be made, within the numbers authorized by the Certificate of Incorporation, as the Board of Directors shall from time to time determine by amendment to these Bylaws. An increase or a decrease in the number of the members of the Board of Directors may also be had upon amendment to these Bylaws by a majority vote of all of the stockholders. Each director shall hold office until the next annual meeting of stockholders of the Corporation and until their successor shall have been elected and shall have qualified. Directors need not be residents of [STATE OF INCORPORATION] or stockholders of the Corporation.

name: No set number of directors
description: CompareNumber, Tenure and Qualification. The authorized number of directors shall be determined from time to time by resolution of the Board of Directors, provided that the Board of Directors shall consist of at least 1 member. Increases or decreases to said number may be made, within the numbers authorized by the Certificate of Incorporation, as the Board of Directors shall from time to time determine by amendment to these Bylaws. An increase or a decrease in the number of the members of the Board of Directors may also be had upon amendment to these Bylaws by a majority vote of all of the stockholders. Each director shall hold office until the next annual meeting of stockholders of the Corporation and until their successor shall have been elected and shall have qualified. Directors need not be residents of [STATE OF INCORPORATION] or stockholders of the Corporation.

name: Standard
description: Obligations and Activities of [PARTY B]Use or Disclosure. [PARTY B] will not to use or disclose PHI [PARTY B] creates or receives from, or on behalf of, [PARTY A], unless expressly permitted or required by this agreement or required by Law.SafeguardsData Security. [PARTY B] shalluse appropriate safeguards to prevent use or disclosure of PHI, anddevelop, implement, maintain, and use appropriate administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of electronic-form PHI that [PARTY B] creates, receives, maintains, transmits, or accesses on behalf of [PARTY A].Provision of Security Policies. On [PARTY A]'s request, [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] with a copy of [PARTY B]'s information security policies and procedures.Audit of Security Procedures. On reasonable notice from [PARTY A] and during normal business hours, [PARTY B] shallallow [PARTY A] to audit [PARTY B]'s compliance with [PARTY B]'s security program and the terms of this agreement, andcooperate with [PARTY A]'s audit, including providing copies of any documents [PARTY A] reasonably requests, at no charge to [PARTY A]Obligations in Case of BreachNotice of Breach. [PARTY B] shall report to [PARTY A] any Breach of Unsecured PHI ("Breach" and "Unsecured are both defined at the end of this section [OBLIGATIONS AND ACTIVITIES OF PARTY B]) that [PARTY B] accesses, maintains, retains, modifies, records, stores, destroys, or otherwise holds or uses on behalf of [PARTY A] within two days after discovering the Breach.Contents of Notice. [PARTY B] shall include in its notice of a Breach all information [PARTY B] knows regarding the breach, includingthe scope of the Breach (e.g. the numbers of individuals affected and PHI elements included),the date of the Breach, if known,the circumstances surrounding the Breach, and[PARTY B]'s plans to investigate and mitigate the Breach.Status Reports on Investigation. During its investigation, [PARTY B] shall provide updates on the status and findings to [PARTY A].Final Report on Investigation. On the conclusion of its investigation, [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] a written report on the investigation, including at a minimumthe actual scope of the Breach, (e.g. identification of each individual whose PHI has been, or is reasonably believed to have been, accessed, acquired, or disclosed during the Breach),the date of the Breach, if known, anda description of [PARTY B]'s response to the Breach.Mitigation of Breach. [PARTY B] shall, in consultation with [PARTY A], mitigate to the extent practicable any harmful effect of the Breach [PARTY B] knows about.Unauthorized Disclosures and Improper UseTrack Authorized Disclosures. [PARTY B] shall track all disclosures of PHI to third parties, including those made to [PARTY B]'s subcontractors, affiliates, agents, and representatives, other than those disclosures that meet the exception criteria of HIPAA and the HITECH Act.Report Unauthorized Disclosures and Improper Use. [PARTY B] shall report to [PARTY A] any unauthorized disclosure or improper use of PHI under this agreement or applicable Law within two Business Days of the date [PARTY B] becomes aware of that use or disclosure.Mitigate Unauthorized Disclosures and Improper Use. If there is any improper use or disclosure of PHI, [PARTY B] shall, in consultation with [PARTY A], mitigate to the extent practicable any harmful effect of that improper use or disclosure [PARTY B] knows about.Reporting of Security Incidents. If [PARTY B] becomes aware of any security incident involving PHI, within two Business Days of becoming aware of it [PARTY B] shall give [PARTY A] a written report of the incident and of the measures [PARTY B] will be take to mitigate harm from that incident and to prevent similar incidents in the future.Subcontractors and Agents. [PARTY B] shall obtain and maintain a written agreement with each third party, agent, and subcontractor that has or will have access to PHI, under which agreement each third party, agent, or subcontractor will be bound by the same restrictions, terms, and conditions that apply to [PARTY B] regarding use and disclosure of PHI under this agreement.Designated Record Sets. On [PARTY A]'s request, [PARTY B] shall, in the time and manner [PARTY A] reasonably requests, provide [PARTY A] access to PHI in a Designated Record Set as necessary for [PARTY A] to comply with 45 CFR 164.524 and applicable [GOVERNING LAW STATE] State Law, and make any amendment to PHI in a Designated Record Set that [PARTY A] directs or agrees to under 45 CFR 164.526 and applicable [GOVERNING LAW STATE] State Law.Audit and Inspection. [PARTY B] shall make its internal practices, books, and records relating to the use and disclosure of PHI available to the secretary of health and human services, or to [PARTY A] as necessary to demonstrate its compliance with the HIPAA Privacy Rule at 45 CFR 160, as in effect of amended, and make that information available in the time and manner reasonably requested by [PARTY A] or the secretary, as applicable.Documentation of Disclosures. [PARTY B] shall document the disclosures of PHI, and any information related to those disclosures, that [PARTY A] would require to respond to requests for an accounting of PHI disclosures under HIPAA Regulations, the HITECH Act, and applicable [GOVERNING LAW STATE] State Law.Accounting of Disclosures. [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] information collected under paragraph [DOCUMENTATION OF DISCLOSURES] necessary to permit [PARTY A] to respond to requests for an accounting of PHI disclosures under HIPAA Regulations, the HITECH Act, and applicable [GOVERNING LAW STATE] State Law, and provide that information to [PARTY A] promptly after the date of the disclosures, includingthe date of the disclosure,the name of the Person who received the PHI,a brief description of the PHI disclosed, anda brief statement of the purpose of that disclosure, and explanation of the basis for the disclosure.Requests from Individuals. If a Person requests access to, amendment of, or accounting of PHI directly from [PARTY B], within two Business Days of that request [PARTY B] shall forward each request to [PARTY A] to respond to.DefinitionsBreach. "Breach" means an unauthorized acquisition, access, use, or disclosure of PHI which compromises the security or privacy of that information.Unsecured. "Unsecured" means PHI that is not rendered unusable, unreadable, or indecipherable to unauthorized individuals through the use of a technology or methodology specified by the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

name: Standard
description: Obligations of [PARTY A]. [PARTY A] will not request any use or disclosure of PHI by [PARTY B] that would not be permissible under HIPAA or the HIPAA Regulations if done by [PARTY A], or that is not expressly permitted under this agreement.

name: Alternative 1
description: Offer. This purchase order ("Order") is an offer by [BUYER NAME] ("[PARTY A]") to [SELLER NAME] ("[PARTY B]") for the purchase of the goods or services specified on the front page of this Order (the "Goods").

name: Standard
description: Offering Materials[PARTY A]'s Responsibility. [PARTY A] is and has been solely responsible for the contents of:the private placement memorandum, registration statement, or other offering document, except for information provided in writing by [PARTY B] concerning the plan of distribution, pricing of the Securities offered, and [PARTY B] and its Affiliates (as such may be amended or supplemented from time to time, and including any information incorporated therein by reference, the "Offering Materials"); andany and all other written or oral communications, except for underwriter free writing prospectus or solicitation materials, provided by [PARTY B] to any actual or prospective purchaser of the securities.Accuracy of Offering Materials. Accuracy of Information. None of the information supplied or to be supplied by the [PARTY A][, including [SPECIFIC DOCUMENTS, TYPES OF INFO] in the Offering Materials, registration Statement, or other materials related to its securities will contain any untrue statement of a material fact, or omit to state a material fact required to ensure that the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which they were made, are not misleading.Reasonableness of Projections. Any financial projections or other projections, estimates, or forecast [PARTY A] has included in the Offering Materials, have been and will be made with a reasonable basis and in good faith and that the such projections will represent the best then-available estimate and judgment as to [PARTY A]'s future financial and other performance, based on the assumptions to be disclosed therein, which assumptions will be all the assumptions that are material in forecasting its financial and other results, and which will reflect the best then-available estimate of the events, contingencies and circumstances described therein.Compliance of Information with Applicable Law. The information supplied by the [PARTY A][, including [SPECIFIC DOCUMENTS, TYPES OF INFO] will comply as to form in all material respects with the requirements of any applicable Law.Notice. [PARTY A] shall immediately notify [PARTY B]:when [PARTY A] learns of any event which occurs during the Term: as a result of which the Offering Materials would include any untrue statement of a material fact, or omit to state a material fact required to ensure that the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which they were made, are not misleading;the a result of which would include a material adverse effect on any of [PARTY A]'s assets or business related to a Contemplated Transaction; andof the receipt of any notification with respect to the modification, rescission, withdrawal, or suspension of the qualification or registration of any [PARTY A] securities related to a Contemplated Transaction, or of any exemption from such registration or qualification, in any jurisdiction.Suspend Solicitations. On receipt of such notice from [PARTY A], [PARTY B] shall immediately suspend solicitation until receiving further notice from [PARTY A] that the issue has been resolved.Efforts to Resolve. [PARTY A] shall use reasonable efforts to prevent the issuance of any such modification, rescission, withdrawal or suspension and, if any such modification, rescission, withdrawal or suspension is issued, as promptly as possible.

name: Offering Periods
description: Offering PeriodsTiming of Offering Periods. This plan will be implemented by consecutive Offering Periods, each one commencing on the first Trading Day on or after [February 1 and August 1] each year, or on such other date as the Administrator will determine.Changes to Offering Periods. The Administrator may change the duration of Offering Periods (including their start dates) for future Offerings without stockholder approval, if the change is announced before the scheduled beginning of the first Offering Period affected by the change.

name: Office and Support Staff
description: Office and Support Staff. During the Term, the Company shall provide the Executive an office or offices of a size and quality and exclusive personal secretarial and other assistance that are generally provided to other [senior] executives of the Company.

name: Officer Election, Term of Office and Qualifications
description: OfficersElection, Term of Office and Qualifications. The officers shall be elected by the Board of Directors at its annual meeting and shall serve for terms of one year, or until their successors are duly elected and qualified. All assistant officers shall be elected or appointed at such times and for such terms as the Board of Directors may determine.

name: Standard
description: OfficersGeneral. The Board will choose the Corporation's officers, including a president, Treasurer, secretary, and other officers the Board of Directors may determine to be necessary or appropriate. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person.Election, Term of Office and QualificationsElection of Officers. The Board will elect the officers at its annual meeting.Term of Regular Officers. Each director will serve for one year, or until their successors are elected and qualified.Appointment and Term of Assistant Officers. The Board may elect assistant officers to serve terms the Board determines.Compensation. The Board will determine the amount of compensation officers receive.Removal. The Board may remove any officer or agent it elects, without prejudice to that officer's or director's contract rights.Resignation. Any officer may resign by giving written notice to the Corporation's president, effective immediately or at a time specified in the notice. Vacancies. The Board will fill any officer vacancies.Chairman of the BoardChairman's Role. The Board's chairman will preside at all Board meetings.Chairman's Power. The Board's chairman may execute bonds, mortgages, contracts, and other documents for the Corporation, except for documents required by Law to be otherwise executed, or where the Board has delegated the execution of a particular document to another officer.Vice-Chairman of the Board. The Board may elect one of its members to be the Board's vice-chairman, who will preside at all meetings of the Board of and or of shareholders if the chairman is not present.Chief Executive Officer. The Corporation's chief executive officer, if one is elected, will have such powers and perform the duties that the Board designates.President President's Role. The Corporation's President will have the general direction and control of the Corporation's affairs of the Corporation, and the authority and duties the Board assigns.President's Power. The Corporation's president may execute bonds, mortgages, contracts, and other documents for the Corporation, except for documents required by Law to be otherwise executed, or where the Board has delegated the execution of a particular document to another officer.Vice-Presidents. The Corporation's vice presidents, if any, will perform the duties the Board or president assigns.Secretary. The Corporation's secretary will attend all Board and committee meetings and record all votes and minutes for all transactions in a book to be kept for that purpose, andThe secretary will give notice of all Board meetings, and perform other duties the Board or president assigns.The secretary will keep in safe custody the Corporation's seal and, when the Board authorizes fix the seal to any instrument requiring it and attest to it by their signature.Treasurer Treasurer's Role. The Corporation's treasurer will have custody of the Corporation's funds and securities, keep correct accounts of receipts and disbursements in books belonging to the Corporation, and deposit the Corporation's monies and other valuable effects in separate accounts or depositaries in the Corporation's name and creditFinancial Accounts. The treasurer will disburse the Corporation's funds as the Board orders, and on the Board's request deliver to the Board an account of all the treasurer's transactions and of the Corporation's financial condition.Subordinate OfficersSelection of Subordinate Officers. The Board may select the number and types of subordinate officers it desires.Term and Roles of Subordinate Officers. Subordinate officers will hold office for such period, have the authority, and perform the duties the Board or president assigns.Delegate Power to Appoint Subordinates. The Board may authorize any officer to appoint and remove subordinate officers, or to prescribe a subordinate's powers and duties.Other Officers. The Board will determine the functions and responsibilities of any other assistant officers.

name: Standard — Merger Agreement
description: Officers and Directors of the Surviving Company. Immediately prior to the Effective Time:The officers and directors of the Company shall resign (from their capacity as officers and directors, not necessarily as employees); andThe officers and directors of the Merger Sub at the time will become the officers and directors of the Surviving Company.

name: Officers Compensation
description: Compensation. The compensation of all the officers of the Corporation shall be fixed by the Board of Directors.

name: Officers General
description: General. The officers of the Corporation shall be chosen by the Board of Directors and shall include a President, Treasurer, Secretary, and may include such other officers as the Board of Directors may determine to be necessary or appropriate. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person.

name: Officers' Powers And Duties
description: Powers And Duties. The officers of the Company will have those powers and duties as generally pertain to their offices as well as any powers and duties that the Board of Directors may from time to time confer upon them.

name: Officers Removal
description: Removal. Any officer or agent elected or appointed by the Board of Directors may be removed by the Board of Directors, with or without cause, but such removal shall be without prejudice to the contract rights, if any, of the person so removed.

name: Officers Resignation
description: Resignation. Any officer may resign at any time by giving written notice to the President. Any such resignation shall take effect upon receipt of such notice or at any later time specified in the notice.

name: Officers Vacancies
description: Vacancies. A vacancy in any office shall be filled by the Board of Directors.

name: Standard
description: OfficesRegistered Office. The Board will determine the location of the Corporation's registered office.Principal Office. The principal office of the Corporation will be in the city of [CITY] in the State of [STATE].Other Offices. The Board may determine other offices for the Corporation to have.

name: Broad Board Authority
description: CompareOffices In addition to the Corporation's registered office listed in its Certificate of Incorporation, the Board of Directors may establish other offices at any place where the Corporation is qualified to do business.

name: Official DMCA Notice
description: [LETTERHEAD INCLUDING CONTACT INFORMATION]We write this letter on behalf of [COPYRIGHT OWNER](the ΓÇ£Copyright OwnerΓÇ¥) and provide notice of copyright infringement under Section 512(c) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (the "DMCA").

name: Older Workers Benefit Protection Act
description: Older Workers Benefit Protection ActCompliance with Act. The parties hereby acknowledge their mutual intent that this agreement comply with and be enforceable under the terms of the Older Workers Benefit Protection Act of 1990.[PARTY B]'s Acknowledgments. [PARTY B] hereby acknowledges that before signing this agreement, [PARTY B]has been given the opportunity, for no less than [21] Business Days, to consider the terms of this agreement,has been given ample opportunity to consult with an attorney regarding this agreement,has carefully read and fully understands all of the terms of this agreement,knowingly and voluntarily agrees to all of the terms of this agreement, andis not waiving rights or claims under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 which may arise after the execution of the Agreement.

name: Operations
description: Operations of Franchised BusinessCondemnation and Casualty of Franchise LocationNotify [PARTY A] of Condemnation. [PARTY B] shall promptly notify [PARTY A] of any proposed taking of the Franchise Location through the exercise of the power of eminent domain.Request Relocation from [PARTY A]. If the Franchise Location is to be taken, on [PARTY B]'s request [PARTY A] may, in its discretion, allow [PARTY B] to relocate its Franchised Business to a new location.Casualty. If the Franchise Location is damaged, [PARTY B] shall promptly repair the damage.Insurance. [PARTY B] shall obtain and maintain the insurance policies listed in and according to [ATTACHMENT].TrainingInitial Training. [PARTY B] shall complete [PARTY A]'s initial training programs, according to [PARTY A]'s then-current training guidelines and costs, at the next scheduled training class after the Effective Date.Employee Training. Before allowing any Person to hold a management position at the Franchised Business, [PARTY B] shall require that Person complete [PARTY A]'s initial training programs, according to [PARTY A]'s then-current training guidelines and costs.Regional Training. [PARTY B] shall complete one or more of [PARTY A]'s regional training programs, according to [PARTY A]'s then-current training guidelines and costs.Update Training. [PARTY B] shall attend and complete annual update training programs, according to [PARTY A]'s then-current training guidelines and costs.Inspection by [PARTY A]Inspection During Normal Business Hours. On at least [two] Business Days' notice to [PARTY B], [PARTY A] may inspect the Franchise Location, and [PARTY B]'s Books and Records, and Tax Returns, during [PARTY B]'s normal business hours.Pay Costs and Missing Fees. If [PARTY A]'s inspection reveals that [PARTY B]'s gross sales have been understated by [2]% or more for any Accounting Period, [PARTY B] shall immediately pay to [PARTY A] the cost of the audit and the amount of royalty fees, plus interest.Operating HoursPost Operating Hours. Subject to applicable Laws, [PARTY B] shall post the operating hours conspicuously at the Franchise LocationModify Operating Hours. The parties may modify the operating hours only by written agreement.[PARTY B]'s EmployeesEmployee Sufficient Employees. [PARTY B] shall employ a sufficient number of trained and competent employees to ensure sufficient service to [PARTY B]'s customers.Relationship with [PARTY A]. No employee of [PARTY B] will be deemed an employee of [PARTY A].Accounting and Record Keeping. At [PARTY A]'s request, [PARTY B] shall, at its expense, provide to [PARTY A] a reviewed or audited profit and loss statement and balance sheet for the Franchised Business within [60] Business Days of the end of each fiscal year.Activities at the Franchise Location. At the Franchise Location, [PARTY B] will notengage in any business except for the Franchised Business, without [PARTY A]'s written consent, orallow the location to be used for any immoral or illegal purpose or activity.Operations ManualOperate According to Manuals. [PARTY B] shall operate the Franchised Business according to the Manuals.Confidentiality of Manuals. [PARTY B] shall treat the Manuals and all information contained in them as Confidential Information, subject to the confidentiality obligations under the attached [Non-Disclosure Agreement] referred to in section [CONFIDENTIALITY].Copying of Manuals. [PARTY B] will not copy, duplicate, record or otherwise reproduce the Manuals or any information in the Manuals, without [PARTY A]'s written consent.Ownership of Manuals. [PARTY A] will retain all ownership interests in the Manuals.Revised ManualsRight to Revise Manuals. [PARTY A] may revise the Manuals or any part of a Manual.Deliver Revised Manuals to [PARTY B]. Promptly after making any revision to a Manual, [PARTY A] shall deliver the revised Manuals to [PARTY B].Comply with Revised Manuals. Within a reasonable time of receiving revised Manuals from [PARTY A], [PARTY B] shall ensure that all operations of the Franchised Business comply with the revisions.

name: Operations of Merger Sub
description: Operations of Merger Sub. The Merger Sub:Is a wholly-owned Subsidiary of the Parent;Was formed solely for the purpose of engaging in the Merger;Has engaged in no other business activities; andHas conducted its operations only as contemplated by this agreement.

name: Real Property Lease
description: Option to PurchaseExercising [PARTY B]'s Option. At the end of the Initial Term, [PARTY B] may purchase the Premises from [PARTY A] for $[PURCHASE PRICE AMOUNT] by notifying [PARTY A] of its intent to purchase the Premise at least [120] days before the expiration of the Initial Term.Requests for Additional Information. On [PARTY B]'s request, [PARTY A] shall deliver to [PARTY B], before the deadline to purchase the Premise, information in [PARTY A]'s possession related to the condition of the Premise including, environmental reports, surveys, and title work.Closing Time and Location. The parties shall close the purchase at [CLOSING LOCATION] on the first Business Day following the expiration date of the Initial Term listed in section [TERM].Deliver Proof of Title. Within [30] days after [PARTY B] notifies [PARTY A] of its intent to purchase, [PARTY A], at its own expense, shall deliver to [PARTY B] a commitment for an owner's policy of title insurance from [INSURANCE COMPANY] showing [PARTY A]'s title to be good and marketable, free and clear of all liens or encumbrances, except for this agreement and any financing to be paid at closing. Satisfy Encumbrances. Before the closing, [PARTY A] shall satisfy any encumbrances imposed by or through [PARTY A] against the Premise, or any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Premise.Taxes in Connection with Purchase. [PARTY B] shall bear all real estate taxes, documentary or deed tax stamps, and installments of special assessments in connection with the purchase.Warranty Deed. [PARTY A] shall convey the Premise to [PARTY B] by a warranty deed in recordable form.Closing Deliverables. At the closing, [PARTY A] shall deliver to [PARTY B] a bill of sale,the customary seller's affidavit,an assignment of this agreement (or at [PARTY B]'s option, a termination of this agreement),assignments of contracts, warranties, and permits, and any other documents reasonably necessary to effectuate the purchase. Prorate Final Rent Payments. [PARTY A] shall prorate the Rent and other payments for the month in which closing occurs.Right to Revoke Exercise of Option for Material Adverse Change. [PARTY B] may revoke its exercise of the option to purchase (and this agreement will continue as if the option had never been exercised) if there is any material adverse change in the Premise after [PARTY B] exercises its option to purchase but before the closing date, and that change was not caused by [PARTY B]'s act or omission,

name: Personal Property Lease
description: CompareOption to PurchaseExercising [PARTY B]'s Option. [PARTY B] may purchase the Equipment from [PARTY A] for [an amount the parties agree to in writing / $[PURCHASE PRICE AMOUNT]] by notifying [PARTY A] of its intent to purchase the Equipment at least [60] days before the expiration of the Term.Requests for Additional Information. On [PARTY B]'s request, [PARTY A] shall deliver to [PARTY B], before the deadline to purchase the Equipment, information in [PARTY A]'s possession related to the condition of the Equipment, including, environmental reports, surveys, and title work.Closing Time and Location. The parties shall close the purchase at [CLOSING LOCATION] on the first Business Day following the expiration of the Term.Deliver Proof of Title. Within [30] days after [PARTY B] notifies [PARTY A] of its intent to purchase, [PARTY A], at its own expense, shall deliver to [PARTY B] a commitment for an owner's policy of title insurance from [INSURANCE COMPANY] showing [PARTY A]'s title to be good and marketable, free and clear of all Encumbrances, except for this agreement and any financing to be paid at closing. Satisfy Encumbrances. Before the closing, [PARTY A] shall satisfy any Encumbrances imposed by or through [PARTY A] against the Equipment, or any alterations, additions, or improvements to the Equipment.Taxes in Connection with Purchase. [PARTY B] shall bear all real estate taxes, documentary or deed tax stamps, and installments of special assessments in connection with the purchase.Closing Deliverables. At the closing, [PARTY A] shall deliver to [PARTY B] a bill of sale,the customary seller's affidavit,an assignment of this agreement (or at [PARTY B]'s option, a termination of this agreement),assignments of contracts, warranties, and permits, and any other documents reasonably necessary to effectuate the purchase. Prorate Final Rent Payments. [PARTY A] shall prorate the Rent and other payments for the month in which closing occurs.Right to Revoke Exercise of Option for Material Adverse Change. [PARTY B] may revoke its exercise of the option to purchase (and this agreement will continue as if the option had never been exercised) if there is any material adverse change in the Equipment after [PARTY B] exercises its option to purchase but before the closing date, and that change was not caused by [PARTY B]'s act or omission,

name: Standard
description: Option to Renew. If [PARTY B] is not in breach of this agreement at the end of the Term, [PARTY B] may have the first option to renew this agreement on the terms the parties agree to before [PARTY A] offers the [Premise / Equipment] to any third party.

name: Reseller Agreement: limited right to cancel
description: OrdersPurchase Orders. [PARTY B] will submit all orders for Products to [PARTY A] in writing to [PARTY A]'s address listed in the introduction to this agreement, or as [PARTY A] otherwise specifies in writing, (each a "Purchase Order") and include in each Purchase Ordereach Product it is ordering, identified by model or part number,the amount of each Product it is ordering,the unit price of each Product it is ordering,the location for delivery, andthe delivery date, allowing reasonable time for [PARTY A] to receive, review, and process the Purchase Order, and to ship the Products (the "Delivery Date").Accepting, Modifying, and Rejecting Purchase OrdersBy Notice. Within [seven] Business Days' of receiving a Purchase Order from [PARTY B], [PARTY A] shall accept, reject, or propose a modification to the Purchase Order by sending [PARTY B] written notice of its acceptance, rejection, or proposed modification.Deemed Acceptance. If [PARTY A] fails to notify [PARTY B] of its acceptance, rejection, or proposed modification, [PARTY B] may deem that [PARTY A] accepted the Purchase Order.Modification of Purchase Order. [PARTY A] may propose a modification to a Purchase Order by including in its notice to [PARTY B] a modified Purchase Order for [PARTY B] to accept or reject according to the acceptance and rejection procedures under paragraphs [BY NOTICE] and [DEEMED ACCEPTANCE].Canceling Purchase Orders. [PARTY B] may, at no expense to itself, cancel part or all of a Purchase Order up to [CANCELLATION WINDOW] Business Days before the Delivery Date.

name: Reseller Agreement: right to cancel at any time
description: CompareOrdersPurchase Orders. [PARTY B] will submit all orders for Products (each a "Purchase Order") to [PARTY A] in writing to [PARTY A]'s address listed in the introduction to this agreement, or as [PARTY A] otherwise specifies in writing, and include in each Purchase Ordereach Product it is ordering, identified by model or part number,the amount of each Product it is ordering,the unit price of each Product it is ordering,the location for delivery, andthe delivery date, allowing reasonable time for [PARTY A] to receive, review, and process the Purchase Order and to ship the Products (the "Delivery Date").Accepting, Modifying, and Rejecting Purchase OrdersBy Notice. Within [seven] Business Days' of receiving a Purchase Order from [PARTY B], [PARTY A] shall accept, reject, or propose a modification to the Purchase Order by sending [PARTY B] written notice of its acceptance, rejection, or proposed modification.Deemed Acceptance. If [PARTY A] fails to notify [PARTY B] of its acceptance, rejection, or proposed modification, [PARTY B] may deem that [PARTY A] accepted the Purchase Order.Modification. [PARTY A] may propose a modification to a Purchase Order by including in it's notice to [PARTY B] a modified Purchase Order for [PARTY B] to accept or reject according to the acceptance and rejection procedures under paragraphs [BY NOTICE] and [DEEMED ACCEPTANCE].Cancelling Purchase Orders. [PARTY B] may, at no expense to itself, cancel part or all of a Purchase Order at any time before delivery.

name: Product Sales Agreement
description: CompareOrdersUse of Standard Form. [PARTY B] will submit purchase orders for the Products on [PARTY A]'s standard form ("Purchase Orders").Contents of Order. [PARTY B] will include in each Purchase Ordereach Product it is ordering, identified by model or part number,the amount of each Product it is ordering,the unit price of each Product it is ordering,the location for delivery, andthe delivery date, allowing reasonable time for [PARTY A] to receive, review, and process the Purchase Order and to ship the Products (the "Delivery Date").[PARTY A]'s Acceptance or Rejection.Notice of Acceptance or Rejection. Within [three] Business Days of receiving [PARTY B]'s Purchase Order, [PARTY A] will notify [PARTY B] whether it is accepting or rejecting the Purchase Order.Acceptance and Deemed Acceptance or Orders. The parties will be bound by the Purchase Order when [PARTY A] gives [PARTY B] notice of its acceptance, orif [PARTY A] fails to notify [PARTY B] of its acceptance or rejection within [three] Business Days of receiving [PARTY B]'s Purchase Order.Waiver of Objections. [PARTY A] will be deemed to have waived any objection to the terms of a Purchase Order on its delivery of the Products detailed in the Purchase Order.Reasons for Rejection. [PARTY A] will include in its notice of rejection include specific grounds for the rejection.Modification. [PARTY A] may propose a modification to a Purchase Order by including in its notice to [PARTY B] a modified Purchase Order, for [PARTY B] to accept or reject according to the acceptance and rejection procedures under this section.

name: Product Sales Agreement: Pro-Supplier
description: CompareProduct Sales AgreementUse of Standard Form. [PARTY B] will submit purchase order for Products on [PARTY A]'s standard form ("Purchase Orders").Contents of Order. [PARTY B] will include in each Purchase Ordereach Product it is ordering, identified by model or part number,the amount of each Product it is ordering,the unit price of each Product it is ordering,the location for delivery, andthe delivery date, allowing reasonable time for [PARTY A] to receive, review, and process the Purchase Order and to ship the Products (the "Delivery Date").[PARTY A]'s Acceptance or Rejection.Notice of Acceptance or Rejection. Within [three] Business Days of receiving [PARTY B]'s Purchase Order, [PARTY A] will notify [PARTY B] whether it is accepting or rejecting the Purchase Order.Acceptance and Deemed Acceptance or Orders. The parties will be bound by the Purchase Order when [PARTY A] gives [PARTY B] notice of its acceptance, orif [PARTY A] fails to notify [PARTY B] of its acceptance or rejection within [three] Business Days of receiving [PARTY B]'s Purchase Order.Waiver of Objections. [PARTY A] will be deemed to have waived any objection to the terms of a Purchase Order on its delivery of the Products detailed in the Purchase Order.Reasons for Rejection. [PARTY A] will include in its notice of rejection include specific grounds for the rejection.Modification. [PARTY A] may propose a modification to a Purchase Order by including in its notice to [PARTY B] a modified Purchase Order, for [PARTY B] to accept or reject according to the acceptance and rejection procedures under this section.Order Limits. If [PARTY B] orders a quantity of Products in any one calendar month that is more than [PERCENTAGE THRESHOLD]% greater than the quantity of Products reflected in the forecast for that calendar month, [PARTY A] will use reasonable efforts to fulfill that Purchase Order in that calendar month, butwill not be liable for failure to meet the quantity of the Products ordered over the Forecast amount.

name: Organization
description: OrganizationFormation. The Members hereby organize a limited liability company under the [RELEVANT STATE ACT] (the "Act") and the terma of this Operating Agreement and, for that purpose, have caused Articles of Organization to be prepared, signed, and filed with the Secretary of State on [FILING DATE].Name of the Company. The name of the Company will be [COMPANY NAME]. The Company may do business under that name and under any other name or names upon which the Members may determine. If the Company does business under a name other than that set forth in the Articles of Organization, the Company shall file a fictitious name registration as required by law.Purpose. The Company is organized to conduct any lawful business under the laws of the various states of the United States of America.Principal Office. The principal place of business and mailing address of the Company, and the office where the records required by the Act are kept is [REGISTERED OFFICE ADDRESS], or at such other location selected, from time to time, by the Board.Term. The term of the Company will be perpetual, unless its existence is sooner terminated under this agreement.Registered Office/Agent. The registered office of the Company in [STATE OF INCORPORATION] is at the office of the statutory agent of the Company in [STATE OF INCORPORATION]. The statutory agent of the Company in Delaware is [STATUTORY AGENT NAME]. The Board may, from time to time, change the statutory agent or the principal place of business of the Company, without reflecting the change in this Agreement.Members. The name and present mailing address of the Members are as follows: [LIST NAMES AND ADDRESSES]

name: [PARTY A]
description: OrganizationOrganized. [PARTY A] is organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction of its incorporation or organization.Authorized. [PARTY A] has all requisite power and authority to own, operate, and lease its properties, and carry on its business as and where that business is currently conducted.Qualified. [PARTY A] is licensed or qualified to do business, and is in good standing in each jurisdiction in which the nature of its business, or the character or location of its owned or leased properties and assets, makes licensing or qualification necessary, except where failure to quality does not constitute a Material Adverse Change.

name: With Specific Qualifications
description: CompareOrganizationOrganized. [PARTY A] is organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction of its incorporation or organization.Authorized. In particular, the [PARTY] reasonably believes that as of the [CLOSING TIME OF THE AGREEMENT] that it will satisfy the conditions to qualify as:[ENUMERATED LIST OF SPECIFIC QUALIFICATIONS]
