name: Certain Pets Permitted
description: Certain Pets Permitted on PremisePets. [PARTY B] may have no more than [NUMBER OF PETS] domestic dogs, cats, or birds on the Premises.Security Deposit for Pets. If [PARTY B] does keep any permitted pet on the Premise, [PARTY B] shall pay [PARTY A] a non-refundable pet deposit of $[PET DEPOSIT AMOUNT].

name: No Pets
description: CompareNo Pets Permitted. Pets. [PARTY B] may not have any pets on the Premise.

name: Place of Meetings
description: Place of Meetings. The Board of Directors may designate any place in or outside [STATE OF INCORPORATION] for any annual or special meeting of the stockholders. If no designation is made, the meeting will be at the principal office of the Corporation.

name: Revocable, Limited Power of Attorney
description: Power of Attorney. [PARTY B] hereby appoints [PARTY A] as its attorney in fact, with full power of substitution, with power and authority to do all things necessary or advisable in connection with the transactions contemplated under this agreement.

name: Irrevocable Power Granted By Debtor
description: ComparePower of AttorneyGrant of Power of Attorney. [PARTY B] hereby irrevocably appoints [PARTY A], and any officer or agent of [PARTY A], with full power of substitution, as its true and lawful attorney-in-fact with full, irrevocable power and authority in the place and stead of [PARTY B] and in the name of [PARTY B] or in its own name for the purpose of carrying out the terms of this agreement.Rights Only Exercisable Upon Default. [PARTY A]'s rights under this power of attorney arise only on the occurrence of a Default.Power Coupled with an Interest. The power of attorney granted under this sectionis a power coupled with an interest, andwill be irrevocable until the Purpose is completely and indefeasibly fulfilled in full.Performance by [PARTY A]. If [PARTY B] fails to perform any obligation contained in this agreement, [PARTY A] shall do so under this power of attorney.Binding Nature. [PARTY B] will be bound by any actions made by its attorney in good faith and without negligence under this power of attorney.Waiver. [PARTY B] shall ratify, and hereby waives, all defenses that may be available to it to contest any action of its attorney taken in good faith and without negligence under this power of attorney.Reimbursement of Expenses. [PARTY B] shall reimburse [PARTY A] for all reasonable expenses (including attorneys' fees and costs), [PARTY A] incurs in connection with carrying out its role as [PARTY B]’s attorney, together with interest at a rate of interest equal to the highest annual rate of interest charged on advances under the [Credit Agreement] within [five] business days of demand.

name: Irrevocable power grantor by an assignor
description: ComparePower of AttorneyGrant of Power of Attorney. If [PARTY B] is unable, for any reason, to obtain the assistance of [PARTY A], [PARTY A] hereby designates and appoints [PARTY B] as [PARTY A]'s agent and attorney-in-fact, with full power of substitution in [PARTY A]'s name and stead, to act for and on behalf of [PARTY A] to take any and all steps tovest or perfect rights in [PARTY B],protect such rights, orenforce any claim or right of any kind with respect those rights.Power Coupled with an Interest. The power of attorney granted under this sectionis a power coupled with an interest, andwill be irrevocable until all [PARTY A]'s obligations are completely and performed in full.

name: Powers
description: Powers. The Company has good and valid rights in and title to the Collateral with respect to which it has purported to grant a Security Interest hereunder and has full power and authority to grant the Security Interest to the Secured Party and to perform its obligations under this agreement, without the consent or approval of any other Person other than any consent or approval that has been obtained.

name: Alternative 2
description: CompareNo Violation of Articles, Bylaws or Agreements. The grant of the Security Interest does not and will not violate the provisions of, or constitute a default under, any presently applicable law or its Articles of Incorporation, Bylaws, any other organizational document or any agreement or instrument to which the Company is a party.

name: Standard
description: Powers Coupled With Interest. [PARTY A]'s authorizations and rights under this agreement are powers coupled with an interest and irrevocable until the Secured Obligations have been fully paid.

name: Standard
description: Powers of Attorney. Other than those powers of attorney set out in the [PARTY]'s Disclosure Schedule, the [PARTY] has not granted powers of attorney to any person with respect to the Business.

name: [PARTY A]
description: ComparePowers of Attorney. Other than those powers of attorney set out in the [PARTY A]'s Disclosure Schedule, the [PARTY A] has not granted powers of attorney to any person with respect to the Business.

name: [PARTY B]
description: Compare Powers of Attorney. Other than those powers of attorney set out in the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule, the [PARTY B] has not granted powers of attorney to any person with respect to the Business.

name: Preamble
description: This [AGREEMENT NAME] is made on [AGREEMENT DATE][ (the “Effective Date”)] between [PARTY A NAME], a [CORPORATE JURISDICTION] corporation with its principal place of business at [PARTY A ADDRESS] (the "[PARTY A ABBREVIATION]") and [PARTY B NAME], [whose principal place of residence is at/a [CORPORATE JURISDICTION] corporation with its principal place of business at] [PARTY B ADDRESS] (the "[PARTY B ABBREVIATION]").

name: Preemptive Rights
description: Preemptive Rights. No holder of any class of capital stock of the Corporation has any preemptive right to purchase or subscribe toany shares of capital stock of the Corporation,any securities convertible into such shares, and any options, warrants, or rights to purchase such shares or securities convertible into any such shares.

name: Alternative 1
description: Preliminary Prospectus. No order preventing or suspending the use of any Preliminary Prospectus or any Issuer Free Writing Prospectus has been issued by the Commission, and each Preliminary Prospectus, at the time of filing thereof, conformed in all material respects to the requirements of the Act and the rules and regulations of the Commission thereunder, and did not contain an untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements therein, in the light of the circumstances under which they were made, not misleading. Provided, however, that this representation and warranty shall not apply to any statements or omissions made in reliance upon and in conformity with information furnished in writing to the Company by an Underwriter through the Representatives expressly for use.

name: Standard: each party bears own costs
description: Payment of Expenses. Each party is responsible for all costs (including legal fees) and other expenses that it incurs in connection with the negotiation and preparation of this agreement.

name: One Party Pays for Other Party
description: Compare Fees and Expenses. [PARTY A] shall pay up to [FEES AND EXPENSES CAP] of [PARTY B]'s costs (including attorneys' fees and expenses) in negotiating and preparing this agreement.

name: Standard: prime contractor determines final proposal
description: Preparation of Proposal Allocation of Responsibility Prime Contractor Responsibilities. The Prime Contractor shall take principal charge of preparing and submitting the proposal ("Proposal") in response to the RFP and management of the performance of the work entailed under any resulting contract, award, or blanket ordering agreement (BOA)/IDIQ. Subcontractor Responsibilities. The Subcontractor shall prepare those technical portions of the Proposal relating to, and perform the work entailed in, the areas described in Exhibit A, subject to the assignment of such additional responsibilities by mutual agreement between the parties. In addition to support of the formal response to the RFP, the Subcontractor agrees to respond to any further requests made by the Client in the evaluation process of the technical and/or business proposal as submitted by the Team Members. Cost Proposal. The Subcontractor shall also prepare and submit a cost proposal for the work entailed in the areas described in Exhibit A. The cost or pricing data contained therein shall be provided no later than [DATE] , in manner prescribed by the Prime Contractor so as to enable it to comply fully with the evaluation and reporting requirements in the RFP. Nothing contained herein shall be construed to require the disclosure of proprietary cost or pricing data to the Prime Contractor. Personnel Resources. Each party shall provide appropriate and high-quality personnel and use its best efforts to prepare and submit a proposal that will result in the selection of the team for the Program. The Team Members agree to jointly develop cost targets for those portions of the work to be performed by the Subcontractor so as to maximize the competitiveness of the Proposal. The Subcontractor agrees to propose costs which meet the agreed-upon targets. Issues and Concerns. The Subcontractor shall provide any exceptions, objections, comments, or other concerns it may have regarding the terms, conditions, and other requirements of the RFP, at the same time of the submission of technical and price proposal to the Prime. The Prime Contractor agrees to submit all of the Subcontractor's reasonable concerns to the Client either through written questions or through the Proposal and to make every effort to favorably resolve those concerns. In the event those concerns are not favorably resolved, however, the Subcontractor agrees nonetheless to accept in the subcontract the flowdown of all performance-related requirements as well as the flowdown of those requirements mandated by law or regulation. Notification of Changes. The Prime Contractor will keep the Subcontractor fully advised of any change, which may affect the Subcontractor's area of responsibility. The Prime Contractor, however, shall have the right to determine the final contents of the proposal. If requested by the Prime Contractor, the Subcontractor will assure the availability of management and technical personnel to assist the Prime Contractor in any discussion and negotiations with the Client. Identification of Contributions. The Proposal submitted to the Client shall contain and identify the Subcontractor's contribution to the Proposal and shall also indicate that the Prime Contractor intends to award a subcontract to the Subcontractor for the work identified as the Subcontractor's responsibility in Exhibit A hereto.

name: President
description: President. The President will have the general direction and control of the Corporation's affairs and such authority and duties as the Board of Directors may from time to time assign. The President may sign on the Corporation's behalf all documents, except where a particular document is required by law to be otherwise signed or when the signature is delegated by the Board of Directors to another officer.

name: Presumption of Assent
description: Presumption of Assent. A director of the Corporation who is present at a meeting of the Board of Directors at which action on any corporate matter is taken will be presumed to have assented to the action taken unless the director's dissent is entered in the minutes of the meeting, he or she files a written dissent to such action with the person acting as the secretary of the meeting before the adjournment, or he or she forwards the dissent by registered or certified mail to the secretary of the Corporation immediately after the adjournment of the meeting. This right to dissent does not apply to a director who voted in favor of the action.

name: Standard
description: Presumptions and Effects of Certain ProceedingsPresumption of Entitlement to Indemnity. If [PARTY B] has properly submitted a request for indemnification under this agreement,the Person empowered or selected to determine whether [PARTY B] is entitled to indemnification shall presume [PARTY B] is entitled to the requested indemnification, to the fullest extent permitted by Law, and[PARTY A] will have the burden of proof to overcome that presumption, to the fullest extent permitted by Law.Failure to Make Determination. If, within [60] Business Days after [PARTY A] receives [PARTY B]'s request for indemnification, the Person empowered or selected to determine whether [PARTY B] is entitled to indemnification does not make a determination, [PARTY B] will be deemed entitled to the requested indemnification, unless [PARTY A] shows[PARTY B]'s request for indemnification included a false or materially misleading statement, or omitted a material fact necessary to make [PARTY B]'s statement not materially misleading, orthe requested indemnification is prohibited by Law.Presumption upon Termination of Claim. [PARTY B] pleading nolo contendere, or any equivalent, to any Indemnifiable Proceeding will not on its ownadversely affect [PARTY B]'s right to indemnification,create a presumption that [PARTY B] did not act in good faith and in a manner which he or she reasonably believed to be in or not opposed to [PARTY A]'s best interests or,as to any criminal proceeding, that [PARTY B] had reasonable cause to believe that his or her conduct was unlawful.Presumption of Good Faith. For purposes of any determination of good faith, [PARTY B] will be deemed to have acted in good faith to the extent he or she relied in good faith on[PARTY A]'s[ or the Enterprise's] records or books of account, including financial statements,information supplied to him or her by [PARTY A]'s officers[, or the Enterprise's officers,] in the course of their duties,the advice of [PARTY A]'s legal counsel, Board, or counsel selected by a committee of the Board[, or the advice of the Enterprise's legal counsel, board of directors, or counsel selected by a committee of the board of directors], orinformation or records given or reports made to [PARTY A][ or the Enterprise] by an independent certified public accountant, appraiser, investment banker, or other expert selected with reasonable care by [PARTY A][, the Enterprise,] or the Board or any committee of the Board.Actions of Other Director. [PARTY B] will not be imputed with the knowledge, actions, or failure to act of any other director, officer, agent, or employee of [PARTY A] for purposes of determining the right to indemnification under this agreement.

name: Pricing
description: PricingProduct Prices. The initial prices for all Products are set forth in Schedule A. All prices are FOB [PARTY A]'s designated shipping point.Updated Price List. [PARTY A] will update its price list each calendar quarter and give notice of the updated list to [PARTY B] no later than [15] days before the end of each calendar quarter.

name: Primary Responsibility
description: [PARTY A] Primarily ResponsibleSecondary Indemnitors. [PARTY A] acknowledges that, to the extent that [PARTY B] is serving on [PARTY B]'s Board at the request or direction of a venture capital fund, other entity, or certain of its affiliates (collectively, the "Secondary Indemnitors"), [PARTY B] may have certain rights to indemnification and advancement of expenses provided by the Secondary Indemnitors.[PARTY A] Primarily Responsible for Indemnity. [PARTY A] acknowledges that, as between itself and the Secondary Indemnitors,[PARTY A] is primarily responsible for amounts required to be indemnified or advanced under its certificate of incorporation, bylaws, or this agreement, andany obligations the Secondary Indemnitors have to indemnify or advance expenses for the same amounts is secondary to [PARTY A]'s obligations.Waiver of Contribution. [PARTY A] hereby waives any right of contribution or subrogation against the Secondary Indemnitors with respect to the liabilities [PARTY A] is primarily responsible for under this section, but only to the extent this waiver does not conflict with any insurance policy providing liability or other insurance for [PARTY A], or any of its directors, trustees, general partners, managing members, officers, employees, agents, or fiduciaries[, or any other Enterprise].Subrogation of Secondary Indemnitors. If the Secondary Indemnitors pay any amounts [PARTY A] is otherwise required to indemnify or advance under its certificate of incorporation, bylaws, or this agreement, the Secondary Indemnitors will be subrogated to the extent of such payment to all of [PARTY B]'s rights of recovery for indemnification or advancement of expenses under [PARTY A]'s certificate of incorporation, bylaws, or this agreement or,to the extent subrogation is unavailable and contribution is found to be the applicable remedy, have a right to contribution in connection with the amounts paid.Third Party Beneficiaries. The Secondary Indemnitors are express third party beneficiaries of the terms of this section.

name: Principal Office
description: Principal Office. The principal office of the Corporation will be in the city of [CITY] in the state of [STATE].

name: Privacy
description: Privacy. For information about how the Company collects, uses, and shares your information, please review our Privacy Policy. You agree that, by using the Site, you consent to the collection, use, and sharing (as set forth in the Privacy Policy) of that information (including the transfer of this information to the United States or other countries for the Company's storage, processing, and use).

name: Alternative 1
description: Probation. It is understood and agreed that the first [NUMBER] days of employment shall constitute a probationary period during which period [PARTY A] may, in its absolute discretion, terminate [PARTY B]'s employment, for any reason without notice or cause.

name: Intellectual Property Security Agreement
description: Proceeds from Collateral Application of Proceeds from Collateral. The proceeds from any sale, license, lease or other transfer or monetization of [PARTY B]'s Intellectual Property included in the Collateral will be applied first, to [PARTY A]'s expenses incurred under this agreement, including from retaking, holding, storing, processing, and preparing for sale, selling, and taxes and other related costs related to the Intellectual Property, and [PARTY A]'s reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses incurred in enforcing its rights under this agreement,second, to the satisfaction of the Secured Obligations and of other payments required by Law, andthird, any remaining surplus will go to [PARTY B].[PARTY B] Liable for Deficiency. If the proceeds of the sale, license, lease, or other transfer or monetization of [PARTY B]'s Intellectual Property included in the Collateral are insufficient to fulfill [PARTY B]'s Secured Obligations, the other amounts owed under this agreement, any interest on the amounts owes, and [PARTY A]'s attorneys' fees incurred in collecting the amounts [PARTY B] owes, [PARTY B] shall be liable to [PARTY A] for that deficiency.Waiver of Damages. To the extent permitted by Law, [PARTY B] hereby waives all claims, damages, and demands against [PARTY A] arising out of the repossession, removal, retention, or sale of the Intellectual Property included in the Collateral, except for claims, damages, and demands due to [PARTY A]'s gross negligence or willful misconduct.

name: Standard
description: Activation. The Software may require you to take certain steps to activate your Software or validate your subscription. Failure to activate or register the Software, validate the subscription, or a determination by us of fraudulent or unauthorized use of the Software may result in reduced functionality, inoperability of the Software, or a termination or suspension of the subscription.

name: Product Field Actions
description: Product Field ActionsNotice to Distributor. On [PARTY A]'s notice that a Product Field Action is required, [PARTY B] shall perform that required Product Field Action according to [PARTY A]'s direction.Reimbursement for Expenses. [PARTY A] shall reimburse [PARTY B] for all reasonable and documented out-of-pocket expenses [PARTY B] incurs carrying out required Product Field Actions.

name: Product Resale, Distribution, and Supply Agreements
description: Product MaterialsMarketing and Informational Materials. [PARTY A] shall provide [PARTY B] with the marketing, promotional, and other information in English about the Products that [PARTY A] typically provides to other distributors of its Products.Regulatory Documentation. On [PARTY B]'s reasonable request, [PARTY A] shall supply [PARTY B] with all documentation [PARTY B] requires to comply with the regulatory requirements of all Governmental Authorities in the Territory.

name: Standard
description: Product ServicesMaintenance Service Requirements. For all Products, whether or not covered by warranty, [PARTY B] shall provide end users in the Territory with maintenance and similar product services.Out-of-Warranty Services. If the Product is no longer covered by warranty, [PARTY B] hereby guarantees only that these services will be of workmanlike quality for [90] days after completion.Standards. [PARTY B] shall perform all maintenance and similar product services in accordance with the requirements of [PARTY A]'s training program.

name: Profit, Loss, and Distribution
description: Profit, Loss, and DistributionsDistributions of Cash Flow. Cash flow for each taxable year of the Company will be distributed to Members in the Managers' discretion in proportion to each Member's Membership Interest.Allocation of Profit or Loss. All Profit or Loss will be allocated to the Member in the Managers' discretion in proportion to each Member's Membership Interest.Liquidation and Dissolution. If the Company is liquidated, the Company's assets wil be distributed to the Members in the Managers' discretion in proportion to each Member's Membership Interest.

name: Progress Report and Commercialization Plan
description: Progress Report and Commercialization Plan. After the end of each calendar year, the Licensee shall provide the Licensor with a Royalty Report and Commercialization Plan detailing the progress made and steps taken during the calendar year in promoting and marketing the Licensed Products.

name: Prohibited Activities
description: Prohibited Activities. No [HOST] client will engage in or permit any Prohibited Use of Services, any Prohibited Use of the Website, or any Disruptive or Abusive Activity.

name: Prohibited Activities
description: Prohibited Activities. No [HOST] client will engage in or permit any Prohibited Use of Services, any Prohibited Use of the Website, or any Disruptive or Abusive Activity.

name: Standard
description: "Prohibited Content" meansmaterial thatbreaches any applicable Laws,infringes any intellectual property or other rights of any third party, ormay give rise to any claim against us, you, or any third party,pornographic or lewd material or links to any such material, andmessages or communications thatare offensive, abusive, indecent, or obscene,are likely to cause annoyance, inconvenience, or anxiety to another internet user, orconstitute spam or bulk unsolicited mail.

name: Prohibited Uses of Content
description: Prohibited Uses of Content. [PARTY B] may not use the [PARTY A] Content for anything other than the permitted uses under section [PERMITTED USES], including that [PARTY B] may notuse [PARTY A] Content in design template applications intended for resale, whether on-line or not, including website templates, Flash templates, and brochure design templates,use [PARTY A] Content in any products for resale, license, or other distribution for profit,use any [PARTY A] Content as part of a trademark, trade name, business name, service mark, or logo,incorporate [PARTY A] Content in any product that results in a re-distribution or re-use of [PARTY A] Content, or is otherwise in any way that a person can extract, access, or reproduce [PARTY A] Content as an electronic file,use [PARTY A] Content in a fashion that [PARTY A], or any Governmental Authority or Law, reasonably considers pornographic, obscene, immoral, infringing, defamatory, or libelous, or that would be reasonably likely to bring any person or property reflected in [PARTY A] Content into disrepute,to the extent source code is contained in [PARTY A] Content, reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble any part of that source code,remove any notice of copyright, trademark or other proprietary right from [PARTY A] Content,sublicense, resell, rent, lend, assign, gift, or otherwise transfer or distribute [PARTY A] Content or [PARTY B]'s rights granted under this agreement,install or use [PARTY A] Content in more than one server location at a time, or post a copy of [PARTY A] Content on a network or web server for use by other users, unless [PARTY A] gives it written approval,use or display [PARTY A] Content in an electronic format that enables it to be downloaded or distributed via mobile devices, or shared in any peer-to-peer or similar file sharing arrangement, oreither individually or in combination with others, reproduce [PARTY A] Content, or any element of [PARTY A] Content, in excess of the quantity allowed under this agreement.

name: Standard
description: "Prohibited Use of the Services" means any use of the Servicesto host, store, send, relay, or process any Prohibited Content,for any purpose that is unlawful, fraudulent, or infringes any third party rights,in any way that may put us in breach of contractual or other obligation it owes to any internet service provider,to make available any content or service that violates this Policy,to send mass unsolicited email ("spam") to third parties, in such a way that we becomes documented on a recognized spam abuse list,to use Internet Relay Chat (including IRC clients, server software, bots, and any other IRC related software),in connection with any tortious or actionable activity, including publishing or disseminating information thatconstitutes slander, libel, or defamation,publicizes the personal information or likeness of an individual without that person's consent or otherwise violates his or her privacy rights, orthreatens individuals with bodily harm,makes harassing, offensive, indecent, obscene or abusive statements or messages, orsolicits the performance of acts or services that are illegal under applicable Law,as online backup or a storage facility,to impersonate any Person,to interfere with the enjoyment of any other Host client,to forward users to a site that, if it were hosted by us, would violate this Policy,to cause an interruption or degradation of, interference with, or disproportionate burden on the operations of our systems or the services it provides to other clients, orto attempt to do, or to assist others in doing, any of the above.

name: Commercial or Office Lease
description: Prohibited Uses of Premise. [PARTY B] will not use the Premise to store, manufacture, or sell any explosives, flammables, or any other inherently dangerous items, except for items properly stored and used only for the permitted use under paragraph [PERMITTED USE OF PREMISE][, or use the Premise as [LIST PROHIBITED USES OR BUSINESSES].

name: Broad
description: CompareProhibited Uses. [PARTY B] will not use the Premise in any way that would be hazardous, or increase the cost of or render void or voidable the insurance required under this agreement.

name: Residential Lease
description: CompareProhibited Uses of PremiseGuests. [PARTY B] may not allow anyone else to use or occupy the Premise without [PARTY A]'s written consent, except for [PARTY B]'s friends and family who use or occupy the premise as temporary guests.No Hazardous Materials. [PARTY B] will not keep on the Premises any item of a dangerous, flammable, or explosive character that might unreasonably increase the danger of fire or explosion or that a responsible insurance company might consider to be hazardous.

name: Sublease
description: CompareProhibited Use of Premise. [PARTY B] may not use the Premise for any of the purposes prohibited under section [PROHIBITED USE OF PREMISE] in the Lease Agreement.

name: Alternative 1
description: Project DescriptionPurpose. The purpose of this project is as follows: [DESCRIBE PURPOSE].Goals. The project goals are:[GOAL 1][GOAL 4][GOAL 3]

name: Project Milestones
description: Project Milestones. The Company shall complete the Website in phases as shown in Schedule A.

name: Franchise Agreement
description: AdvertisingLocal Advertising Expenses. Each month, [PARTY B] shall spend at least [MINIMUM MARKETING PERCENTAGE] percentage of its gross sales on local marketing.Document and Report Expenses. Each Accounting Period, [PARTY B] shall document and report the monthly amounts it spent on advertising during that Accounting Period.Pre-Approval of Advertising. [PARTY B] will only use advertising, marketing, and promotional materials, media, methods, campaigns, firms, and venders [PARTY A] approves of in writing.

name: Distribution Agreement
description: CompareAdvertising and ReportsAdvertising. [PARTY B] shall use reasonable efforts to advertising, promote, and sell the Products in the Territory, including, at [PARTY B]'s own expenseemploying a sufficient number of trained and qualified personnel to promote and sell the Products,maintaining a professional sales and service organization as necessary to provide training and end user service for the Products, andotherwise acting professionally and ethically in all its advertising efforts in connection with the Products.Annual Advertising PlanFirst Annual Advertising Plan. Within [60] Business Days of the Effective Date, [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] with its "Annual Advertising Plan" for the first year for [PARTY A] to review and approve or reject, which will includesales goals for the upcoming 12 month period for each Product,planned media activities in support of each Product,key opinion leaders and demographics sales and marketing efforts will be focused on, andan audit plan for end user accounts to assess Product usage.Updated Advertising Plans. At least [60] Business Days before each anniversary of the date [PARTY A] approved the first Annual Advertising Plan, [PARTY B] shall update the Annual Advertising Plan and provide [PARTY A] a copy of the updated plan.Implementation. On [PARTY A]'s approval, [PARTY B] shall implement the Annual Advertising Plan, the first plan and then each subsequently updated and approved plan.Monthly Forecast, Sales, and Advertising Reports. During the first week of each month, [PARTY B] shall provide to [PARTY A] a monthly forecast, sales, and advertising report.

name: Promotions
description: Promotions. Some users may promote competitions, promotions, prize draws, and other similar opportunities on the Site ("Third Party Competitions"). The Company is not the sponsor or promoter of these Third Party Competitions and does not bear any responsibility or liability for the actions or inactions of any third parties who organize, administer, or are otherwise involved in any of promotion of these Third Party Competitions. If you wish to participate in any of these Third Party Competitions, you are responsible for reading and ensuring that you understand the applicable rules and any eligibility requirements, and are lawfully able to participate in such Third Party Competitions in your country of residence. If you wish to run your own Third Party Competition on the Platform, you are free to do so provided you comply with our Competition Terms.

name: Property Ownership
description: Property Ownership. The [Employee / Contractor] acknowledges that all copyrights, trademarks, patents, and other intellectual property rights to works or marks arising in from or in connection with the [Employee / Contractor]'s [employment / Services], and that are within the scope of the [Employee / Contractor]'s [employment / Services], are the Company's sole and exclusive property. The [Employee / Contractor] shall not assert any such rights against the Company or any third party.

name: Explicit "Work for Hire"
description: Compare Property Ownership. The [Employee / Contractor] acknowledges that all work performed by the [Employee / Contractor] on behalf of the Company is on a "work for hire" basis. The [Employee / Contractor] assigns and transfers and, to the extent any such assignment cannot be made at present, will assign and transfer, to the Company and its successors and assigns all [Employee / Contractor]'s right, title and interest in all inventions, developments, methods, modifications, improvements, ideas, products, processes, formulae, techniques, know-how, trade secrets, and works of authorship that are created or developed by the [Employee / Contractor] on behalf of the Company during the [Employee / Contractor]'s [employment / engagement].

name: Assignment of rights; license of provider property
description: CompareIntellectual Property RightsAssignment of Intellectual Property Rights. The Client exclusively owns all Intellectual Property Rights in any intellectual property that is incorporated into any Work Product. To the extent that the Service Provider, in providing the Services, has acquired any such Intellectual Property Rights, the Service Provider hereby absolutely and irrevocably assigns those Intellectual Property Rights to the Client in perpetuity.License of Service Provider Intellectual Property. Subject to section 22.01 (Assignment of Intellectual Property Rights), the Service Provider exclusively owns and retains the interest in all Service Provider Intellectual Property. The Service Provider hereby grants to the Client, strictly for the Client's own internal business use and operations,a non-exclusive, personal, irrevocable (subject to the terms in this agreement), royalty-free, non-transferable and non-sublicensable licence to use, during the term of this agreement and the Termination Assistance Period, any Service Provider Intellectual Property embedded in any Work Product thatis expressly identified for use by the Client in any applicable Statement of Work,is used in creating or incorporated into the Services and must be used by the Client in connection with the Client's enjoyment, use or implementation of the Services,represents a Deliverable but is not the Work Product and is necessarily required for the proper functioning of the Work Product, orrepresents a Deliverable but is not a Work Product and is connected to any the Work Product, together witha perpetual, non-exclusive, personal, irrevocable, royalty-free, and non-transferable license to use the Service Provider Intellectual Property to the extent it is embedded or incorporated in any Work Product.Ownership of Work Product. The Client owns the interest in all Work Product as its exclusive property.Right to Modify. The Client may at any time modify any Service Provider Intellectual Property referred to in section 26.02 (License to Use Service Provider Intellectual Property).Waiver of Moral Rights. The Service Provider hereby expressly waives, and shall cause its employees and Approved Subcontractors to expressly waive, to the full extent permitted by law, any moral rights that it or any of them has or may have in or in connection with any Work Product.Each Party's Rights. Neither party will acquire any Intellectual Property Rights in the intellectual property of the other party except as set out in this section (Intellectual Property Rights).

name: Property Taxes
description: Property TaxesProperty Taxes. The Tenant shall pay when due all general real estate taxes and installments of special assessments applicable to the Premises.Personal Property Taxes. The Tenant shall all personal property taxes applicable to the Tenant's personal property on the Premises.

name: Proposal
description: Proposal. The terms of any proposal shall be effective for 30 days after presentation to the Customer. If the Customer does not execute this Agreement within that time, the proposal, along with any related documents, shall be subject to amendment.

name: Alternative 1
description: Proposal OverviewBackground. [COMPANY NAME], a [DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS], is accepting proposals in response to this Request for Proposal (this “RFP,” or this “Request for Proposal”) in order to find a qualified source to provide [DESCRIPTION OF PRODUCT OR SERVICE].Objective. The objective of this Request for Proposal is to locate a source that will provide the best overall value to [COMPANY NAME]. While price is a significant factor, other criteria will form the basis of our award decision, as more fully described in the Evaluation Factors section of this Request for Proposal below.

name: Alternative 1
description: Proposal RequirementsNotification. Bidders intending to submit a proposal should notify the representative identified on the cover page no later than [DATE].Qualifications. The [COMPANY NAME] will accept proposals only from qualified bidders. Bidders mustlist at least [NUMBER] projects that are substantially similar to this project as part of their response,provide references for each project, andsubmit representative examples of work.Technical Proposal. A technical proposal must be provided that is not more than [NUMBER] pages. This technical proposal must provide an overview of the proposed solution as well as resumes of all key personnel performing the work. In addition, the technical proposal should provide a proposed schedule and milestones, as applicable.Price Proposal. A price proposal must be provided that is not more than [NUMBER] pages. This price proposal should indicate the overall fixed price for the project as well as hourly rates and an estimated total number of hours, should [COMPANY NAME] decide to award a contract on an hourly rate basis.Authorization. Proposals must be signed by a representative that is authorized to commit bidder’s company.

name: Provide Content In A Suitable Format
description: Provide Content in a Suitable Format. The Customer shall provide content in a format suitable to be included in the Website.

name: Standard
description: Provision of SystemsOnly for Internal Use. [PARTY B] shall use the Systems only for its internal use[, not to supply any consulting, support, or training services to any third-party].Cooperation ObligationsMutual Cooperation. The parties shall cooperate with each other to facilitate [PARTY A]'s provision of the Systems to [PARTY B][PARTY B]'s Cooperation Obligations. As part of [PARTY B]'s obligation to cooperate under section [MUTUAL COOPERATION] directly above, on [PARTY A]'s reasonable request, [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] with the materials, resources, information, data, access, support, and other cooperation necessary for [PARTY A] to provide the Systems to [PARTY B].Additional Systems. If [PARTY B] requests, and [PARTY B] agrees to provide, additional Systems, the parties shall cooperate to sign one or more additional [Systems Order], listing the additional Systems [PARTY A] will provide, and the additional fees [PARTY B] will pay.

name: Provisions Relating to Parachute Payments
description: Provisions Relating To Parachute Payments. If payments and benefits to or for the benefit of the Executive, whether under this agreement or otherwise, would result in total Parachute Payments having a value equal to or greater than 100% of the Parachute Payment Limit, the Executive may elect to reduce the amount payable under the section related to Bonus Payments so that the value of all Parachute Payments to the Executive, whether or not made under this agreement, is equal to the Parachute Payment Limit minus $1.00.

name: Proxies
description: Proxies. At all meetings of stockholders, a stockholder may vote by a written proxy signed by the stockholder or by its duly authorized attorney in fact. The proxy must be filed with the Secretary before or at the beginning of the meeting, before the call to order.

name: Proxy Resignation
description: Proxy Resignation. A Proxy may at any time resign by submitting a resignation in writing to the Company, with notice to the Shareholder. The Proxy's resignation will be effective on the date of resignation stated in the notice of resignation. No formal acceptance of the resignation is necessary to make the resignation effective. Upon resignation, the Proxy's obligations and responsibilities under this agreement are at an end.

name: Standard
description: PublicationsCopies of Proposed Publications. [PARTY B] shall provide [PARTY A] with copies of any proposed publication or presentation at least [three] months in advance of the submission of the proposed publication or presentation to a journal, editor, or other third party.Review Period. [PARTY A] will have [three] months after receipt of the materials to object to the proposed presentation or publication, because there is patentable or potentially patentable subject matter that needs protection.[PARTY A]'s Objection. If [PARTY A] does makes an objection, [PARTY B] shall refrain from publishing or presenting the materials for [three] months from date of its receipt of [PARTY A]’s objection.No Response from [PARTY A]. If [PARTY A] does not respond to [PARTY B]’s submission of materials for its review for [three] months, [PARTY B] may proceed to publish or present these materials.[PARTY A] Information. [PARTY B] will not, without [PARTY A]’s prior written consent, publish or present any information that [PARTY A] has supplied to [PARTY B] in connection with the [DELIVERABLE].Publication after End of Research. [PARTY B] may publish or present any material relating to the [DELIVERABLE] [six] months after the date of submission of the final report referred to in section [RESEARCH WORK] or the date of termination of this agreement, as applicable.

name: Consent Required; Cooperation; No Unreasonable Delay
description: PublicityConsent. Neither party will use the other party's name, logo, or trademarks, or issue any press release or public announcement regarding this agreement, without the other party's written consent, unless specifically permitted under this agreement or required by Law.Cooperation. The parties will cooperate to draft all appropriate press releases and other public announcements relating to the subject matter of this agreement and the relationship between the parties.No Unreasonable Delay. The parties will not unreasonably withhold or delay their consent to press releases or public announcements.

name: Joint Initial Release
description: ComparePublicity. The parties will issue an initial joint press release mutually agreed upon by the parties, and will not issue any other announcement without the other party's prior written consent, which will not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

name: Joint Communications Plan
description: ComparePublicity The parties will use reasonable efforts to develop a joint communications plan with respect to the subject matter of this agreement. Each party will use reasonable efforts to ensure that all press releases and other public statements in connection with the transactions contemplated by this agreement will be consistent with the joint communications plan.

name: Permitted use of logos and initial press release
description: ComparePublicityUse of Logos. [PARTY B] hereby grants [PARTY A] a non-exclusive, non-transferrable, non-sublicensable, and royalty-free license to use and reproduce [PARTY B]'s name, logos, and trademarks on [PARTY A]'s customer lists, advertising, and website.Press Releases. After the Effective Date, [PARTY A] may issue a high-level press release announcing the parties relationship and transactions under this agreement.

name: Unilateral prohibition
description: Compare Publicity. [PARTY B] cannot use [PARTY A]'s name of any advertising or publicity, or make any news release, public announcement, denial or confirmation of the Order, or any part or any phase of the Order.

name: Permitted use of logos
description: CompareUse of Logos. [PARTY B] hereby grants [PARTY A] a non-exclusive, non-transferrable, non-sublicensable, and royalty-free license to use and reproduce [PARTY B]'s name, logos, and trademarks on [PARTY A]'s customer lists, advertising, and website.

name: Asset Purchase Agreement
description: Sale and Purchase of Purchased AssetsObligations at the Closing. Subject to the terms and conditions of this agreement:The [PARTY B] hereby agrees to sell, assign, transfer and deliver to the [PARTY A] at the Closing the Purchased Assets.The [Party A] hereby agrees to purchase and accept from the [PARTY B] at the Closing the Purchased Assets.Purchased Assets Definition. The "Purchased Assets" means all of [PARTY B]'s right, title and interest in and to the all of the assets and rights of [PARTY B] used in the Business, including without limitation the following assets (collectively, the "Purchased Assets"):All customer and supplier lists, customer and supplier files, and related accounts;All rights under:Customer contracts and purchase orders, whether oral or written, as listed in the [SECTION] of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule (the "Customer Contracts"); andAll other contracts, agreements and licenses, whether oral or written, and works in process, as listed in the [SECTION] of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule (together, the contracts described in this subsection and the Customer Contracts are collectively referred to as the "Assumed Contracts");All Purchased Intellectual Property, as defined in the [INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY REPRESENTATION] below, of the [PARTY B], as listed in the [SECTION] of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule;All leases of tangible personal property and all leases of real property listed in the [SECTION] of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule (collectively, the "Assumed Leases");All machinery, equipment, furniture, trade fixtures, furnishing, vehicles, leasehold improvements and other tangible personal property including without limitation, all artwork, desks, chairs, tables, copiers, telephone lines and numbers, facsimile machines and other telecommunication equipment, cubicles and miscellaneous office furnishings and supplies and computer and computer-related hardware, including without limitation computers, file servers, facsimile servers, scanners, color printers, laser printers and networks;To the extent transferable, all permits, authorizations and governmental licenses;All of the [PARTY B]'s outstanding accounts receivable as of the Closing Date, summarized in the [SECTION] of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule (collectively, the "Accounts Receivable");All deposits and prepaid expenses as set forth in the [SECTION] of the [PARTY B]'s Disclosure Schedule;To the extent assignable, all of the [PARTY B]'s rights under all third-party manufacturing warranties relating to any of the Purchased Assets;All insurance proceeds, claims and causes of action existing as of the Closing Date and relating to the Purchased Assets;All cash, including but not limited to petty cash, money-market, checking, savings and similar type accounts, and cash equivalents of the [PARTY B];All of the [PARTY B]'s books, records, files and papers relating to the Purchased Assets or the conduct of the Business at any time prior to the Closing;All goodwill associated with the Business and the Purchased Assets; andAny and all other properties, assets, rights and privileges of the [PARTY B] which are used in the Business and not expressly described, listed or referred to in the [EXCLUDED ASSETS SUBCLAUSE] below.

name: Stock Purchase Agreement
description: CompareSale and Purchase of Purchased AssetsObligations at the Closing. Subject to the terms and conditions of this agreement:The [PARTY B] hereby agrees to sell, assign, transfer and deliver to the [PARTY A] at the Closing the Shares.The [PARTY A] hereby agrees to purchase and accept from the [PARTY B] at the Closing the Shares.The Shares Definition. The "Shares" means [AMOUNT OF [PARTY B'S COMMON STOCK] of the [PARTY B]'s common stock.

name: Purchase and Supply
description: Purchase and SupplySupply. Supplier agrees to supply to Purchaser the amount of the Items set forth on purchase orders submitted by Purchaser.Orders Content of Orders. An Order mustidentify the Items requested,state the quantity, date, time, mode and place of delivery, and state the price of the Items requested.Acceptance/Rejection of Orders. The Supplier shall promptly communicate its acceptance or rejection of an Order. Any notice of rejection shall state the specific grounds for such rejection. In all events, any objection by Supplier to the terms of an Order shall be deemed waived upon the Supplier's delivery of Items.Order Adjustments. The Supplier acknowledges that the Purchaser may be required to modify Orders from time to time.ForecastsForecast. During the Term, the Purchaser shall provide the Supplier with a [FORECAST PERIOD MONTH] month written forecast, which will be updated no less frequently than every [quarter/six months] on a rolling [six/twelve] month basis, of the Purchaser's monthly anticipated requirements of the Items over the next [FORECAST PERIOD MONTH] months from the date of the forecast.Binding Forecasts. The first [BINDING PERIOD] months of each such forecast will represent a binding commitment that the Purchaser intends to order the forecasted amount from the Supplier during that period.Non-Binding Forecasts. The quantities indicated for the remaining [NON BINDING PERIOD] months of the forecast will be made to assist the Supplier in planning its items and the Purchaser in planning its sales, and will be non-binding.[Order Minimum. The minimum order quantity in a single purchase order for any quarterly forecast period will be [MINIMUM ORDER QUANTITY].]Requirements. All Items supplied under this agreement will be manufactured by the Supplier in accordance with the Requirements. The Supplier will use a documented system of procedures for the control of changes to the Requirements. Any significant changes will be reviewed and approved by both parties prior to implementation.

name: Pro-Purchaser
description: ComparePurchase and SupplyPerformance. Supplier agrees to manufacture, sell and distribute Items manufactured in accordance with the Requirements pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Supply Agreement.Supply Requirements. Supplier recognizes the importance of a reliable source of supply of Items.Supplier shall maintain levels of inventory of Items based upon current and future demands of Purchaser and the Purchaser Distributors during the Term of this Supply Agreement.Supplier agrees that it will manufacture and sell sufficient Items to meet forecasts for such Items as provided by Purchaser upon entering into this Supply Agreement with minimum manufacturing requirements per flavor as set forth in Schedule IV.Supplier acknowledges that the Items may contain markings exclusive to Purchaser and Supplier is granted a limited license during the Term to distribute the Items in accordance with the terms of this Supply Agreement.Supplier will not adopt or use any proprietary markings in any manner whatsoever except as authorized by Purchaser. In order to preserve the proprietary nature of such markings on the Items, Supplier shall not distribute any Items that contain such markings to any parties other than Purchaser and Purchaser Distributors.Supplier agrees that all Items that contain markings will be sold to Purchaser and Purchaser Distributors on a first in first out basis. Supplier also recognizes that Purchaser may alter the Requirements for the Items from time to time. Supplier shall provide Purchaser with proofs of Items incorporating the Requirements for approval by Purchaser prior to production of any Items. Supplier shall not manufacture final Items until it receives signed and dated approval by Purchaser for all proofs of the Items.Defective Items. If there are any defects in any Items or their packaging or if Supplier fails to follow the Requirements, then Purchaser shall have the right, immediately and at its sole option, to withdraw such Items from the Purchaser Distributors. Purchaser shall notify Supplier of such withdrawal, and Supplier shall immediately cease distribution of such Items. If directed by Purchaser, Supplier shall recall or reacquire any defective Items. If any recall is caused by technical defects in Requirements, then Purchaser or Purchaser Distributors shall reimburse Supplier for the expenses incident to the recall. Conversely, if the recall is caused by Supplier, then Supplier shall bear its total expenses of such recall and reimburse Purchaser or Purchaser Distributors for any expenses they may have incurred.Failure to Supply. Supplier and Purchaser recognize that the Items are unique and Purchaser will not have the ability to substitute the Items with like goods from the marketplace. Therefore, in the event of a Shortage, other than a Shortage caused by ordering errors of Purchaser or Purchaser Distributors, then Supplier shall provide comparable Items from Supplier's Inventories to the extent that Supplier is unable to supply such Items and the price of the comparable goods shall be equal to Supplier's cost. Such price shall not Include any additional expenses incurred by Supplier. Supplier shall pay any additional expenses that may be necessary to distribute the substitute goods in accordance with the original order for the Items (e.g., expedited shipping costs).Orders Content of Orders. An Order shallidentify the Items requested,state the quantity, date, time, mode and place of delivery, and state the price of the Items requested.Acceptance/Rejection of Orders. Supplier shall promptly communicate its acceptance or rejection of an Order. Any notice of rejection shall state the specific grounds for such rejection. In all events, any objection by Supplier to the terms of an Order shall be deemed waived upon Supplier's delivery of Items.Order Adjustments. Supplier acknowledges that Purchaser may be required to modify Orders from time to time.Forecasts. Upon signature of this agreement, the Purchaser shall supply Supplier with a nonbinding, rolling forecast for the Items to be purchased during the Term of this Supply Agreement. The Supplier shall maintain sufficient inventory levels to meet the fluctuations of demands for the Items with Requirements.

name: Standard
description: Purchase Orders and Statements of WorkUse of Standard Form. [PARTY B] shall submit each order for Equipment or Services on [PARTY A]'s standard form, an example of which is attached to this agreement on [ATTACHMENT] (each one, a "Purchase Order").Contents of Purchase Order. [PARTY B] shall include in each Purchase Order each item requested, it's price, and product number,the quantity of each item requested, andthe time, date, mode, and location for delivery.Acceptance or Rejection of OrderWritten Notice of Decision. Within [five] Business Days of receiving a Purchase Order, [PARTY A] shall accept or reject that Purchase Order by giving written notice to [PARTY B].Contents of Rejection. [PARTY A] shall include in its notice of rejection the specific grounds for making the rejection, including any objections to Purchase Order.Execution of Statements of Work. If [PARTY A] accepts a Purchase Order, the parties shall cooperate to execute a binding statement of work, specifically describing the Equipment and Services to be provided, prices owed, and timetable for performance (each one, a "Statement of Work").

name: Asset Purchase Agreement
description: Consideration for the Purchased AssetsThe Purchase Price and Assumed Liabilities. The aggregate value for the Purchased Assets is the Purchase Price, plus the assumption of the Assumed Liabilities.Purchase Price Definition. The "Purchase Price" comprises the following:cash in the amount of $[DOLLAR AMOUNT] [;[the issuance of [NUMBER OF SHARES IN THE BUYER] shares of newly issued common stock of the [PARTY A] (to be adjusted for forward or reverse splits occurring after the date of this agreement);[NOTES];[LOANS AND LIABILITIES OWED TO THE BUYER]; and[OTHER RIGHTS OF THE BUYER OR OTHER FORMS OF CONSIDERATION THE BUYER MAY TRANSFER]].

name: Stock Purchase Agreement
description: CompareConsideration for the SharesThe Purchase Price. The Purchase Price is the aggregate amount of consideration for the Shares.Purchase Price Definition. The "Purchase Price" means cash in the amount of $[PURCHASE PRICE AMOUNT].

name: Domain Name Transfer
description: ComparePurchase Price. As consideration for [PARTY A]'s sale and transfer of the [DELIVERABLE], [PARTY B] shall pay [PARTY A] $[PURCHASE PRICE] (the "Purchase Price").

name: Purchase Agreement
description: Sale Obligation. [PARTY A] will sell to [PARTY B] the [SHORT DESCRIPTION OF DELIVERABLE], as further defined in the [PURCHASE ORDER] attached to this agreement (the "[DELIVERABLE]").

name: License Grant
description: CompareLicenseLicense Grant. [PARTY A] hereby grants to [PARTY B] [a non-exclusive / an exclusive], [irrevocable / revocable], [sub-licensable / non-sub-licensable] license[, as further described in [ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement,] (the "[DELIVERABLE]") touse the Licensed Intellectual Property on and in connection with the [Licensed Goods / Licensed Software / Licensed Method] in the Licensed Territory (including on packaging, promotional, and advertising materials), andmake, use, sell, distribute, and advertise the [Licensed Goods / Licensed Software / Licensed Method] in the Licensed Territory.No Other Rights. [PARTY A] reserves for itself all other rights and interest not explicitly granted under this agreement.Definitions[Licensed Goods / Licensed Software / Licensed Method]. "[Licensed Goods / Licensed Software / Licensed Method]" means the [goods / software / methods] incorporating or otherwise based on the Licensed Intellectual Property, as listed in [ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement.Licensed Intellectual Property. "Licensed Intellectual Property" means the intellectual property listed in [ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement.Licensed Territory. "Licensed Territory" means [[DESCRIBE LICENSED TERRITORY] / the territory listed in [ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement].

name: Standard Services Agreement
description: CompareServices Obligation. [PARTY B] shall perform the [SHORT DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES] services for [PARTY A] (the "Work Product")], as described in [ATTACHMENT], attached to this agreement (the "[DELIVERABLE]").

name: Basic Employment Agreement

name: Investment Bank Engagement Letter
description: CompareServices[PARTY B]'s Services. As [PARTY A]'s exclusive financial advisor, [PARTY B] shall provide  financial and logistical services and advice to [PARTY A] and assist its management, legal counsel, accountants, and other advisors in connection with the Contemplated Transaction and related issues, including, as necessary or reasonably requested by [PARTY A], including the following.Study Operations. [PARTY B] shall study and review the business, operations, and historical financial performance of [PARTY A] (based upon management’s forecast of financial performance) so as to enable [PARTY B] to provide advice to [PARTY A].Understand Business Needs. [PARTY B] shall build an understanding of [PARTY A]'s business strategy, competitive landscape, financial history, and future projections, funding needs, proposed use of the funds (if they are obtained), and related matters.Formulate Strategy. [PARTY B] shall assist [PARTY A] in attempting to formulate the best strategy to meet [PARTY A]'s working capital and capital resource needs.Prepare Business Plan. [PARTY B] shall prepare a business plan that includes an executive summary, summary of strategic vision, financial history, projections, use of funding, executive biographies, and other information as needed.List of Potential Investors. [PARTY B] shall cultivate a list of targeted potential investors from publicly available angel investor sources and its own professional contacts.Introductions to Lenders and Investors. [PARTY B] shall introduce [PARTY A] to potential lenders of funds as well as to potential investors (whether the potential investment is in the form of debt or equity financing, or some combination of debt and equity).Structure Transactions. [PARTY B] shall assist in the formulation of the terms and structure of any Contemplated Transaction.Present Contemplated Transactions. [PARTY B] shall assist in the presentation to the Board of any Contemplated Transaction.Recommend Professional Connections. [PARTY B] shall recommend other professionals (attorneys, accountants, industry specialists) on an as needed basis.Additional Investment Banking Services. [PARTY B] shall provide other financial advisory and investment banking services in connection with any conversions, offerings, exchanges, or other aspects of a Contemplated Transaction as may be agreed upon by the parties.[PARTY A]'s Acknowledgment Regarding Completed Transactions. description: CompareIntegration ServicesScope of ServicesServices Described in Task Orders. Either party may request to change or supplement any of the Services under this agreement by submitting a change order to the other party, including any changes to the schedule, budget, Deliverables, or Acceptance Criteria), on the form attached to this agreement on [ATTACHMENT]. Change Orders Effective When Signed. A change order will only be effective and the proposed changes binding on the parties when the change order is signed by each party. Deliverable Acceptance ProcessInitial Delivery. [PARTY B] shall deliver each completed Deliverable on or before the applicable due date listed in the applicable TO.Initial Acceptance Period. On delivery, [PARTY A] may have [ACCEPTANCE PERIOD DAYS] Business Days to accept or reject the Deliverable, based on the Acceptance Criteria established for that Deliverable in the applicable TO.Rejection. [PARTY A] may reject a Deliverable for failing to meet the Acceptance Criteria by providing [PARTY B] written notice before the end of the acceptance period and specifying the basis of the rejection.Remedy and Re-Deliver Non-Complying Deliverables. If [PARTY A] notifies [PARTY B] that [PARTY A] has rejected the Deliverable, [PARTY B] shall remedy the failure and re-deliver the Deliverable within [CURE PERIOD] Business Days after receiving [PARTY A]'s noticeAcceptance of Re-Delivery. On delivery of the remedied Deliverable, [PARTY A] may have [ACCEPTANCE PERIOD DAYS] Business Says to accept or reject the Deliverable, based on the requirements and acceptance criteria for that Deliverable, as described above.Termination for Repeated Failure. If [PARTY A] rejects remedied Deliverables, [PARTY A] may terminate this agreement or the applicable TO.Deemed Acceptance. If [PARTY A] does not reject a Deliverable in writing within the acceptance period, [PARTY A] will be deemed to have accepted that Deliverable at the expiration of the acceptance period.

name: Purpose
description: 2. Purpose. The purpose of this Non-Disclosure Agreement is to define the conditions under which confidential information will be disclosed between the Parties in connection with [PURPOSE OF DISCLOSURE].

name: PURPOSE AND INTENT
description: II. PURPOSE AND INTENT 1. The mutual promises and representations herein are deemed by each Party hereto to be good and sufficient consideration for this Agreement. 2. The intent and objective of this Agreement is to facilitate sharing of Covered Data for Permitted Purposes. Covered Data to be shared pursuant to this Agreement is to be treated as confidential, business sensitive, and potentially harmful to competition if inappropriately disseminated. Any recipient of Covered Data agrees, both as a condition to its right to receive Covered Data under this Agreement and as a contractual obligation under this Agreement, to treat any Covered Data received herein as follows: a. The Covered Data is to be kept in strict confidence and protected from public or other unpermitted disclosure; b. The Covered Data is to be used solely for the Permitted Purposes; and c. The Covered Data is not to be used, or made available for use, in Merchant/Market Function activities as defined herein, except as permitted by the FERC Standards of Conduct. 3. Nothing in this Agreement shall be understood to authorize: a. The sharing of information where prohibited by the FERC Standards of Conduct; b. The release of Critical Energy Infrastructure Information or Critical Infrastructure Information; c. The release of information where release is prohibited or limited by the North American Electric Reliability Corporation Reliability Standards; or d. The release of information where release is prohibited or limited by another agreement or any other applicable law or regulation.

Neither the [PARTY B], nor any other party to such lease, is in default under any lease.Will Remain Valid. All leases of leased real property will remain valid and binding in accordance with their terms following the Closing.Copies. The [PARTY B] has delivered to the [PARTY A] a copy of each lease with respect to any leased real property, and any and all amendments to the leases.No Owned Property. The [PARTY B] does not own[, and has never owned,] any real property.

name: [PARTY A]
description: CompareReal PropertyLeased Property. The [PARTY A]'s Disclosure Schedule correctly lists all of the [PARTY A]'s leased real property.Marketable. The [PARTY A] has good and marketable leasehold title to all leased real property, free and clear of all Encumbrances[ (except Permitted Encumbrances)].No Default. Neither the [PARTY A], nor any other party to such lease, is in default under any lease.Will Remain Valid. All leases of leased real property will remain valid and binding in accordance with their terms following the Closing.Copies. The [PARTY A] has delivered to the [PARTY B] a copy of each lease with respect to any leased real property, and any and all amendments to the leases.No Owned Property. The [PARTY A] does not own[, and has never owned,] any real property.

name: [PARTY A] — Robust
description: CompareReal Property and Tangible AssetsOwnership of Real Property. Except as would not materially and adversely affect the value, operation, and use of the real property, the [PARTY A] or one of its Subsidiaries owns good and marketable fee simple title or has valid leasehold title (as applicable) to:the material real properties owned by the [PARTY A] or its Subsidiaries as of the date of this agreement (the "[PARTY A] Owned Real Property"); andthe material leases, subleases, licenses, or other occupancies to which the [PARTY A] or its Subsidiaries is a party as tenant for real property as of the date of this agreement (the "[PARTY A] Real Property Leases", together with the [PARTY A] Owned Real Property, the "[PARTY A] Real Property") and other tangible assets reflected on the [PARTY A] Balance Sheet Date, in each case, free and clear of all Encumbrances, except for:Permitted Encumbrances; andfor the property and assets that have been disposed of since the [PARTY A] Balance Sheet Date in the ordinary course of business consistent with past practice. No Default. Except as would not have a [PARTY A] Material Adverse Effect, here is not under any [PARTY A] Real Property Lease:any existing default by the [PARTY A] or any of its Subsidiaries or, to the knowledge of the [PARTY A], any other party thereto; orto the [PARTY A]'s knowledge, any condition or event that, with notice or lapse of time, or both, would constitute a material default under the provisions of such [PARTY A] Real Property Lease. List of Real Property. The [PARTY A] Disclosure Schedule contains a correct list of the:[PARTY A] Owned Real Property, including the owner thereof; andeach material [PARTY A] Real Property Lease. No Legal Proceedings Related to Real Property. To the [PARTY A]'s knowledge, there is no pending or threatened condemnation proceeding with respect to any of the [PARTY A] Owned Real Property or any material [PARTY A] Real Property Lease.

name: [PARTY B] — Robust
description: CompareReal Property and Tangible AssetsOwnership of Real Property. Except as would not materially and adversely affect the value, operation, and use of the real property, the [PARTY B] or one of its Subsidiaries owns good and marketable fee simple title or has valid leasehold title (as applicable) to:the material real properties owned by the [PARTY B] or its Subsidiaries as of the date of this agreement (the "[PARTY B] Owned Real Property"); andthe material leases, subleases, licenses, or other occupancies to which the [PARTY B] or its Subsidiaries is a party as tenant for real property as of the date of this agreement (the "[PARTY B] Real Property Leases", together with the [PARTY B] Owned Real Property, the "[PARTY B] Real Property") and other tangible assets reflected on the [PARTY B] Balance Sheet Date, in each case, free and clear of all Encumbrances, except for:Permitted Encumbrances; andfor the property and assets that have been disposed of since the [PARTY B] Balance Sheet Date in the ordinary course of business consistent with past practice. No Default. Except as would not have a [PARTY B] Material Adverse Effect, here is not under any [PARTY B] Real Property Lease:any existing default by the [PARTY B] or any of its Subsidiaries or, to the knowledge of the [PARTY B], any other party thereto; orto the [PARTY B]'s knowledge, any condition or event that, with notice or lapse of time, or both, would constitute a material default under the provisions of such [PARTY B] Real Property Lease. List of Real Property. The [PARTY B] Disclosure Schedule contains a correct list of the:[PARTY B] Owned Real Property, including the owner thereof; andeach material [PARTY B] Real Property Lease. No Legal Proceedings Related to Real Property. To the [PARTY B]'s knowledge, there is no pending or threatened condemnation proceeding with respect to any of the [PARTY B] Owned Real Property or any material [PARTY B] Real Property Lease.

name: Resale, Distribution, and Supply Agreements
description: Recalls. [PARTY B] will promptly comply with any recalls of the Product issued by [PARTY A] or any applicable governmental authority.

name: Low Requirements for Disclosure
description: Use of DataPurpose. [PARTY B] shall use or disclose the Data only in furtherance of the Project or as required by Law.Standard of Care. [PARTY B] shall exercise at least the same degree of care as it uses with its own data and Confidential Information, but in no event less than reasonable care, to protect the Data from misuse and unauthorized access or disclosure.Safeguards Around Data. [PARTY B] shall use appropriate safeguards to protect the Data from misuse and unauthorized access or disclosure, includingmaintaining adequate physical controls and password protections for any server or system on which the Data is stored,ensuring that Data is not stored on any mobile device (for example, a laptop or smartphone) or transmitted electronically unless encrypted, andtaking any other measures reasonably necessary to prevent any use or disclosure of the Data other than as allowed under this agreement.Personal Information. [PARTY B] will not attempt to identify any Person whose information is contained in any Data or attempt to contact those Persons.Permitted Disclosure. [PARTY B] may disclose the Data onlyto the extent necessary, andto its officers, directors, employees, consultants, and representatives on a need-to-know basis.Required Disclosure. If [PARTY B] is compelled by Law to disclose any Data, [PARTY B] shall notify [PARTY A] before disclosing the compelled Data.Unauthorized DisclosureReport. Within [three] days of [PARTY B] becoming aware of any unauthorized use or disclosure of the Data, [PARTY B] shall promptly report that unauthorized use or disclosure to [PARTY A].Cooperation and Mitigation. [PARTY B] shall cooperate with any remediation that [PARTY A], in its discretion, determines is necessary toaddress any applicable reporting requirements, andmitigate any effects of such unauthorized use or disclosure of the Data, including measures necessary to restore goodwill with stakeholders, including research subjects, collaborators, governmental authorities, and the public.Agents and Subcontractors. [PARTY B] shall ensure that any agents, including subcontractors, to whom it provides the Data agree to the same restrictions and conditions listed in this agreement.No Modification of Data. [PARTY B] shall not copy, decompile, modify, reverse engineer, or create derivative works out of any of the Data.

name: High Requirements for Disclosure

[PARTY B] shall exercise at least the same degree of care as it uses with its own data and Confidential Information, but in no event less than reasonable care, to protect the Data from misuse and unauthorized access or disclosure.Safeguards Around Data. [PARTY B] will not attempt to identify any Person whose information is contained in any Data or attempt to contact those Persons.Permitted Disclosure. [PARTY B] may disclose the Dataonly if and to the extent [PARTY A] consents in writing to the disclosure, andto [PARTY A]'s officers, directors, employees, or Affiliates, whoneed-to-know the Data in furtherance of the Project,have been informed of the obligations of this agreement, and agree to abide and be bound by the provisions this agreement.Required Disclosure. If [PARTY B] is compelled by Law to disclose any Data it shallprovide [PARTY A] with prompt written notice so that [PARTY A] may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy and/or waive compliance with the provisions of this agreement,cooperate with [PARTY A] to obtain a protective order or other appropriate remedy, andif the parties cannot obtain a protective order, other appropriate remedy, or otherwise fail to quash the legal process requiring disclosure, [PARTY B] will disclose the requested Data only to the extent necessary to satisfy the request.Unauthorized DisclosureReport. Within [three] days of [PARTY B] becoming aware of any unauthorized use or disclosure of the Data, [PARTY B] shall promptly report that unauthorized use or disclosure to [PARTY A].Cooperation and Mitigation. [PARTY B] shall ensure that any agents, including subcontractors, to whom it provides the Data agree to the same restrictions and conditions listed in this agreement.No Modification of Data. [PARTY B] shall not copy, decompile, modify, reverse engineer, or create derivative works out of any of the Data.
